Tab Benoit LIVE with Jeff McCarty and Eric Johanson: The Whiskey Bayou Records Revue

Tuesday, March 13, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
950234108465476

Tab Benoit LIVE with Jeff McCarty and Eric Johanson: The Whiskey Bayou Records Revue

Tuesday, March 13, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Tab Benoit's Whiskey Bayou Records Revue feat. Jeff McCarty and Eric Johanson at The Haunt on 3/13!! 7:00pm Doors 8:00pm Show Tab Benoit http://www.tabbenoit.com/ Eric Johanson and Jeff McCarty both released CDs on Tab Benoit's Whiskey Bayou Records Revue in 2017. Jeff McCarty is a southern soul singer whose Louisiana musical roots run deep into the soulful Blues Rock genre. Eric Johanson has played guitar for Cyril Neville and Terrence Simeon. He's learned first hand from those two musical legends about rhythm through the many unique styles of Louisiana music.. In August WBR releaed Jeff McCarty's Step Out. Jeff hit the road playing local and short tours with Josh Garrett the Midwest. On October 13, 2017 WBR released Eric Johanson's Burn It Down which Eric followed up by aupporting a string of Tab Benoit through the Midwest and east-coast. Whiskey Bayou Records is proud to present these two soulfully unique breakout Artist.

Troy Millette Solo

Wednesday, March 14, 2018

7:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
364215810655768

Troy Millette Solo

Wednesday, March 14, 2018 7:00PM - Wednesday, March 14, 2018 9:00PM

7-9pm All Ages // Free Free pool 5-9pm! ~~~~~~~~~~~ Troy Millette Music Heart, humor, and humility are keys to success for Fairfax singer/songwriter Troy Millette, whose energetic live performances have earned him a reputation as one of Vermont‚Äôs must-see artists. Drawing from a wide array of contemporary and retro cover tunes, as well as a vast catalogue of original material, his sets are sure to entertain music-lovers of all types. Over the past several years Millette has continued to hone his craft playing across Vermont and upstate New York. As a result of his talent and determination, Millette has shared the stage with some of the most talented names in the business including local favorites Madaila and Kat Wright & the Indomitable Soul Band, as well as national recording artists such as Atlantic Records Oh Honey!, country music balladeer Jamie Lee Thurston, and Noah Guthrie of the hit FOX Television series ‚Äòglee‚Äô.

Weird Al Yankovic: Ill-Advised Vanity Tour

Wednesday, March 14, 2018

8:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
1651758548214028

Weird Al Yankovic: Ill-Advised Vanity Tour

Wednesday, March 14, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Weird Al Yankovic: Ill-Advised Vanity Tour Wednesday, March 14th 2018 8:00pm showtime. ‚ÄúWeird Al‚Äù Yankovic burst onto the scene over three decades ago and never looked back. For the first time in his storied career, the world‚Äôs foremost musical satirist and four-time Grammy-winner foregoes his usual high-octane, big-production show for an intimate evening of music, focusing on original (non-parody) songs from his 14-album catalog. After his 2016 world tour, including venues such as the Hollywood Bowl and Radio City Music Hall, this is a rare opportunity to get up-close and personal with this legendary performer. Weird Al‚Äôs most recent album Mandatory Fun was the first comedy album in history to debut at #1 on the Billboard Top 200 chart. In 2018 he will be awarded a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

Goose wsg Ocular Panther at Flour City Station | Rochester, NY

Thursday, March 15, 2018

9:00PM

Flour City Station

Rochester, NY

9
2014527808871566

Goose wsg Ocular Panther at Flour City Station | Rochester, NY

Thursday, March 15, 2018 9:00PM - Friday, March 16, 2018 1:00AM

Goose hits Flour City Station in Rochester, NY w/ Ocular Panther on Thursday March 15th! Get ready for a flockin' good time! GOOSE: Goose is a Funk-Folk band based out of Norwalk, Connecticut. Rick Mitarotonda is the guitarist-singer-songwriter whose folky, hummable melodies are supported by Peter Anspach on guitar/keys, and a deep-pocket rhythm section of Trevor Weekz on Bass, Ben Atkind on drums, and Aaron Hagele on percussion. The band‚Äôs music is both memorable and danceable; an organic and easy-to-love mix of funk and contemporary folk, with touches of reggae, jazz, blues, and rock. Tracked in a snowbound lakeside New Hampshire cabin, with mixing and mastering at the Factory Underground in Norwalk, CT, Goose‚Äôs debut album ‚ÄòMoon Cabin‚Äô was released in early 2016. Moon Cabin traverses diverse musical terrain with 3 part harmony vocals and hooks so big you can hang your hat on them; funky improvised solos and adventurous musical interludes. With a second album on the way and tour dates continuing to ramp up, the Goose is getting loose. http://www.gooseband.us OCULAR PANTHER: "Ocular Panther is bold; a brash and brilliant example of ethereal pursuit with organic tools. They have melded music from different genres, eras, and approaches to create a new contagion of danceable ambiance and rock grit. Some of the songs exhibit a protracted intro to their varied grooves that grow from a standard hook into a kind of epiphany. It smacks smooth and gloriously disjointed." -Frank De Blas√©, Rochester City Newspaper "Ocular Panther‚Äôs sound doesn‚Äôt so much caress and cajole the listener as it stalks that listener like prey through a jungle that sounds like it erupted from the mind of Salvador Dali. Essentially dance music, the band‚Äôs sound employs electro grooves as if they were the obvious basis for a brand of outer-space funk. The music is sinewy and menacing. A blend of world beat, European electro, and a futuristic marriage of both laid the basis for the virtuosic interplay of the musicians, who managed to take what was essentially dance music into some deeply interesting places. Ocular Panther seems to have no trouble crafting music that moves with purpose and forward motion, avoiding the pitfalls of lazy static repetition. Which is to say, this is music that you can dance to, analyze, or simply lose yourself within with equal ease." www.ocularpanther.com

The English Project at King Rook Club

Friday, March 16, 2018

9:00PM

Kings Rook Club

Erie, PA

8
128010414528948

The English Project at King Rook Club

Friday, March 16, 2018 9:00PM

Based out of Western NY, the English Project has solidified itself in the North Eastern U.S. as a collective that pushes the envelope of groove and improvisation. Comprised of core members Chris English on drums and vocals, Paul McArdle on guitar, Andres Rivera on bass and Dave Solazzo on piano, the English Project seamlessly fuses funk and soul with elements of modern jazz. They‚Äôve also opened for artists such as Bobby Brown, Arrested Development, Jazz is Phsh, Giant Panda Guerrilla Dub Squad, Sophistafunk, Thunderbody, John Kadlecik Band, and many others. Their debut EP, ‚ÄúThe English Project, Vol.1‚Äù is OUT NOW.

FREE MOVIE: Searching for Sugar Man

Friday, March 16, 2018

7:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
2128221804072296

FREE MOVIE: Searching for Sugar Man

Friday, March 16, 2018 7:00PM

DSP Shows Presents: Searching for Sugar Man *** FREE SCREENING *** Friday, March 16th 7:00pm showtime In the early 1970s, Sixto Rodriguez was a Detroit folksinger who had a short-lived recording career with only two well received but non-selling albums. Unknown to Rodriguez, his musical story continued in South Africa where he became a pop music icon and inspiration for generations. Long rumored there to be dead by suicide, a few fans in the 1990s decided to seek out the truth of their hero's fate. What follows is a bizarrely heartening story in which they found far more in their quest than they ever hoped, while a Detroit construction laborer discovered that his lost artistic dreams came true after all.

Spotlight: Seth Faergolzia‚Äôs Multibird

Friday, March 16, 2018

7:00PM

Bop Shop Records

Rochester, NY

9
1593705597389334

Spotlight: Seth Faergolzia‚Äôs Multibird

Friday, March 16, 2018 7:00PM - Friday, March 16, 2018 9:00PM

FREE SHOW! This episode of #Season5 of the #RochesterIndieMusicianSpotlight features Seth Faergolzia! Each concert at Bop Shop Records will feature a ten-to-fifteen minute interview with the guest, then a 45 minute set. Seth is a revered member of the psychedelic anti-folk movement with Dufus. Now he's in Rochester, performing with Seth Faergolzia's Multibird, Seth Faergolzia & the 23 Psaegz, and his loop painting projects. Don't miss what he has in store for us!

Swimmer with Eggy at Nectar's

Friday, March 16, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
174927219927729

Swimmer with Eggy at Nectar's

Friday, March 16, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, March 17, 2018 12:00AM

9pm doors 21+ $5 ~~~~~~~~~~ Swimmer Swimmer is an experimental rock-fusion quintet based out of Burlington, VT. Their music transcends convention, fusing the band‚Äôs roots in rock, funk, jazz and electronica to create a unique and powerful sound. Since conceived in 2014 at New Hampshire‚Äôs Plymouth State University, Swimmer has cultivated a fanbase through captivating composition and distinct live performances featuring an emphasis on high-energy improvisation. Eggy Down at home, funky crunchadelic, Eggy is the group that brings balance to your musical breakfast. The band presents a timeless vision of songwriting both lyrically and in composition, creating works worthy of lasting a lifetime. Michael Goodman (bass/vocals), Jake Brownstein (guitar/vocals), Dani Battat (keys/vocals) and Alex Bailey (drums/vocals) work around the clock, sharpening their craft. The result, an original and organic musical blend inspired by their musical heroes of the past and present. In a live setting, eclectic improvisations create performances that take on a life of their own. Eggy paints a full spectrum of styles and emotions, and invites you to share in the experience!

The BuddhaHood + Root Shock at Funk 'n Waffles

Friday, March 16, 2018

9:30PM

Funk 'n Waffles Rochester

Rochester, NY

9
160742451227156

The BuddhaHood + Root Shock at Funk 'n Waffles

Friday, March 16, 2018 9:30PM - Saturday, March 17, 2018 1:00AM

$10 / Age 18 And Up Doors 8:30 Root Shock (9:30 - 11:00) Root SHOCK was formed in Winter of 2012 with veteran musicians whose love of reggae music flows deep. Blending roots reggae, dancehall, heavy drum & bass and soulful vocals with conscious lyrics into positive dance music will make you want to move! The Buddhahood (11:30 - 1am) Making up this highly creative and entertaining ensemble are eight members, with a wide spectrum of character and musical background. Know for their multi-instrumental, powerhouse sets, The Buddhahood represents with a variety of vocal styles, percussion, guitar, horns, bass and keys in shades of Roots, Rock, Reggae, Funk and Afrobeat in a flavor they call "Worldternative" as each song forces you to stay on the dance floor. Tickets: https://www.ticketweb.com/event/the-buddhahoodroot-shock-at-funk-funk-n-waffles-rochester-tickets/8052665?REFERRAL_ID=twfb

The Sisters of Murphy at 3HB

Friday, March 16, 2018

7:00PM

Three Heads Brewing

Rochester, NY

9
993201837484346

The Sisters of Murphy at 3HB

Friday, March 16, 2018 7:00PM - Friday, March 16, 2018 11:00PM

The Sisters of Murphy are Rochesters tallest Irish Band. They also are one of the most rockin' ones too. On the eve of St. Patrick's Day, they are making their annual trip back to the brewery. This is going to be nutty and the kick off of a crazy 24 hour stretch for the bands. This probably will be most sober they are on stage for the whole weekend. Come get green with us. Doors at 7 Music at 8 $5

Buffalo, NY

286459141860581

The English Project at Nietzsche's

Saturday, March 17, 2018 9:00PM

Based out of Western NY, the English Project has solidified itself in the North Eastern U.S. as a collective that pushes the envelope of groove and improvisation. Comprised of core members Chris English on drums and vocals, Paul McArdle on guitar, Andres Rivera on bass and Dave Solazzo on piano, the English Project seamlessly fuses funk and soul with elements of modern jazz. They‚Äôve also opened for artists such as Bobby Brown, Arrested Development, Jazz is Phsh, Giant Panda Guerrilla Dub Squad, Sophistafunk, Thunderbody, John Kadlecik Band, and many others. Their debut EP, ‚ÄúThe English Project, Vol.1‚Äù is OUT NOW.

Head for the Hills with The Wormdogs at Nectar's

Saturday, March 17, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
199798373906791

Head for the Hills with The Wormdogs at Nectar's

Saturday, March 17, 2018 9:00PM - Sunday, March 18, 2018 12:00AM

9pm doors 21+ $5 ~~~~~~~~~~~ Head for the Hills Head for the Hills has a simple but continuing dilemma they can‚Äôt seem to resolve. Specialists have been hired to no avail and the predicament persists: how does one describe the multifarious music of Head for the Hills? Among the top contenders are catchy turns of phrase like post-bluegrass, progressive string music, modern acoustic noir, and bluegrass bricolage. ‚ÄúOn top of modern string music,‚Äù (Bluegrass Today), ‚ÄúCutting edge,‚Äù (Drew Emmitt) or ‚ÄúBest in Colorado Bluegrass‚Äù (Westword Showcase Readers Poll)‚Äîthose are up there too. Strip away the artful descriptors and you have a forward thinking group of {mostly} acoustic musicians drawing on eclectic influences, tastes and styles. They didn‚Äôt grow up immersed in bluegrass music but came to it later in life, with each other. The result is a sound based in bluegrass that reaches into indie rock, jazz, hip hop, world and folk to stitch together fresh songs that bridge the divide between past and future acoustic music. Head for the Hills‚ÄîAdam Kinghorn on Guitar and vocals, Joe Lessard on violin and vocals, Matt Loewen on upright bass and vocals and Mike Chappell on acoustic and electric mandolins‚Äîhas been bringing their music, whatever you‚Äôd like to call it, to audiences from the Telluride Bluegrass Festival to South by Southwest and a multitude of stages in between since 2004. The band has independently issued two studio records and one live, been featured on NPR Ideastream and eTown, co-released a beer with Odell Brewing Company in May 2013 and charted on the CMJ Top 200 (Blue Ruin, 2013 and Head for the Hills, 2010). Blue Ruin, an all-new album of original material is available now. Meta-fictional sea shanties. Pop-infused newgrass murder ballads and urbane lyricism. Twang and punch. Head for the Hills‚Äô fourth record, Blue Ruin, fuses bluegrass, jazz, hip-hop and indie rock into songs inspired by love and misery and comic books. Featuring twelve new original songs marked by moving narratives and stellar musicianship, Blue Ruin showcases the quartet‚Äôs contemporary take on acoustic music; embracing the bluegrass pedigree while looking forward. Recorded and mixed in Fort Collins, Colorado at Swingfingers Studios with ace engineer and banjoist Aaron Youngberg (Martha Scanlan, Cahalen Morrison and Eli West), Blue Ruin features contributions from Andy Hall (The Infamous Stringdusters), James Thomas, Gabe Mervine (The Motet), and more. Renowned screen print artist Timothy Doyle (Muse, The Black Keys, Lucas Films, NASA) created the stunning cover art and Grammy Award-winning mastering engineer David Glasser rounds out the production team. This is Head for the Hills at their most artistically fulfilled: self-produced and in top form. Blue Ruin is more than just a ‚Äúbluegrass‚Äù record‚Äîit‚Äôs a Head for the Hills record. A quintessential Colorado band, Head for the Hills has been fortunate to work with many of the area greats, starting with Grammy Award winning Dobroist Sally Van Meter, producer of 2007‚Äôs Robber‚Äôs Roost. Legacy Colorado musician and Leftover Salmon mandolin player Drew Emmitt came in to produce 2010‚Äôs Head for the Hills. The list goes on, with a bevy of talent from Colorado and beyond surrounding 2010‚Äôs Head for the Hills; including Grammy Award winning mixing engineer Vance Powell (Jack White, The Raconteurs), technical wizard and Pink Floyd re-master engineer Gus Skinas, Anders Beck (Greensky Bluegrass), Kyle James Hauser (Sonablast! Recording Artist) and keyboardist James Thomas, with String Cheese Incident guitarist and Colorado mainstay Billy Nershi rounding out the lineup as studio host and collaborator. In 2012 Head for the Hills released their first live record (Live). Captured in high fidelity sound & culled from 5 great nights in Colorado, Live is just that; the band live and unadorned, performing favorite original material and select covers. Here are a few of the things people all over the country have been saying about Head for the Hills: ‚ÄúCutting edge. Listeners will fully enjoy this unique sound,‚Äù Drew Emmitt (Leftover Salmon); ‚ÄúHead for the Hills possesses that secret ingredient,‚Äù Ryan Dembinsky (Glide Magazine, Hidden Track); ‚ÄúCritics Picks-What we think you should hear at SxSW,‚Äù (Austin Statesman/360.com); ‚ÄúSummer Stars‚Äù (Relix Magazine); ‚ÄúFiery and precise ‚Äì what modern bluegrass should be,‚Äù City Weekly (Salt Lake City, UT); ‚ÄúA very modern indie rock approach to bluegrass,‚Äù Daily Herald (Provo, UT); ‚ÄúColorado Neo-bluegrassers Head for the Hills combine old and new and carry the torch for a new generation,‚Äù Ryan Heinsius (Flagstaff Live); ‚ÄúRising stars of the acoustic string scene,‚Äù (BluegrassLA); ‚ÄúThe band is standing shoulder-to-shoulder with many of their predecessors, and in the process creating their chapter in the ever-continuing story of bluegrass,‚Äù (Marquee Magazine); ‚ÄúReshaping the genre as a whole,‚Äù Sam Sanborn (Oregon Music News); ‚ÄúThe name Head for the Hills connotes hightailing it, running away. Yeah right. From the growing crowd of fans in hot pursuit,‚Äù Susan Viebrock (Telluride Inside & Out); ‚ÄúSupremely satisfying,‚Äù Eric Podolsky (Jambase.com). The Wormdogs The Wormdogs are a knee slapping, swamp picking, sun-stanky foursome from Burlington, Vermont featuring members of Squimley & The Woolens + Doctor Rick. Elliot Diana - Mandolin/Fiddle/Mouth Harps/Vocals Nick Ledak - Guitar/Banjo/Vocals Eric Soszynski - Guitar/Russian Vocals Pat Callahan - Guitar/Vocals Braden Lalancette - Bass/Vocals Will Pearl - Drums/Vocals

Vanishing Sun at Photo City ft. Eli Flynn and Incognito Burrito

Photo City Improv: Comedy & Music Venue

Rochester, NY

9
495543137508789

Vanishing Sun at Photo City ft. Eli Flynn and Incognito Burrito

Saturday, March 17, 2018 7:00PM - Sunday, March 18, 2018 1:00AM

Rochestarian powerhouse Vanishing Sun makes its debut at Photo City Improv for a St. Patrick's day celebration the likes of which you have never seen! Special guest performances by Eli Flynn and the Everymen and Incognito Burrito! $10. DOORS AT 7 MUSIC AT 8. BE THERE OR BE SQUARE! Originating as an instrumental Jazz / Drum & Bass Fusion project in late 2016, Vanishing Sun has rapidly evolved into one of the Upstate New York region's top up and coming artists. With the addition of powerhouse vocalist Zahyia and the release of their second album "After" in 2017, the band is poised and ready to continue to unleash its trademark explosive live performance while ever pushing its own limits in terms of music and creativity. Coming from a wide range of musical backgrounds and with an age spread that exceeds three decades, the band is composed of internationally touring musicians that have played and toured with the likes of legends such as Chaka Khan, Teddy Pendergrass, and Maceo Parker. With this rare combination of diverse musicians, its no wonder that Vanishing Sun has a unique sound... Hiatus Kaiyote meets A Tribe Called Quest, Headhunters meets Flying Lotus, Rage Against the Machine meets Erykah Badu.

Freedom Train LIVE at State Theatre of Ithaca!

Sunday, March 18, 2018

3:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
267503283735066

Freedom Train LIVE at State Theatre of Ithaca!

Sunday, March 18, 2018 3:00PM

The Tompkins Trust Company and CSP Management Family Series Presents: Freedom Train LIVE at State Theatre of Ithaca! Sunday, March 18th, 2018 - 3pm Sponsored by Northeast Pediatrics Community Partner: Greater Ithaca Activities Center Harriet Tubman was born a slave, but when she was 25 she made her perilous escape from a Maryland plantation, leaving her family behind. Pursued by dogs and relentless slave catchers, she followed an escape route laid out by Quakers -- secret hiding places in churches, barns, cellars and homes. The escape route that Harriet followed soon became known as the Underground Railroad, and she quickly became one of its most celebrated 'conductors.' Up creek beds, through swamps, over hills in the dark of night, on 19 secret trips Harriet Tubman guided more than 300 slaves, including her aged parents, to freedom. "I never run my train off the track," she said, "and I never lost a passenger." Freedom Train tells the thrilling story of Harriet Tubman, the Moses of her people, in a fascinating series of highly theatrical scenes that use dance, dialogue, and music of the period. Songs include "Follow the Drinking Gourd," "Steal Away," "Wade in the Water," "Good News, the Chariot's A-comin'," and many others still sung today. Freedom Train is the story of self-sacrifice, dedication and survival, laced with warmth and a sense of humor that celebrates the human spirit -- a universal story for all. (One hour in length, recommended for grades 3 - 9) Curriculum Connections: Communication and Language Arts, Music, Relationships & Family, Social Studies.

Funk 'n Waffles Rochester

1574902119268034

$5.00 Pre-Sale / $7.00 DOS Age 18 And Up Casey Bloom (7:00 - 7:30) Multi-Instrumentalist, singer, composer, and band leader from Upstate New York Pine Needle Soul (7:45 - 8:15) Pine Needle Soul is a band from Rochester NY featuring an MC, guitar, vocals, bass, keys, sax, and drums. We play in the style of hip hop fusion. Higher Education (8:30 -10:00) Higher Education continues to craft a unique sound comprised of 90s rock melded with traditional reggae that originates from the Washington, DC College Park scene. Besides making their presence known while playing residencies at key venues, Higher Education has extended its reach along the east coast, out west, and across international borders. Brothers Petey and Danny Devaney constantly discover new ways to integrate both reggae vibes and psychedelic inspirations into the electricity of rock and roll, with classic and contemporary influences such as dance hall reggae, 90s rock, and 60s guitar psychedelia. That 1 Guy w/Michael Stark

Sunday, March 18, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
133114717373106

That 1 Guy w/Michael Stark

Sunday, March 18, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents That 1 Guy with Michael Stark at The Haunt on 3/18!! 7:00PM Doors 8:00PM Show That 1 Guy http://that1guy.com/ With an extensive and amazing track record of unique and imaginative performances featuring his curious instrument and copious amounts of originality, Mike Silverman, a/k/a That1Guy, has set himself apart as a true one-of-a-kind talent that rivals any other artist currently in the entertainment industry. Averaging 150-200 shows a year all over North America and Canada, he has been a consistent favorite at such festivals as: Wakarusa, Electric Forest, Big Day out, All Good Music Festival, Bella, High Sierra Music Festival, Summer Meltdown, Montreal Jazz Festival, and many more. He was also the ‚ÄòTap Water Award‚Äô winner at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival for best musical act. His legendary collaboration and multiple tours with Buckethead performing as The Frankenstein Brothers has further cemented his virtuoso story as a creative visionary. His innovation continues to soar with his latest tour, That1Guy & The Magic Pipe Present: An Evening of Musical Magical Wonder... The Likes of Which Ye Haven't Yet Seen, which kicked off in 2014. Along with his pioneering main instrument, The Magic Pipe, a monstrosity of metal, strings, and electronics, he facilitates the dynamic live creation of music and magic in ways only That1Guy can conjure. You can also expect to see magic seamlessly integrated into the already clever performance. With the addition of magic in his live shows, he has legitimately achieved an all-inclusive audio/visual performance unlike anything experienced before. ‚ÄúSo much of my music has miraculous qualities to it because it‚Äôs hard to tell what‚Äôs going on. There are lots of slights of hand and sonic misdirection. It feels like I was meant to do magic‚Äù. Silverman‚Äôs back-story is similar to many musicians that have come before him. He grew up a self-proclaimed music geek, soaked in the influence of his jazz musician father, and enrolled in San Francisco Conservatory of Music before joining the local jazz scene himself as a sought-after percussive bassist. This is where the similarities end though and where That1Guy truly began. ‚ÄúIn my case, being a bass player, I just felt very restricted by the instrument itself,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve always wanted to sound different and have my own sound. I was headed that way on the bass, but for me to fully realize what I was hearing in my head sonically I was going to have to do it my way‚Äù. His influential and innovative double bass style eventually evolved into what we see today as That1Guy and The Magic Pipe. As his story continues to develop, Billboard has famously noted, ‚ÄúIn the case of Mike Silverman‚Äôs slamming, futuristic funk act... the normal rules of biology just don‚Äôt apply.‚Äù In addition, Silverman also has new music and videos in the works for 2015 that will further validate his status as an industry trailblazer. ‚ÄúI like being my own person‚Äù, he says. ‚ÄúI didn‚Äôt set out to be a weirdo, but I‚Äôm starting to embrace it‚Äù. Ultimately, his motivation can be encapsulated as this: ‚ÄúHuman beings do our best work when we‚Äôre challenged and pushed up against the wall‚Äù. That1Guy goes on to further explain, ‚ÄúBy nature, we‚Äôre hunters and gatherers, spending each day looking for their next meal. It‚Äôs easy to be lazy when you don‚Äôt have to come up with something creative right away.‚Äù Michael Stark ‚ÄúSwimming through the clouds and byways of an existential haze, drifting and painting a sacred totem atop the endless mantle, Michael Stark‚Äôs fingers roll across the ivory keys like a dream‚Ä¶ Stark‚Äôs affinity for creation is apparent in the weightless shaping he attaches to each group he works with. A notable grace and lean infusion marks his approach. He waves a sort of expressionistic wand, lending accents that accommodate and heighten‚Ä¶ There‚Äôs abstraction, but also a deep love of song craft to his approach. Many of his compositions can easily get stuck in your head like some Top 40 hit, albeit in a sneakily artful and pleasant way.‚Äú - Christopher J. Harrington Ithaca.com Stark‚Äôs involved in many diverse Ithaca based bands including TZAR, Jennie Lowe Stearns, The Analogue Sons, Bronwen Exter, Johnny Dowd, MSZM, Mary Lorson, Wingnut, Venissa Santi, and Orbiting Art Ensemble to name a few, some of which also perform in Europe and Canada. Here through his solo performance he shares his latest compositions filled with vintage drum machine, synth bass pedals, and various expressive keyboard instruments. Stark, currently in the recording studio, is in the process of documenting a variety of new music both for his solo context and several bands he writes for. New website to be debuted with these recordings. In the meantime folks can find out about all of his music happenings on his facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/mr.michaelstark

With so many talented bands interested in playing our StrangeCreek Campout, we created these friendly annual ‚Äòbattles‚Äô to give bands a shot at earning their way onto our festival stages by the best measure we know: strutting their stuff LIVE in a venue, showing us what they can do where it counts most ‚Äì in front of a crowded dancefloor. Anyone Anyway / Fortunato / Carpool

Tuesday, March 20, 2018

8:00PM

Bug Jar

Rochester, NY

9

Kubick's Rubes (WSG Ben Haravitch!) at Johnny's

Tuesday, March 20, 2018

7:00PM

Johnny's Pub & Grill

Rochester, NY

9
2108892342663525

Kubick's Rubes (WSG Ben Haravitch!) at Johnny's

Tuesday, March 20, 2018 7:00PM - Tuesday, March 20, 2018 10:30PM

The 3rd Tuesday of the month will be here before you know it, which means Kubick's Rubes will be bringing our high-energy blend of Bluegrass and Western Swing back to Johnny's Pub & Grill. We're really psyched to have our good friend Ben Haravitch play a showcase set with us. One of the most in-demand banjo and bass players in the region, Ben sings and plays original and traditional roots music with The Brothers Blue, "The Crawdiddies", and Aaron Lipp's Mount Pleasant String Band. Also on hand this month will be exalted guest Rube John Denniston tearing it up on mando. So come on out for a great night of music, food, and libations! No cover! 7:00-8:00 -- the Rubes 8:00-8:45ish -- Ben Haravitch 8:45ish-10:30 -- the Rubes

Wed. Mar 21st : Blue Marble 2 - preparty at Temple

Wednesday, March 21, 2018

9:00PM

Temple Bar & Grille

Rochester, NY

8
172709736706358

Wed. Mar 21st : Blue Marble 2 - preparty at Temple

Wednesday, March 21, 2018 9:00PM - Thursday, March 22, 2018 1:00AM

The Blue Marble 2 kicks off the outdoor camping season Apr 27-29 in Marion, NY only 20 miles east of Roc. This is the official preparty featuring The Forest Dwellers Old World Warblers Moe Michnick of Astro Collective ------------------------------------------------------------------ SHOW STARTS BY 10PM ------------------------------------------------------------------ ALWAYS FREE at Temple Bar & Grille. ------------------------------------------------------------------ 21+ Any Burger w/ Fry and any Draft Beer only $10.99!!! Woah! Genny and a shot, $4 ;D -- Presented by Rochestergroovecast.com -- BLUE MARBLE INFO: The Blue Marble returns under a full moon for the first Upstate campout of the year. Live music, camping, vending, food, art, family, community Lineup so far..... After Funk Dr. Slothclaw A.G.T. Haewa A Girl Named Genny PA Line ART the band Darb Jansen The Stone Jack Ballers Tyler Westcott Astro Collective Raibred Dapper Dan The Ditch Diggers Electric Tie Dye The Forest Dwellers Old World Warblers Duffy 'n' Alliekatt Johnny Richards ....alot more vending: Colleen Bielemeier all other info: Herby1 Presents $45 weekend pass - $60 at the gate. TICKET OUTLETS ON SALE NOW AARON'S ALLEY - Rochester facebook.com/AaronsAlleyInc EDDY RIDGE BOX OFFICE - Marion facebook.com/eddyridgefarm COMING SOON TO VAPOR RISING - Canandaigua facebook.com/VaporRisingShoppe SLICES PIZZA - Marion facebook.com/SlicesPizzaShop/ Vehicle parking fees: $5 cars and trucks (one day) $10 cars and trucks (weekend) (+) plus an additional... $10 popups $15 tow behinds and 5th wheels $15 buses and RVs. GUIDELINES **This is a family musical campout, not a corporate festival, and not a drug store. Don't be that guy or girl or you will be escorted off the property. Not kidding. **Tailgating is encouraged. Bring your BBQ grills and coolers and have a cookout. NO GLASS BOTTLES. **Camp by your vehicle and carry in tent camping is available. **Pop-up trailors, tow behinds, and RVs are allowed but the weather will be a factor for availability and your parking options. No electric or sewer hookups. contact herby1 beforehand to get on the large vehicle list or you may be turned away. **NO drunks or crackheads **NO dumbasses **NO second chances (see above) **Please respect your self,, our neighbors, the campers, the bands and the staff. **HAVE FUN! Eddy Ridge Farm 4653 Eddy Ridge Road Marion NY 14505 *When you check in you will receive a wristband and parking pass, which is good all weekend long. if you need to go to work or home for part of it, just show your wristband and pass upon your return and you are good to go back in and have fun! **We will be collecting can and dry food at the gate for the Marion Food Pantry. Please bring as much as you can donate, but please make sure they are not past their expiration date or they won't be able to donate it. Thank you. One love!

The Finger Lakes Thaw

Friday, March 23, 2018 6:00PM - Saturday, March 24, 2018 1:00AM

This is a festival, and the city is the venue. 1 Pass || 2 Days || 5 Venues || 35+ Acts Shake off the cold and join your community in a series of exclusive concerts in intimate venues throughout Ithaca. The Finger Lakes Thaw strives to provide a diverse and cosmopolitan experience, featuring local, regional, and national artists. Ithaca's local offerings of food, music, and culture, serve as a backdrop for this festival. ***Admittance to venues during the festival will be on a first-come first-serve basis, subject to venue capacity*** Current Line Up with more to be announced: PJ Morton (New Orleans) Giant Panda Guerilla Dub Squad (Rochester) Cas Haley (Paris, Texas) Big Mean Sound Machine (Ithaca) Bead and Bone Big Sister (Ithaca) Blue Iris (Brooklyn) Butterchild (Brooklyn/Boston) Chris Kazarian (Brooklyn) Cocek Brass Band (Boston) Cuddle Magic (Brooklyn) Danielle Ponder & The Tomorrow People. Fri. March 23rd: Casey Bloom's 30th birthday celebration at Vpub

Friday, March 23, 2018

9:00PM

The Villager

Canandaigua, NY

9
1791377671156921

Fri. March 23rd: Casey Bloom's 30th birthday celebration at Vpub

Friday, March 23, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, March 24, 2018 1:00AM

Herby1 Presents - Celebrating Casey Bloom's 30th birthday with a night of live music at the VPub. Old World Warblers featuring Timothy Clayton Braley and Hannah Farley will kick things off, followed by a set by Casey and his new band The Ditch Diggers featuring Matt Herrmann, Danny Mills & Ali Mills. The night will end with Casey being joined by Max Flansburg and Richie Colf of Dirty Blanket as the trio does a live take of the legendary "Pizza Tapes" recordings of Jerry Garcia, David Grisman, and Tony Rice. Christina Maureen Senska will be singing with Casey in between sets. Maureen Elizabeth Murphy and Casey perform a few before the final set.

Strange Machines w/ Electric Love Machine at Nectar's - 3/23

Friday, March 23, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
240486603156946

Strange Machines w/ Electric Love Machine at Nectar's - 3/23

Friday, March 23, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, March 24, 2018 2:00AM

Strange Machines return to Burlington, VT with special guests Electric Love Machine Friday, March 23 at Nectar's! $5 / 21+ STRANGE MACHINES NEW ALBUM "VOICE OF COLOR" AVAILABLE HERE: iTunes: http://apple.co/2yLF1a8 Bandcamp: http://bit.ly/2xm4ea3 Spotify: http://spoti.fi/2ytROBY Amazon: http://amzn.to/2z52Pdd CDBaby: http://bit.ly/2y5ca3g Boston-born, New England based quartet Strange Machines have been steadily making a name for themselves in the East Coast jam scene. What started as a band focused on rock and reggae has slowly melded into a true melting pot of musical fusion, with sounds catering to heavy rock, funk, livetronica and a multitude of other genre‚Äôs, all while stringing them together seamlessly to create a fluid and captivating live performance. Their original songs are nuanced by creative composition, practiced precision, and a looseness that allows them to truly explore the music they create. They have shared the stage with national-touring acts such as Dopapod, Twiddle, Pigeons Playing Ping Pong, Turkuaz, Kung Fu, TAUK, Deep Banana Blackout, John Brown's Body, and more. Strange Machines have carved out their own niche in the east coast music scene and show no signs of slowing down. Strange Machines released their new album October of 2017. Founding member Mike MacDonald and long time keyboardist Christian Perron, with the additions of Craig Holland on bass and Isaac Civitello on drums, have honed in their sound and hit their stride as a four piece. "Voice of Color", the bands first full length release, is a representation of what the band has developed into, diving further into progressive experimental rock and funk more than ever before. Striving to consistently deliver a high energy and engaging live performance, the band has continued to gain momentum in the Northeast and beyond. This album aims to capture the diversity and big sound you will experience at a Strange show. "Strange Machines is known for powerful, high-energy live performances that explore the depths of their music and cater to a breadth of listeners. None of the band‚Äôs beloved characteristics are lost on the album‚Äîrather, Voice of Color offers precisely executed arrangements of Strange Machines originals while still embodying the looseness and exploration you‚Äôd find at a live performance." - Live For Live Music

Strange Machines with Electric Love Machine at Nectar's 3/23

Friday, March 23, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
192493461336509

Strange Machines with Electric Love Machine at Nectar's 3/23

Friday, March 23, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, March 24, 2018 2:00AM

9pm doors 21+ $5 ~~~~~~~~~~~ Strange Machines Boston-born, New England based quartet Strange Machines have been steadily making a name for themselves in the East Coast jam scene. What started as a band focused on rock and reggae has slowly melded into a true melting pot of musical fusion, with sounds catering to funk, livetronica, heavy rock and a multitude of other genre‚Äôs, all while stringing them together seamlessly to create a fluid and captivating live performance. Their original songs are nuanced by creative composition, practiced precision, and a looseness that allows them to truly explore the music they create. They have shared the stage with national-touring acts such as Dopapod, Twiddle, Pigeons Playing Ping Pong, Turkuaz, Kung Fu, TAUK, Deep Banana Blackout, John Brown's Body, and more. Strange Machines have carved out their own niche in the east coast music scene and show no signs of slowing down. Strange Machines released their latest studio album October 7, 2017. Founding member Mike MacDonald and long time keyboardist Christian Perron, with the additions of Craig Holland on bass and Isaac Civitello on drums, have honed in their sound and hit their stride as a four piece. "Voice of Color", the bands first full length release, is a representation of what the band has developed into, diving further into progressive experimental rock and funk more than ever before. Striving to consistently deliver a high energy and engaging live performance, the band has continued to gain momentum in the Northeast and beyond. This album aims to capture the diversity and big sound you will experience at a Strange show. "Strange Machines is known for powerful, high-energy live performances that explore the depths of their music and cater to a breadth of listeners. None of the band‚Äôs beloved characteristics are lost on the album‚Äîrather, Voice of Color offers precisely executed arrangements of Strange Machines originals while still embodying the looseness and exploration you‚Äôd find at a live performance." - Live For Live Music Electric Love Machine Electric Love Machine is a Baltimore based quartet that combines Electronica, Dance, Rock, Soul, and Funk into an incomparable, high energy live music experience.

The Musical Box: 50 Years of Genesis

Friday, March 23, 2018

8:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
334956720311306

The Musical Box: 50 Years of Genesis

Friday, March 23, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents: The Musical Box: 50 Years of Genesis March 23rd, 2018 8:00pm Show State Theatre of Ithaca The Musical Box, internationally acclaimed for its historical re-enactment of early Genesis‚Äô works, will perform Selling England By The Pound, the emblematic 1973 show that made Genesis and Peter Gabriel attain rock star status, enjoying to this day a cult following from nostalgic and young music lovers alike. Exclusively licensed by Peter Gabriel and Genesis,The Musical Box has performed worldwide in some of the most prestigious venues such as The London Royal Albert Hall and had the privilege of receiving Phil Collins and Steve Hackett from Genesis as performing guests. With its quest for authenticity,The Musical Box is often cited as the best interpretation group in the world.

String Thing 6: Free Live Bluegrass & Americana

Saturday, March 24, 2018

4:00PM

Johnny's Pub & Grill

Rochester, NY

8
786338488238446

String Thing 6: Free Live Bluegrass & Americana

Saturday, March 24, 2018 4:00PM - Sunday, March 25, 2018 1:30AM

A FREE celebration of Rochester's bluegrass and acoustic music community sponsored by Johnny's Pub & Grill, Two Roads Brewing Company and Sound Source, Inc. This year we are partnering with the M.K. Gandhi Institute for Nonviolence, who are doing important work in local schools and elsewhere in our community. 9 great musical acts performing nonstop music between two stages with no overlapping sets! 4:00-4:30 Her Dad's Banjo 4:30-5:30 Ruckus Juice Jug Stompers 5:30-6:00 Old World Warblers 6:00-7:15 Elephino 7:15-8:15 String Theory* 8:15-9:15 Kubick's Rubes* 9:15-9:45 Jungle Steve (Jacob Crawford) 9:45-10:45 The Crooked North 10:45-11:00 Raffle winners 11:00-12:00 North Star String Band* 12:00 acoustic jam on the floor, if anyone's up for it * = a host band for FREE Bluegrass Tuesdays at Johnny's Pub & Grill Two Roads and Johnny‚Äôs have teamed up to bring you some delicious and easy sipping beverages‚Äî Honeyspot Road Unfiltered IPA, Ol' Factory Pils, and Lil' Heaven Session IPA. As with all events at Johnny's Pub & Grill, there is never a cover. Enjoy 8 hours of free live music!

The band has been surprising and delighting crowds across the New York region and beyond, bringing their unique high-energy style spearheaded by the stunning soulful vocals and stage presence of Jessica Brown to a wide range of settings. The band‚Äôs dedication to spreading music with a positive message has paid off in entertaining, elevating, and energizing music lovers of all walks of life! On the heels of their 2016 debut album, Root Shock is stepping up their game, hitting the road and bringing their renowned live show to clubs, festivals and concert halls far and wide. 2017 is already treating them well; winning the Syracuse Area Music Awards ‚ÄúBest New Artist‚Äù accolade as well as being crowned winner in the NYS Music‚Äôs state-wide March Madness fan favorite competition. The band is continuing to concentrate on spreading their uplifting message and vibes to the masses. Root Shock‚Äôs genre-bending sound has proven to fit many musical settings yet always stand out! Signal > Noise: v.4.1: Loren / Pat Bosman / Alex Morrison

Saturday, March 24, 2018

10:00PM

Photo City Improv: Comedy & Music Venue

Rochester, NY

9
147436386061438

Signal > Noise: v.4.1: Loren / Pat Bosman / Alex Morrison

Saturday, March 24, 2018 10:00PM - Sunday, March 25, 2018 4:00AM

Loren A rapidly-rising star in Detroit's ever-vibrant techno and house scene, LOREN has established herself as a legitimate force in a city where the bar for talent is set famously high. A resident DJ at Detroit's favorite club, TV Lounge, a regular booking in Chicago, Brooklyn and beyond, and with an impressive appearance at 2016's Movement under her belt, Loren is a familiar presence in dj booths these days. This will be western New York's first opportunity to become acquainted with Loren's unique energy, motor city swagger and hypnotic, pounding grooves. Pat Bosman PAT BOSMAN is quite the man about town in the world's house music capital of Chicago. A collaborator of our dear friend Sassmouth (hi Sam!) in the Naughty Bad Fun Collective and resident at the long-running Planet Chicago club night, Pat is all about jacking beats, android funk, disgusting acid, precision mixing and just the right dose of the thing we understand as deepness. If you like your house and techno creeping, twisted and totally free of fucks, Pat Bosman is your man. Alex Morrison If you've been attending Signal>Noise events (or techno parties practically anywhere in the US, for that matter) for for the past three years, chances are you've danced beside Buffalo's ALEX MORRISON. Alex' boundless enthusiasm for the underground is evident. His work with Buffalo's Redux crew has brought many a memorable night of killer dance music to western NY, but if you haven't heard him throw down a dj set you you're really in for something special. With a discerning taste in music, a broad repertoire and technical skills on par with the very best, Alex is one of our favorite DJs in the region. Having an innate sense of knowing just what to play and when to play it makes Alex Morrison a DJ we're extremely excited to finally have on this lineup. >> ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî Loren [ LOBOS | My Baby | TV Lounge ] DET Pat Bosman [ NBFC | Planet Chicago ] CHI Alex Morrison [ REDUX ] BUFF >> ‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî Saturday > March 24 Rochester > NY [10PM - 4AM] 21+ w/ID Lights By : Gnosis Powered By : JWI

Sophistafunk with Cozy O'Donnell at Nectar's

Saturday, March 24, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
414414225645799

Sophistafunk with Cozy O'Donnell at Nectar's

Saturday, March 24, 2018 9:00PM - Sunday, March 25, 2018 12:00AM

9pm doors 21+ $10 ADV // $10 DOS ~~~~~~~~~ Sophistafunk SOPHISTAFUNK met in 2007 and rapidly evolved into a national-touring live act. Known for their HUGE sound (created by only three members), the band has won over crowds with a captivating stage presence and tight musicianship. Rooted by old school funk / hip hop, the trio explores electronic dance grooves while infusing each tune with soul and positively charged lyrics. SOPHISTAFUNK is a multi-genre tour de force, jam packed with vintage tones and live instruments. Catch ONE show, and you will be hooked! For six years, this road warrior band has been hitting the pavement and blowing minds across the United States. They‚Äôve collaborated live with greats spanning Bernie Worrell (Parliament/Talking Heads) to Nikki Glaspie (Beyonce/Dumpstaphunk) and were featured on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives when Gold‚Äôs restaurant and music venue, Funk n‚Äô Waffles, was featured on the show on December 25, 2012. Host, Guy Fieri, dug the band so hard, they‚Äôve since played his birthday party in Santa Rosa, CA and became the first band ever to play the International Home and Housewares Convention in Chicago, IL on March 3, 2013, by Fieri‚Äôs personal request. SOPHISTAFUNK will cross the pond in August 2013, when they slay the UK with the internationally acclaimed Syracuse native, Joe Driscoll, and their new album, Freedom Is, will be dropping and dominating iPods within weeks. The band has played high-profile venues including The Blue Note Jazz Club (NYC), The Boom Boom Room (San Francisco), The Belly Up (Aspen), Brooklyn Bowl (NYC) and more and supported acts including Soulive, G. Love, Foreigner, Trombone Shorty, Ivan Neville‚Äôs Dumpstaphunk, EOTO, Marco Benevento and more. They‚Äôve also gained attention from publications including New York City‚Äôs Village Voice and Beyond Race Magazine.

Uncle Ben's Remedy

Saturday, March 24, 2018 8:00PM - Saturday, March 24, 2018 11:00PM

Uncle Ben's Remedy was the sleeper show of the year in 2017. I knew they were uptempo Americana with a touch of country and rock. But you just cannot truly get it until you see them live. They threw in some of the craziest covers you could imagine, got into the crowd for an unexpected unplugged acoustic 3 song set, had their bass player play his upright over his head....it was a spectacle. But on top of that, they have incredible amounts of talent and are great players. This is a show you cannot sleep on. It will be so worth it. Doors at 7 Music at 8 $5

Wild Child live in Ithaca

Saturday, March 24, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
321982938282480

Wild Child live in Ithaca

Saturday, March 24, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Wild Child - Expectations Tour with special guests The Wild Reeds at The Haunt on 3/24!! 7:00PM Doors 8:00PM Show Wild Child won't settle. For seven years now the Austin-based ensemble has carried its infectious blend of indie-pop and infectious melodies across the international music scene, charting viral hits and wrapping their arms around a diverse and dedicated fan base. But earlier this year when the band set out to make their fourth studio album, they found they had their hands full: After half a decade of maturation, the group had grown beyond its traditional writing and recording process. ‚ÄúWe had too many ideas for how we wanted to make this record‚Äù says Kelsey Wilson, the group‚Äôs lead vocalist and violinist. She shrugs. ‚ÄúSo we said, ‚ÄòWhy not just do all of them?‚Äô‚Äù The group realized this offered an exciting opportunity to make a kind of record bands rarely get right: To take a new, multispectral approach to writing and recording that went beyond simply trying to engineer success. The band made a list of their favorite musicians who were also great producers in their own right ‚Äî choosing ones they thought would shine a new and unique light on specific compositions ‚Äî and then Wild Child set about chasing their album from studio to studio all over the world, never saying no to an idea. The result ‚Äî the band‚Äôs fourth album, Expectations ‚Äî is Wild Child‚Äôs most creative, colorful and intellectually engaging album to date. Now a seven-piece pop mini-orchestra (Wilson on violin and vocals; Alexander Beggins on ukulele and vocals; Sadie Wolfe on cello; Matt Bradshaw on keyboards, trumpet, and harmonica; Tom Myers on drums; Cody Ackors on guitar and trombone; and Tyler Osmond on bass), Wild Child formed in 2010 when the group's core duo of Wilson and Beggins wrote and released their first album, Pillow Talk. Wild Child shaped their last record, Fools, in the shadows of more than one failed love, and Expectations, as the title suggests, is a continuation of that personal experience into an awakening. Wilson and Beggins, whose voices fit each other as naturally as any family act, pushed their boundaries as writers, drawing freely from the stories they've lived as well as the artists around the world that have inspired their growth. Their rate of output over that last year got them thinking differently about producing, focusing on one track at a time. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve always focused on the record as a whole. We wanted to think about each track as it‚Äôs own piece- but somehow it all fits together‚Äù Wilson says of the approach. That route took them around the world ‚Äî from Chris Walla's (Death Cab For Cutie) studio in Troms√∏, Norway, where the Northern Lights are the brightest in the world, to a home-built warehouse studio on the outskirts of Philadelphia, where Dr. Dog's Scott McMicken picked up the bass and ‚Äújoined the band for a week,‚Äù arranging harmonies and sharing living and recording space. Back in Wimberley, Texas, Matthew Logan Vasquez (Delta Spirit) set up a makeshift studio in Kelsey Wilson‚Äôs beloved childhood home ‚Äî abandoned since the floods of 2015 ‚Äî where they found the muses were eager to resurface. The group also tapped the talents of frequent tour mate Chris Boosahda (Shakey Graves), Atlantic Records recording artist Max Frost, and Grammy-winning producer Adrian Quesada (Groupo Fantasma, Brown Sabbath, Spanish Gold). The result is a theater of possibilities, with arrangements that reflect the range of tastes of the producers, from scruffy lo-fi tape hiss, to smoothed out precision-cut electronic pop sounds. Smartly, the album avoids defining itself and kicks off with a child‚Äôs voice telling Alexander Beggins, "Don't think that way." The track that follows (called "Alex") is a hook-spangled opener which in its three breezy minutes builds from a single ukulele to a lush and playful arrangement reminiscent of Beirut. The record almost immediately settles in to find the band at its most expansive. Songs like "My Town" and the deep-breathing "Eggshells" stretch the spaces between beats like a Chinese finger/time trap. They stop for more than one layover in Detroit, with "Back and Forth" evoking the horn charts of Arthur Conley and Jackie Wilson (or even Jens Lekman), and "Think It Over" throws an unexpected nod to Sly and the Family Stone. The closing track, ‚ÄúGoodbye, Goodnight,‚Äù is also the first the group recorded, and the one they believe best epitomizes the journey of making this album. At first, Scott McMicken‚Äôs production caught the band off-guard: He slowed the waltz down to the tempo of a dirge ‚Äî or a dirge with the levity of a waltz ‚Äî and built the track up at an almost excruciatingly slow pace that in the end gives you what you want from it, but only gives it to you once. ‚ÄúAt first we were all just trying to understand where he was coming from,‚Äù Wilson says with a laugh. ‚ÄúAnd it took us a while to get there, but the arrangement works out so well ‚Äî with what the song is about and how we felt when we wrote it ‚Äî that it ended up being one of my favorite songs on the record.‚Äù And the more you listen to Expectations, the more the many worlds of this project begin to cohere around you. After all, one of the great joys of traveling the world is discovering surprising connections: A skyscraper in Barcelona reminds you of a spire in the Utah desert; the Northern Lights in the Norwegian sky look like an oil slick on the Philadelphia pavement. Expectations, an album which can by turns be bitter, wistful, angry, and flirtatious, is rich with these surprising rhymes across the record. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre all growing and changing and learning new tricks,‚Äù Beggins says. Wilson responds, ‚ÄúYeah, there‚Äôs no right or wrong way to do anything.‚Äù Her own record, though, is proof she‚Äôs wrong.

Goodnight Moon & The Runaway Bunny at State Theatre of Ithaca

Sunday, March 25, 2018

1:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
995810637236580

Goodnight Moon & The Runaway Bunny at State Theatre of Ithaca

Sunday, March 25, 2018 1:00PM

The Tompkins Trust Company and CSP Management Family Series Presents: Goodnight Moon & The Runaway Bunny at State Theatre of Ithaca Sunday, March 25th -- 1pm Showtime Sponsored By Wegmans Recommended ages 3-8 yrs Mermaid Theatre has earned international acclaim for its unique interpretations of the works of Eric Carle (The Very Hungry Caterpillar ), Leo Lionni (Swimmy, Frederick & Inch by Inch) and Sam McBratney (Guess How Much I Love You). These widely-travelled productions incorporate innovative puppetry, striking scenic effects, and evocative original music to provide very young audiences with an effortless introduction to the performing arts and the excitement of reading. Goodnight Moon and The Runaway Bunny features these same elements. Few writers have been as attuned to the concerns and emotions of childhood as Margaret Wise Brown (1910‚Äì1952). Brown, a former teacher, believed that very young children could be fascinated by the simple pleasures of the world around them. Few had previously attempted to write specifically for children aged two to five, and Brown created some of the most enduring and beloved children‚Äôs books of all time as well as developed the concept of the first durable board book. Clement Hurd (1908‚Äì1988) graduated from Yale University and studied painting in Paris in the 1930s with Fernand L√©ger and others. His engaging semi-abstract style became world-famous with the publication in 1942 of The Runaway Bunny and Goodnight Moon in 1947 ‚Äì collaborations with Brown that became two of the 20th Century‚Äôs best-known children‚Äôs books. Goodnight Moon is a celebration of familiar nighttime rituals, while The Runaway Bunny‚Äôs pretend tale of leaving home evokes reassuring responses from his loving mum. Both tales feature endearing rabbit characters, and the soothing rhythms of bunny banter and dream-like imagery never fail to infuse young readers with a reassuring sense of security. Mermaid‚Äôs staged adaptation will bring a new sense of appreciation to stories that have delighted several generations.

Stu Hamm: Songs and Stories Solo Tour 2018

Sunday, March 25, 2018

7:00PM

Lovin' Cup

Rochester, NY

9
167582823993216

Stu Hamm: Songs and Stories Solo Tour 2018

Sunday, March 25, 2018 7:00PM

$ 15.00 / Age All Ages Additional Info: Through his innovative work as a solo artist and his contributions as a sideman to Joe Satriani and Steve Vai,Stu Hammhas firmly established himself as one of the mostinfluential electric bassists of the past half-century. Extending the non-traditional function of the electric bass previously revolutionized by Jaco Pastorius and Stanley Clarke in the1970s,Hammhelped to reshape the contemporary concept of the bass guitar as an unaccompanied instrument with the utilization of polyphonic, two-handed tapping, slapping andpopping techniques, chords, and harmonics. AlthoughHammcertainly wasnt the first bass player to debut during the 1980s and employ an unorthodox approach to playing theelectric bass, he was undoubtedly at the forefront of his generation who effectively fused the application of these unconventional techniques.Stu Hammis a world class, utterly entertaining story-teller, legendary bass guitar icon, known also for playing and recording with some of the greatest guitarists of the recent decades: Steve Vai, Joe Satriani, Greg Howe, Alex Skolnick, Richie Kotzen, Mike Keneally, Allan Holdsworth, Frank Gambale, Michael Schenker, Richie Kotzen. and many others.Stuhas been a monumental influence in jazz/rock style for many bass players worldwide.http://www.stuarthamm.net/ Tickets: http://www.ticketweb.com/event/stu-hamm-songs-and-stories-lovin-cup-tickets/7982125?REFERRAL_ID=twfb

EVERY LAST WEDNESDAY: Ben Chilbert of Haewa Brings "Chilly's Open Chill" To Temple Bar and Grille. 2/28 LINEUP! Blues for Blu - Sugaray Rayford Band - Benefit Show for Bluseed

Thursday, March 29, 2018

8:00PM

Waterhole

Saranac Lake, NY

9
151678598830208

Blues for Blu - Sugaray Rayford Band - Benefit Show for Bluseed

Thursday, March 29, 2018 8:00PM - Friday, March 30, 2018 1:00AM

Blues for Blu - Benefit Concert for Bluseed Studios feat. Sugaray Rayford Band Waterhole Upstairs Music Lounge 48 Main St., Saranac Lake, NY 21+ 3/29/18 - Thursday 7pm Doors 8pm Show $20.00 Tickets - $30.00 VIP Includes - Balcony, Tables/Chairs, Meet and Greet and Appetizers www.bluseedstudios.org www.saranaclakewaterhole.com Sugaray Rayford Band - https://sugarayblues.com Sugaray Rayford Band is one of the top blues bands touring the world today.. When Sugaray belts out a song, you not only hear it, you feel it. The excitement in the room is palpable when he takes the stage, a superb vocalist and world-class entertainer and complete with a 7 piece band with horns. His dynamic voice and stage presence is large as the man himself. His vocal style, echoes the energy of Otis Redding and his fluid dance steps will remind you of the Legendary James Brown. Sugaray was the lead vocalist for the Mannish Boys who won Best Traditional Blues Album in May 2013 at the Blues Music Awards. Now fronting his own band, The Sugaray Rayford Band. This year they have been honored to have the most nominations in the Blues Music awards including the pinnacle award of BB King Entertainer of the Year, Blues Soul Album of the Year, Soul Artist of the Year and Vocalist of the Year. This is a do not miss show of high energy and a whole lot of soul and funk! Wear blue to support BluSeed and see the best blues act today. There will be a musical silent auction of collectible musical items. VIP tickets include balcony access with tables and chairs, southern style appetizers and a meet and greet with the band.

Charlie Hunter Trio ft. Silvana Estrada

Thursday, March 29, 2018

8:00PM

Lovin' Cup

Rochester, NY

9
186466371934143

Charlie Hunter Trio ft. Silvana Estrada

Thursday, March 29, 2018 8:00PM

$ 15.00 / Age All Ages Additional Info: PRESENTED BY LOVIN' CUP & BOP SHOP RECORDSWith a career spanning 25 years and almost 20 albums, Charlie Hunter consistently ups his game as an innovative writer and bandleader. He has worked with the likes of Norah Jones, Mos Def, John Mayer, DAngelo and countless others. He is widely considered the authority on the seven and eight string guitar, and continues to stun audiences with his ability to simultaneously bust out tasty bass parts, melodic leads and swinging rhythms.Silvana Estrada, a native of Mexicos southeast, had just started her studies of Jazz at the University of Veracruz and quickly became known throughout the Jazz Studies Centre as a unique triple threat talent: an instrumentalist, playing the Cuatro Venezolano, vocalist and songwriter whose original compositions are a mixture of Latin American sounds and a vocal interpretation that comes from the son jarocho tradition of Veracruz.On a whim after rehearsing one day, Silvana and the band took a road trip to hear one of their heroes; Charlie Hunter was in Mexico City delivering a Master Class at the University. Inspired (and pushed by Alex the drummer) the band waited to meet Charlie whereupon Silvana sang for him on the spot. Charlie was so impressed that he ended up staying in Mexico, calling his sound engineer buddy Chris Finney from New Orleans and together they went to Silvanas magical hometown in the Southeastern hills of Mexico to record her debut album Lo Sagrado (The Sacred) that will be released on Charlies non profit 30 Amp Circuit later this month.DOORS @ 6:30PM | $15 ADVANCE / $20 DOSSHOW @ 8PM Tickets: http://www.ticketweb.com/event/charlie-hunter-trio-ft-silvana-lovin-cup-tickets/7945085?REFERRAL_ID=twfb

Hermanos vs. Wookies

Thursday, March 29, 2018

5:00PM

Three Heads Brewing

Rochester, NY

9
1975962805998099

Hermanos vs. Wookies

Thursday, March 29, 2018 5:00PM - Thursday, March 29, 2018 8:00PM

Three Heads Brewing and Bitter Honey are coming together for a fun event to help raise money for Stomping Ground. What are we doing? We are going to have people sign up to support Team Wookie (Three Heads) or Team Hermanos (Bitter Honey). Each team will have a special cask of Kind IPA that will be doctored up by Zack Mikida and a tray(s) of tacos made by Bitter Honey. The first team to finish their beer and tacos wins. What makes this fun is a couple of things. First off, there will be various levels of heat in the tacos and you might get a mild one or a very spicy one. It is the luck of the draw on which you pick. Secondly, the winner of the contest will be able to help add a new piece of decoration that must be prominently displayed at the losers establishment. If that isn't enough. A Girl Named Genny will be playing the brewery at 8 and covering So Far...by Crosby, Stills Nash & Young. All it takes is for you to come down between 5 and 6 to pay $10, pick your team and then eat and drink at 6pm when the contest starts. You are going to get some food, beer, music and also be helping to raise money for an incredible charity. Who's ready to have some fun?

Krish Mohan & Andrew Frank's Comedy Takeover w/ Malcolm & Kara

Thursday, March 29, 2018

8:00PM

Photo City Improv: Comedy & Music Venue

Rochester, NY

9
167986957132870

Krish Mohan & Andrew Frank's Comedy Takeover w/ Malcolm & Kara

Thursday, March 29, 2018 8:00PM - Thursday, March 29, 2018 10:00PM

The Anti-Imperialism Nationwide Comedy Takeover with Krish Mohan & Andrew Frank! An evening of Socially Conscious Comedy! Featuring: Malcolm Whitfeild & Kara Maillie Thursday March 29, 2018 at 8pm Doors at 7:30pm Live at the Photo City Improv $5 at the door About Andrew: Andrew Frank is a comedian based out of Chicago. His cerebral, imaginative style and relentless ethic have earned him three nationwide tours spanning a total of 42 cities. His love of language, philosophy, sociology, anthropology, and cosmology are on full display each time he takes the stage. He has had the privilege of working alongside great comedic minds such as Anthony Jeselnik, Kevin Nealon, Jake Johannsen, Bobcat Goldthwait, Chad Daniels, Tommy Johnagin, and many more. He was the Winner of Make Me Laugh 2015, The Winner of Go Bananas Comedy Club's Funniest in Cincinnati 2016, the Runner Up in Trial By Laughter 2015, and the Runner Up of Helium's Funniest in St. Louis 2016 Competition. He was selected as one of 32 comics to participate in the 38th Annual Seattle International Comedy Competition in November 2017. His first independently filmed hour special entitled Macrocosm was released in February 2017. Andrew continues to explore his mind and the minds of others at clubs, independent venues, and colleges all over the country. About Krish: Krish Mohan is a socially conscious, Indian standup comedian and writer who regularly tours the country. He performs at small theaters, bars, comedy clubs, colleges and DIY venues with his quirky attitude, charming personality, and intelligent humor. Krish captivates and engages audiences of all backgrounds, tackling hot button topics like race, religion, war, immigration, while adding an optimistic philosophical & sociological twist! Mohan has also been featured on NPR and performed at several Fringe Festivals (IndyFringe, Pittsburgh Fringe, Capital Fringe, Philly Fringe Arts), where he has been an audience favorite with his unique brand of comedy & social vigilantism. He has also opened for nationally touring headliners like Stewart Huff, Redacted Tonights Lee Camp and Hari Kondabolu. Krish is also the host of the weekly socio-political commentary web show, Fork Full of Noodles and the podcast Taboo Table Talk. Join the Takeover!

Sophistafunk w/Butter

Thursday, March 29, 2018

9:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
168393997112730

Sophistafunk w/Butter

Thursday, March 29, 2018 9:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Sophistafunk with Butter at The Haunt on 3/29!! 8:00pm Doors 9:00pm Show Sophistafunk http://sophistafunkband.com/ Known for their huge sound and tight musicianship, the band SOPHISTAFUNK is an unstoppable funk hip-hop dance party. Their presence is powerful, their lyrics are cutting edge, and their live shows are packed with passion and energy. Comprised of funkmaster Adam Gold, who sings, beatboxes, and plays up to four keyboards at the same time; soulful drummer / vocalist Emanuel Washington; and captivating front-man Jack Brown; the band recently welcomed their newest member: saxophonist Tommy Weeks of the Funky Dawgz Brass Band. In 2017, SOPHISTAFUNK was featured as the house band on five episodes of the Food Network show Guy‚Äôs Grocery Games. During the show, host Guy Fieri called them his ‚Äúfavorite band," which has been covered by new outlets such as The Village Voice (NYC) and BuzzFeed. They've also played four of his birthday parties and frequently entertain a wide array of celebrities. The band has released four studio albums, including their most recent double-LP "Real Vibration" (2017). This past October, a song from that record entitled "No More War" gained notoriety when its music video was premiered by Live for Live Music. This nationally renowned website also referred to them as "the hip hop band for the jam fan." From their home base in Syracuse NY, SOPHISTAFUNK has become a mainstay with national audiences spanning from electronic to jazz, reggae, and jam bands. Their coast-to-coast schedule includes frequent stops in New York City, Boston, New Orleans, Denver, San Francisco, & Seattle, among others Their festival resume includes Camp Bisco 2017, GrassRoots Festival of Music and Dance (five years running), as well as Horning‚Äôs Hideout in Oregon and Spirit of the Suwannee Music Park in Florida. The band has also toured the UK multiple times, performing to 50,000+ at the giant international festivals BoomTown and Shambala. As a result, they were featured in a 2015 Relix Magazine article entitled "Five Bands You Should Know." Every show features vintage tones, live improvisation, and surprise guests. The band loves collaborating with different musicians, from the late great Bernie Worrell to drummers Tommy Lee of Motley Crue and Nikki Glaspie of Nth Power/Beyonce. In 2016, SOPHISTAFUNK recorded a live show featuring five members of Snarky Puppy (2x Grammy winner). Their versatility allows them to support a wide variety of national bands, such as Snarky Puppy, Rebelution, SOJA, Bass Nectar, Disco Biscuits, Lettuce, & Soulive (to name a few), as well as classic acts such as Aretha Franklin, Parliament Funkadelic, Foreigner, Rakim, & KRS One. They have also toured extensively with The Motet, Orgone, Fishbone, Turkuaz, Kung Fu, & Ivan Neville‚Äôs Dumpstaphunk. In 2016, SOPHISTAFUNK rocked a full house at the Aria Resort in Las Vegas, playing after Zac Brown Band. The guys still maintain a close personal connection with Guy Fieri, frequently playing private parties for him and his friends across the country. They first met in 2013 while performing on his show Diners, Drive-Ins, & Dives at the restaurant/music venue Funk ‚Äòn Waffles, which is owned by keyboardist Adam Gold. Butter Formed in March 2016 by guitarist Nicky Young and Jonah Bobo, Butter has made it‚Äôs mission to bring funky music to as many people as they could. From the first rehearsal, the whole band knew that this group could be something special. Since then, Butter has played several events on and off the Ithaca College campus, growing as a unit and delivering an increasingly exciting show for their audiences.

State Theatre of Ithaca

Demetri Martin: Let‚Äôs Get Awkward Tour

DSP Shows Demetri Martin: Let's Get Awkward Tour Friday, March 30th 8:00pm State Theatre of Ithaca Ithaca, NY Demetri Martin rose to relative obscurity when he started doing stand-up comedy in New York City at the end of the 20th Century. Later he became a writer at Late Night with Conan O‚ÄôBrien and then a regular performer on The Daily Show with Jon Stewart. In 2003, Demetri won the Perrier Award at the International Fringe Festival for his first one-man show, If I. He released a comedy album called These Are Jokes and then created and starred in his own television series called Important Things with Demetri Martin. His first stand-up comedy special, Demetri Martin. Person is considered by many to be his longest and only hour-long stand-up comedy special. Martin has appeared in movies as an actor, most recently in Steven Soderbergh‚Äôs Contagion and most lengthily in Ang Lee‚Äôs Taking Woodstock. His first book, This Is a Book by Demetri Martin is a New York Times Bestseller. At the 2016 Tribeca Film Festival, Demetri Martin‚Äôs film Dean won The Founders Award for Best Narrative Feature.

Grippo Funk Band with DJ Rekkon at Nectar's

Friday, March 30, 2018

9:00PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
395249477611347

Grippo Funk Band with DJ Rekkon at Nectar's

Friday, March 30, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, March 31, 2018 12:00AM

9pm doors 21+ $7 ~~~~~~~~ Grippo Funk Band The Grippo Funk Band got its start at Burlington VT‚Äôs Red Square in 1999 when alto saxophonist Dave Grippo gathered some of his favorite musicians together to jam on Monday nights. This humble beginning led to an unbroken string of Mondays at the Square that lasted nearly seven years. These legendary gigs served as a funk-style bootcamp where the GFB explored the deep cuts of James Brown, Maceo Parker, Sly Stone, and countless other R&B legends. Musicians touring with Dr. John, Soulive, Maceo, Beyonce Knowles, The Neville Brothers, and saxophonist Chris Potter would often make it a point to stop by and jam when in town on a Monday night. The GFB took it in, mixed it up, stirred the pot, and as months turned to years they developed their own ensemble sound and ‚Äòheartbeat in unison‚Äô deadly locked-down grooves. The GFB has also been exceptionally fortunate to benefit from the contributions of many outstanding performers through the years such as drummer Kenny ‚ÄúSweet Sugar‚Äù Gulfield; MC‚Äôs Fatty B (of Belizbeha), Reko The Mighty Konflik, and Manus; singer/songwriter/trumpeter Jennifer Hartswick (of Trey Anastasio‚Äôs band and solo artist); trombonists James Harvey, Ben Smeltzer, and Andy Moroz (also from Trey‚Äôs band); guest guitarists Nick Cassarino and Benny ‚ÄúJFC that‚Äôs good chicken‚Äù Yurco (of Grace Potter and The Nocturnals); DJ‚Äôs A-Dog, Nastee, and Zach ‚ÄúZJ‚Äù Johnson; and many more. This extended family often grows the band to 7, 8, 9, or 10 strong at area nightclubs but these six core musicians remain a constant.

The John Payton Project is back on the scene. They have played here twice since their return and both shows have been great parties. They weave a kaleidoscopic soundscape that spans decades and nations. Not disjointed, but nebulous; tight, but soulful; frenetic, but funky, and always so very danceable, the John Payton Project can surely hold down a crowd. Come get normal with us. We are thrilled for the return of Rochester Soul Superstar Danielle Ponder & The Tommorow Poeple. Special Guests are local Old Time Jazz outfit The Cool Club & The Lipker Sisters!!! GA Tickets $10 adv. $15 at the door. Tickets will be on sale starting Friday March 9th. Join us for a Soul, Jazz, and Funk filled fundraiser for ADELANTE Student Voices, a program started by Geneva resident Gabriela Quintanilla that helps undocumented high school students from rural NY learn about and gain access to secondary education. Come and celebrate music, diversity, and the country we call home, and help make a difference for the future generations!

Foam N' Glow Syracuse, NY "World's Largest Foam Party"

Saturday, March 31, 2018 9:00PM - Sunday, April 1, 2018 1:00AM

Foam N' Glow "World's Largest Foam Party" Presents: Foam N' Glow Syracuse, NY Saturday March 31st, 2018 Feat: Corbin Kelly & Special Guest, HRD-DRV, KEN3TIC, KIDD, ILLUSION The show concept leads fans on a journey of unimaginable atmospheres and unforgettable emotions. A concert revolution that has swept the world of electronic dance music, blurring the line between fantasy and reality. With state of the art visual effects, ground shaking bass, and World class DJs. Foam N' Glow ‚ÄúWorld‚Äôs Largest Foam Party‚Äù Fuses High-Energy Music, Ultraviolet Dancers, Contortionists, Stilt Walkers, Fire Performers, Soaring Ariel Acts, CO2 Shows & the ever so famous FOAM N' GLOW BLAST, Into One Mind Blowing Combination. FAQs ACCEPTABLE FORMS OF ID Any US government-issued driver‚Äôs license or ID card containing a photograph and date of birth. US or foreign government-issued passport containing a photograph and date of birth. Foreign government-issued driver‚Äôs license/ID with color photocopy of passport (not valid for 21+ wristband. To purchase alcohol or enter VIP areas, a physical passport or US ID will be required.) Temporary DMV documents proving you are currently renewing a license ‚Äî ONLY if accompanied by passport or expired license WHAT TO BRING WITH YOU Valid Photo ID Your ticket via print out or scannable barcode on your phone Neon or White comfortable clothing and shoes Smiles, friends and good vibes EVENT POLICIES NO Refunds or exchanges NO Sitting in designated dance floor areas NO Moshing, crowd-surfing or stage-diving NO Unauthorized or unlicensed vendors NO Unauthorized solicitations, giveaways, sampling, etc. DISCLAIMER YOU ARE PUT ON WARNING: that you are entering these premises and participating in a ‚ÄúFOAM N' GLOW EVENT‚Äù at your own risk, which you voluntarily assume. Although we have taken precautions to make this FOAM PARTY safe and enjoyable, we cannot and do not guarantee that accidents or other mishaps, perhaps resulting in serious injury will occur. If you have any doubts or misgivings about your safety, well being, or personal property, you have the right to not participate in this event by not entering into this establishment. FOAM N' GLOW expressly disclaims responsibility or liability for any and all injuries, accidents or other occurrences which may result in damages to any individual or group participates in the "FOAM N' GLOW EVENT‚Äù. Take extreme caution, the floor and other surfaces will become slippery. Please govern yourself accordingly. Although the FOAM used is considered safe, persons with allergies, skin disorders, open wounds or any other ailments or conditions should consult a doctor before entering the FOAM. All persons should avoid eye contact and taking FOAM internally. The FOAM (a detergent) will cause dermatitis in certain individuals if left on the skin for an extended amount of time. Removal of wet clothing, bathing and using a moisturizer is advised. Enjoy yourself and please respect all other participants.

The Elementals w/ Redbeard Samurai

Saturday, March 31, 2018

10:00PM

ButaPub

Rochester, NY

9
988346761318451

The Elementals w/ Redbeard Samurai

Saturday, March 31, 2018 10:00PM - Sunday, April 1, 2018 12:45AM

The Elementals began their union in Rochester NY with the catchy, smooth and stylistic song "Down The Drain". What began as the remnants of local bands AudioInflux and Megalodonis, flourished into this musical phenom. The quartet draws heavily on the flavors of Funk, Jazz, Hip Hop, RnB and Alternative. The group's influences include the likes of Haitus Kaiyote, Robert Glasper, Raphael Sadiiq, Miles Davis, Erykah Badu and Bruno Mars. Redbeard Samurai is an artist and producer employing hip hop to craft party anthems laced with introspective funk. As a conservatory trained jazz guitarist from the Eastman School of Music, Redbeard Samurai expertly weaves elements of RnB, jazz, and soul into hip hop for a complete musical experience. Clever, artful and cool. Come join us for a truly interesting night.
