- Mosaic Foundation (original roots reggae from NY) - Outside Event - $5 Cover - Food Trucks - Live Painting - 21+ to Drink ----------------------- With a style as unique as its members are diverse, Mosaic Foundation is forward thinking reggae that stays true to the roots. Formed in 2009 and based in the Finger Lakes region of New York, the band has grown a loyal following, thanks to electric live performances and three studio releases. Blending roots, ska, dub, dance-hall and beyond, Mosaic is an exploration in reggae that is pushed to the limits and sometimes spills over. With lyrics that inspire dancing in the moment, and activate the mind in reflection, the songs encourage positivity, sustainable living and community. mosaicfoundationmusic.bandcamp.com youtube.com/channel/UCyN5_xyUDJdKWquKkk7ft_A

EXPANSIONS ‚Äì THE DAVE LIEBMAN GROUP

Saturday, May 5, 2018

8:00PM

Lovin' Cup

Rochester, NY

9
1859165854157355

EXPANSIONS ‚Äì THE DAVE LIEBMAN GROUP

Saturday, May 5, 2018 8:00PM

$ 15.00 - $20.00 / Age All Ages Additional Info: BOP SHOP RECORDS & BOP ARTS INC. presentEXPANSIONS THE DAVE LIEBMAN GROUPSATURDAY, MAY 5, 8PMLovin Cup Bistro & Brews300 Park Point Drive,Rochester,NY$20 advance / $25 at the door. Students $15Tickets on sale at Bop Shop Records, Lovin Cup andon line.Dave Liebmansnew group looks towards the present generation of jazz musicians who have been schooled in conservatory and university settings. Lieb is continuing the time tested tradition of master/apprentice as he experienced in the 1970s with drummer Elvin Jones and Miles Davis, by reaching across generations to teach and learn from them. EXPANSIONS features the up and coming pianist Bobby Avey, reedman Matt Vashlishan, drummer Alex Ritz and a continuation of Liebs long relationship with bassist Tony Marino. Conceptually, the repertoire traverses elements of free jazz and re-arrangements of standards all infused withthe complex time signatures and harmonies being explored by the new jazz artists of our time. The first recording will be released in 2014Samsara (Whaling City Sound).David Liebmans career has spanned over four decades, beginning in the 1970s as the saxophone/flautist in both the Elvin Jones and Miles Davis Groups, continuing as a leader since. He has played on nearly three hundred recordings with over one hundred under his leadership or co-leadership. In jazz education he is a renowned lecturer and author of several milestone books:Self Portrait Of A Jazz Artist, A Chromatic Approach To Jazz Harmony And Melody, Developing A Personal Saxophone Sound, translated into several languages, in addition to teaching DVDs, journalistic contributions to periodicals and published chamber music.He is the Founder and Artistic Director of the International Association of Schools of Jazz (IASJ) existing since 1989. Awards include (Jazz Educators Network Legend of Jazz (2013); National Endowment of the Arts Masters of Jazz (2011); the Order of Arts and Letters (France 2009); Jazz Journalists award for Soprano Saxophone (2007); Grammy nomination for Best Jazz Solo (1998); Honorary Doctorate from the Sibelius Academy (Finland-1997). He is currently Artist in Residence at the Manhattan School of Music and has consistently placed in the top three places for Soprano Saxophone in the Downbeat Critics Poll since 1973, winning first place in both the Downbeat and Jazz Times Critics Poll in both 2011 and 2012. (Complete bio at davidliebman.com)http://davidliebman.com/home/ Tickets: http://www.ticketweb.com/event/expansions-the-dave-liebman-lovin-cup-tickets/7921175?REFERRAL_ID=twfb

Lowest Of The Low

Saturday, May 5, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
345404069291469

Lowest Of The Low

Saturday, May 5, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Lowest Of The Low at The Haunt on 5/5!! 7:00pm Doors 8:00pm Show Lowest Of The Low http://www.lowestofthelow.com/ Lowest of the Low rose to prominence after the release of their 1991 debut album Shakespeare‚Ä¶.My Butt ‚Äî 17 tracks of smart, spiky, socially conscious folk-rock that were assembled from the character sketches and journal entries in Ron Hawkins‚Äô ever present- notebook as he wandered the streets of Toronto. The end result was an eloquent love letter to the city and its people. It‚Äôs 2017 and they are back with a new album and a fresh attitude. ‚ÄúDo The Right Now‚Äù the 2017 album is a near-perfect embodiment of the Low‚Äôs evolution as a band. It‚Äôs got the clever wordplay, razor-sharp hooks, meaty riffs and airtight harmonies that permeate their back-catalogue, but also benefits from a broader sonic palette that can only come with experience and experimentation. It‚Äôs a thrilling natural progression of their insistent sound, and it manages to pull off a pretty sly, contradictory trick, too: it‚Äôs a modern treatise on living in the moment that simultaneously manages to take an over-the-shoulder glance at the group‚Äôs own past. The songs on Do The Right Now are united by a common, overarching theme: the importance of mindfulness, of being present in an age of distraction rather than fixating on the future or being a slave to your past. ‚ÄúTomorrow‚Äôs a lie and yesterday‚Äôs gone,‚Äù as the title track asserts.The album encourages the carpe‚Äôing of many diems, it also allows for you to sit back and listen to great album start to finish.

http://lovelytheband.com/ A sleek-toned indie pop band in the vein of MGMT and Foster the People, Los Angeles trio lovelytheband formed in West Hollywood in 2016. Led by former Oh Honey member Mitchy Collins along with guitarist Jordan Greenwald, and drummer Sam Price, the band debuted in July 2017 with "Broken," a sprightly and infectious single that quickly racked up over five million streams on Spotify. Signing with Another Century Records (Sony RED MUSIC), lovelytheband released their debut EP, ‚Äúeverything i could never say‚Ä¶‚Äù, in September of that year.

Brandi Carlile

Tuesday, May 8, 2018

8:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
321162831714357

Brandi Carlile

Tuesday, May 8, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows: Brandi Carlile Tuesday, May 8th 8:00pm The State Theatre Ithaca NY By The Way, I Forgive You is not an album about forgiveness in the easy sense‚Äîwhere someone has hurt you and then suddenly there‚Äôs a great reconciliation and a remorse-filled scene with two people running across the golden wheat field towards an embrace that somehow undoes a lifetime of pain and damage, as if the past has no meaning. It‚Äôs about radical acceptance (not to be confused with complacency) and unconditional love. Whoever is reading this, your parents will die. You may have been hurt or loved by them, probably both. But can you forgive them for leaving in the end? We are a powerful generation witnessing war and division like never before, yet somehow this is the safest time to be alive in human history. Can we love one another as ourselves? More importantly, can we love ourselves at all? The songs alone aren‚Äôt universal messages, they are personal stories of our parents and childhood, our divorces, oppressive religion, the fact that marriage is hard and having children is terrifying, even the sting of death. It is the story of forgiveness, that despite all this keeps us innocently climbing out of bed every morning open to love‚Äîbig terrible trembling love. I don‚Äôt love you because you‚Äôve done what I think you should do with your life. I love you whatever you do, but I‚Äôve got a life to live too. And, by the way, I forgive you.

SOLD OUT: Lake Street Dive w/ Mikaela Davis at Higher Ground

Tuesday, May 8, 2018

8:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
183055485643616

SOLD OUT: Lake Street Dive w/ Mikaela Davis at Higher Ground

Tuesday, May 8, 2018 8:00PM

http://www.lakestreetdive.com The title of Lake Street Dive‚Äôs Free Yourself Up is both an exhortation to listeners and a statement of purpose for the band. The songs have an infectious swagger, even when dealing with awkward breakups or the unsettled state of our world. Free Yourself Up is Lake Street Dive‚Äôs most confident album yet, seriously soulful and exuberantly rocking. And, in many ways, it is Lake Street Dive‚Äôs most intimate and collaborative, with the band itself taking over the production reins and working as a tightly knit unit to craft these ten songs. In addition, the quartet drafted touring keyboardist Akie Bermiss to join them in the studio, literally freeing the band up to explore a wider range of instrumental textures, construct more full-bodied arrangements, and build stacks of lively background harmonies. On Free Yourself Up, the sound is influenced by late sixties-early seventies R&B, AM pop, and FM rock while the lyrics are informed more by contemporary events. The album opens with ‚ÄúBaby, Don‚Äôt Leave Me Alone With My Thoughts,‚Äù which envisions a lover acting as a ‚Äúhuman shield‚Äù against the anxiety of our Twitter-ravaged age. It‚Äôs funny, sweet, a little angry, and definitely right up-to-the-minute in its sentiment. Singer Rachael Price says, ‚ÄúI thought about that song as the thesis of this record. It‚Äôs a disco-dance fun song but it‚Äôs also a person talking about needing comfort from another person, and it has a reference to the political climate.‚Äù The lyrics to the guitar-driven ‚ÄúShame, Shame, Shame,‚Äù which feels like undiscovered, transistor-radio-ready AM gold, bravely speak to an unnamed person: ‚ÄúNo I‚Äôm not getting caught in your little spider web/Won‚Äôt let an angry dog get me down/Don‚Äôt you think it‚Äôs time we put this dog out of his misery?/Change is coming, oh yeah‚Ä¶‚Äù Bassist Bridget Kearney explains, ‚ÄúThis album is based in the realities in our time, which have inevitably become part of everyone‚Äôs daily life. It‚Äôs something you think about and obsess over‚Äîand write songs about. Free Yourself Up is about empowering yourself, emboldening yourself, no matter what‚Äôs going wrong.‚Äù

Donna The Buffalo

Friday, May 11, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Donna the Buffalo at The Dock on 5/11!! 7:00pm Doors 8:00pm Show Donna the Buffalo http://www.donnathebuffalo.com/ One of the most dynamic and determined bands continuously touring America for since 1989, Donna the Buffalo has created a community environment at their shows through their distinctive, groove-heavy, and danceable music. Donna the Buffalo is a band for the people that is accessible, positive, and memorable. With roots in old time fiddle music that evolved into a soulful electric American mix infused with elements of cajun/ zydeco, rock, folk, reggae, and country, Donna‚Äôs music often contains social and moral responsibility as core beliefs, and they are just simply fun to get out and celebrate life with. Donna the Buffalo drew its original inspiration from a cherished part of the American heritage: the old-time music festivals of the south that drew entire towns and counties together. Not only was it playing music at these events, it was the vibe and the togetherness that bonded the people that attended.

Friday May 11th - Giant Panda Guerilla Dub Squad w/ Root Shock Doors: 8:00pm, Show: 9:00pm - Tickets: $15 ADV/$18 DOS - Ages: 18+ ________________________________ Giant Panda Guerilla Dub Squad: Giant Panda Guerilla Dub Squad‚Äôs sixth studio album MAKE IT BETTER was released September 16, 2016 on Rootfire Cooperative. It debuted at #1 on the Billboard Reggae Chart. Formed in 2001 in Rochester, New York, GPGDS first received praise for their live show, which combined world beats and reggae rhythms within jamband aesthetics. In recent years the band‚Äôs studio recordings, which showcase their songwriting and musicianship across all genres of roots music, have further cemented their legend as master innovators and artists. ‚ÄúThere is a lot of intention in this release. We had a purpose to prove to ourselves recording this album [MAKE IT BETTER]. We wanted to know that we could put our heads down and do good work fast. It was a great release artistically. It uniquely sounds the most progressive of anything we have ever done while also sounding the most like our first album.‚Äù -James Searl, Bassist/Vocalist Root Shock: Root SHOCK was formed in Winter of 2012 with veteran musicians whose love of reggae music flows deep. Blending roots reggae, dancehall, heavy drum & bass and soulful vocals with conscious lyrics into positive dance music will make you want to move! Root Shock has been surprising and delighting crowds across the Central New York region, bringing their unique high-energy style spearheaded by the stunning vocals of Jessica Brown to a wide range of settings. The band‚Äôs dedication to spreading music with a positive message has paid off in entertaining, elevating, and energizing music lovers of all walks of life!

Fleetmac Wood Presents Rumours Rave - Burlington, VT

Saturday, May 12, 2018

9:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
444570292624312

Fleetmac Wood Presents Rumours Rave - Burlington, VT

Saturday, May 12, 2018 9:00PM

05.12.18 Higher Ground, Burlington 21:00 - late Tickets: http://bit.ly/fmwrrburtix In February 1977, Rumours by Fleetwood Mac was born after a lengthy labour of love. We are thrilled to announce that we will be adding Burlington to our Rumours Rave Tour. Over the last year we've hosted our celebrations in San Francisco, Los Angeles, NYC, London, Berlin and many more cities, hedonistically celebrating one of the greatest albums of all time with remixes and edits of the album and back catalogue with DJs: Roxanne Roll and Smooth Sailing How could we better the perfect album? We simply cannot, but we will have fun re-framing it for the dance floor. If you haven‚Äôt heard of our project before then have a listen to what it‚Äôs all about: www.soundcloud.com/fleetmacwood Since 2012, we have been hosting our tunnel-visioned event and celebrating the extensive back catalogue of Fleetwood Mac. With a curated and created assortment of remixes and edits we‚Äôve shared our passion with like-minded hedonists all over the world. We‚Äôve twirled in the mud at Glastonbury and tipped our top hat to the dust at Burning Man. We‚Äôve always felt that there is so much more to Fleetwood Mac than Rumours. To us it‚Äôs just one of the many great albums they have produced, and often the ‚Äògateway‚Äô drug for a new fan. What is undeniable is that you can play any song from this album and there will be applause. It is perfectly formed but not over-produced, even it‚Äôs cover design by Herbert Worthington is an example of classic elegance. The only complaint from us is that Silver Springs couldn‚Äôt also fit within its lacquer grooves, an omission will we be remedying at this party. Dress code: 1977 or your best celebratory sparkles. Sounds like: http://bit.ly/fmwvol6 Feels like: http://bit.ly/rrvidfmw Yes we have T-shirts http://fleetmacwood.bigcartel.com Facebook: http://bit.ly/fmwfacebookpage Twitter: http://bit.ly/fmwtwitter Instagram: http://bit.ly/fmwinsta Soundcloud: http://bit.ly/fmwsoundcloud Youtube: http://bit.ly/fmwytpg Vimeo: http://bit.ly/fmwvimeo

Saranac Lake, NY

Root Shock Waterhole Music Lounge 48 Main St., Saranac Lake, NY 8pm Doors 9pm Show $10.00 - 21+ www.saranaclakewaterhole.com Root Shock - Syracuse - NY High Energy Roots Soul Reggae http://www.rootshockmusic.com/ Root SHOCK was formed in Winter of 2012 with veteran musicians whose love of reggae music flows deep. Blending roots reggae, dancehall, heavy drum & bass and soulful vocals with conscious lyrics into positive dance music will make you want to move! Root Shock has been surprising and delighting crowds across the Central New York region, bringing their unique high-energy style spearheaded by the stunning vocals of Jessica Brown to a wide range of settings. The band‚Äôs dedication to spreading music with a positive message has paid off in entertaining, elevating, and energizing music lovers of all walks of life!

SOLD OUT: Shakey Graves w/ And The Kids at Higher Ground

Saturday, May 12, 2018

8:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
1972204452997618

SOLD OUT: Shakey Graves w/ And The Kids at Higher Ground

Saturday, May 12, 2018 8:30PM

Narragansett Beer and Farrell Distributing proudly welcome Shakey Graves to Higher Ground! http://shakeygraves.com/ Back in December 2017, Shakey Graves proclaimed on his Twitter page, ‚ÄúNext album. New sound. Sell your suspenders.‚Äù The tweet was tongue-in-cheek, but Alejandro Rose-Garcia, the Austin native who‚Äôs been plying his trade as Shakey Graves since 2007, was making a dead-serious point about his latest album, Can‚Äôt Wake Up (Dualtone, out May 4). This ambitious, audacious work heralds an artistic metamorphosis for the 30-year-old veteran, whose risk-taking in painting outside the lines has been rewarded tenfold. ‚ÄúThis record is the most I‚Äôve ever intentionally worked on a project, musically speaking, in terms of the scope of it and how much thought went into it,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a dense album; there‚Äôs a lot of information going on.‚Äù That is not a hyperbolic boast. From one moment to the next, Can‚Äôt Wake Up veers from the inevitable to the revelatory, its thirteen songs teeming with jarring musical and thematic collisions and thrillingly seamless intersections, gnarly psychological hornswoggles and ecstatic resolutions. Central to the prevailing sense of disorientation are the lead vocals, none of which is purely solo. Instead, each lead performance is shadowed by a queasy harmony or slightly out-of-sync unison part, giving the sense‚Äîespecially on headphones‚Äîthat these voices are emanating from inside the listener‚Äôs head. Newfound inspirations the Beatles and Harry Nilsson (‚ÄúI could only deny the inevitable for so long,‚Äù he says of his belated immersion in the sacred texts) cohered around Rose-Garcia‚Äôs longtime touchstones, including Elliott Smith, Beck circa One Foot in the Grave, Broken Social Scene, Built to Spill and other indie bands of the 1990s and early oughts. ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never worked like this before, but I went into the record with the idea of having a thesis statement of what I wanted to get across,‚Äù Rose-Garcia explains. ‚ÄúAnd the place that I got at was that I wanted it to be vaguely Wizard of Oz-themed, and I wanted it to be hectic and a little uncomfortable, like what I refer to as the Big Five Disney cartoons: Pinocchio, Fantasia, Snow White, Dumbo and Bambi. All those movies are terrifying‚Äîsome of the most stressful movies I‚Äôve ever seen. So I started with this Wizard of Oz thing‚Äî‚ÄôTin Man‚Äô that has obvious allusions to that‚Äîand the idea of black-and-white to color.‚Äù The creative process was paralleled by the conception and execution of the striking, hallucinatory cover art. ‚ÄúI built an elaborate miniature diorama in my house and used plexiglass plates, paint and train set buildings to create a forced-perspective illusion and photographed it,‚Äù Rose-Garcia explains. ‚ÄúThe goal was to have the cover and the process to mirror the album in a way, and I am thrilled with how it turned out.‚Äù

Blackberry Smoke Find A Light Tour at Anthology

Sunday, May 13, 2018

7:00PM

ANTHOLOGY

Rochester, NY

9
149326315759997

Blackberry Smoke Find A Light Tour at Anthology

Sunday, May 13, 2018 7:00PM - Sunday, May 13, 2018 11:30PM

BLACKBERRY SMOKE FIND A LIGHT TOUR 2018 SUNDAY, MAY 13th Doors 6:00 PM | $27 adv | All Ages WITH: Special Guest TYLER BRYANT & THE SHAKEDOWN TICKETS & INFO | www.ticketfly.com/purchase/event/1654343 Tickets are available without online fees at ANTHOLOGY 336 East Ave. | By phone 585.484.1964 | And Box Office on Fridays 10:30am - 5:30pm. Tickets are also available at The Record Archive, Hart's Market, and Aaron's Alley. FOLLOW ANTHOLOGY: More Shows - www.anthologylive.com Twitter - www.twitter.com/anthologylive Facebook - www.facebook.com/Anthology Instagram - @AnthologyPresents Blackberry Smoke has never been a band that stands still. Whether pursuing the dream by logging hundreds of thousands of miles on America‚Äôs highways and abroad or relentlessly exploring the many facets of its most unique art form, the Atlanta quintet is always on the move. The songs on Blackberry Smoke‚Äôs sixth album, Like an Arrow show just how far this authentic American rock band has come as the accomplished group of musicians tackles a diverse set of new ideas, sounds and territories, long after most bands with half the success might have settled into a well-worn groove. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre all likeminded in that we all want to explore,‚Äù singer and principal songwriter Charlie Starr said. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs just no way we could make the same record over and over again, though there are some fans who would like us to. That‚Äôs just way too formulaic. If the Beatles or Led Zeppelin did that, we wouldn‚Äôt love them as much.‚Äù Like An Arrow continues the trend of sonic exploration established on the Blackberry Smoke‚Äôs previous two releases, 2012‚Äôs The Whippoorwill and 2015‚Äôs chart-topping Holding All the Roses. It kicks off with the band‚Äôs heaviest song to date and explores British rock before moving on to musical stops in places like Macon, Woodstock, Muscle Shoals and Tulsa as Starr and his buddies follow the ramblin‚Äô examples of timeless, authentic acts like The Allman Brothers Band, JJ Cale, The Band and others who define rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll in all its many facets. ‚ÄúWe just want the sound of the band to continue to grow and broaden. We‚Äôre not trying to make a hip-hop record,‚Äù Starr said with a laugh. ‚ÄúBut there‚Äôs so many elements to what people call rock. There‚Äôs gospel and country and swing and blues. We‚Äôre just trying to write songs that include all those different types of elements. It keeps it interesting for musicians and songwriters. You think, ‚ÄòWell, I don‚Äôt have a straitjacket on, I haven‚Äôt painted myself into a corner, so I can try and just make the most of this art form.‚Äô‚Äù That‚Äôs what Starr (lead vocals, guitar), Paul Jackson (guitar, vocals), Brandon Still (keyboards), Brit Turner (leads drums) and Richard Turner (bass, vocals) have been doing for 16 years now after forming in 2001. The quintet‚Äôs blue-collar work ethic, road-dog attitude ‚Äì the band averages 250 shows a year ‚Äì and willingness to jam all night long have left Blackberry Smoke with a grassroots fan base that continues to grow show by show. Holding All the Roses, produced by Grammy Award winner Brendan O‚ÄôBrien, debuted at No. 1 on the Billboard Country Albums chart and No. 7 on the Rock Albums chart, proof of the band‚Äôs universality. Praised by fellow artists as diverse as Dierks Bentley and ZZ Top‚Äôs Billy Gibbons, Blackberry Smoke now delivers an album that should invite even more fans under its revival tent. Produced by the band with O‚ÄôBrien‚Äôs engineer Billy Bowers handling the recording, Like An Arrow sounds and feels exactly how the band wanted it to. ‚ÄúI think that it pleasantly surprised everybody involved,‚Äù Starr said. ‚ÄúNot that I think working with a producer is a bad thing because it‚Äôs a very good thing. But sometimes you just go with your gut and my gut told me, ‚ÄòLet‚Äôs make this record.‚Äô We stretched out on some songs, of course, and obviously the record is a bit more hi-fi than my homemade demos. But it really was going back to let‚Äôs get in a room and play the music.‚Äù Like An Arrow leads off with ‚ÄúWaiting For The Thunder,‚Äù a song driven by dark images, towering guitars and Still‚Äôs storm-driven B3 Hammond organ. Starr says the song sets the tone for where the album lives. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs dynamic and big, it‚Äôs exciting,‚Äù Starr said. ‚ÄúWhen we recorded it, from the very beginning, I felt like this was going to be the song that would lead off the record because it sort of stands alone as far as the level of excitement that the song throws at you, just right off the bat.‚Äù The band continues its exploration of amped-up territory on the title track, a psychedelic blast of heavy metal transcendentalism. ‚ÄúThere are some songs that are heavier than anything we‚Äôve ever recorded ‚Äì it‚Äôs a far cry,‚Äù Starr said. ‚Äú‚ÄôLike An Arrow‚Äô is the closest thing to Black Sabbath that I think we‚Äôve ever recorded in a way. I think it surprised everybody when we pressed record and started to play it. We were like, ‚ÄòOh, my God, this thing is massive.‚Äô‚Äù Blackberry Smoke heads hard in the other direction, too, backing off the four-on-the-floor for different textures. ‚ÄúBelieve You Me,‚Äù for instance, is a disco-tinged, bottom-heavy blast of country funk. ‚ÄúIt is one of the handful of departures on the record,‚Äù Starr said. ‚Äú‚ÄôWaiting For The Thunder‚Äô or ‚ÄòLike An Arrow‚Äô might place the album in a certain genre ‚Äì whichever box might make you feel comfortable ‚Äì and ‚ÄòBelieve You Me‚Äô will come along and shake up the norm. It‚Äôs not what I would consider formulaic.‚Äù ‚ÄúSunrise In Texas,‚Äù a Michael Tolcher song that‚Äôs been a fixture in Blackberry Smoke‚Äôs live set for a decade, finally makes it onto album here, also because of its uniqueness. The song opens with dobro and electric piano before building to a long-form crescendo that lets the band show off its well-honed musicianship. ‚ÄúRunning Through Time,‚Äù written with friend Travis Meadows, takes a look at life through the eyes of an old man looking back at the struggles of his youth on a song that‚Äôs carried along on an airy, lilting guitar line like nothing else the band‚Äôs recorded. ‚ÄúWe both led wild lives throughout our 20s and some of our 30s, doing similar types of bad things,‚Äù Starr said. ‚ÄúAnd we laugh about it now. And so we were talking about writing a song about that idea: Who he is now and what he might have learned ‚Äì and maybe what he didn‚Äôt. The yin and the yang of the young and old man. That‚Äôs the trippy one. That‚Äôs the mushroom song. Like JJ Cale recording in Muscle Shoals.‚Äù Gregg Allman joins the band on ‚ÄúFree On The Wing,‚Äù a song that brings it all back home after the musical journey. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a very Macon, Georgia, kinda song,‚Äù Starr said. ‚ÄúTo me that type of song just embodies the whole Southern rock idea to me. Because it sounds like it came out of the river, out of the Chattahoochee, out of the Southeastern United States where we all grew up. And to have Gregg Allman sing on it perfectly completes it.‚Äù

Brian Regan

1959859020928159

Brian Regan

Sunday, May 13, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows: Brian Regan Sunday, May 13th 8:00pm The State Theatre Ithaca NY Setting a comedic standard of excellence that others continually try to follow, Brian Regan made history on September 26, 2015 with the critically-acclaimed live broadcast of Brian Regan: Live From Radio City Music Hall, the first live broadcast of a stand-up special in Comedy Central‚Äôs history. And on May 8, 2015, Brian made his 28th and final stand-up performance on Late Show With David Letterman, the most of any comic since the show moved to CBS in 1993. Brian is the unique comedian whose material is relatable to generations of fans and revered by comedians as the best in the business: ‚ÄúHe is one of my favorite, favorite stand-up comedians.‚Äù - Jerry Seinfeld ‚ÄúNo comedian in the world says, 'Yeah, I want to follow Brian Regan.'" ‚Äì Chris Rock ‚ÄúBrian Regan is one of my favorite comedians ever. He is unbelievably funny.‚Äù ‚Äì Jimmy Fallon ‚ÄúSaw Brian Regan last night at the Arlington Theater in Santa Barbara. In a word (or three) Simply the Best!‚Äù ‚Äì Dennis Miller ‚ÄúBrian Regan is one of my favorite comics of all time, he‚Äôs just the best...an absolute master.‚Äù ‚Äì Bill Burr ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre one of the rare guys that is universally respected by comics as being one of the most hilarious guys out there at stand-up.‚Äù ‚Äì Joe Rogan ‚ÄúHonestly, Brian Regan‚Äôs the best stand-up working today. Period.‚Äù ‚Äì Patton Oswalt ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre the guy people look up to...Brian Regan‚Äôs the funniest guy...there‚Äôs Brian Regan and then there‚Äôs other people.‚Äù ‚Äì Marc Maron Earlier this year Brian made a scene-stealing cameo in Chris Rock‚Äôs film, Top Five and he was seen in Seinfeld‚Äôs Comedians in Cars Getting Coffee. But it is stand-up comedy that is Brian‚Äôs focus visiting close to 100 cities each year and selling out some of the most beautiful venues on the continent. Brian returned to the legendary, 8600-seat Red Rocks Amphitheater on September 5, 2015 and on March 18 & 19 he will return to the 12,500-seat Vivint Smart Home Arena in Salt Lake City where he sold out two shows in 2014. Brian has released three hour-long TV specials, three CD‚Äôs and four DVD‚Äôs: Brian Regan: Live From Radio City Music Hall (2015) is airing on Comedy Central and is available on CD & DVD and as a video or audio download; All By Myself (2010) is available on CD and download only through his website; his two previous hour-long Comedy Central specials, The Epitome of Hyperbole (2008), and Brian Regan Standing Up (2007) are available on DVD; I Walked on the Moon (2004) is available on DVD or as an audio or video download only through his website and Brian Regan Live (1997) is available on CD.

Matthew Logan Vasquez w/ Mail The Horse at Higher Ground

Wednesday, May 16, 2018

8:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
1995064127401080

Matthew Logan Vasquez w/ Mail The Horse at Higher Ground

Wednesday, May 16, 2018 8:30PM

http://www.matthewloganvasquez.com/ "Matt‚Äôs voice and words have that Nashville outcast vibe to it,‚Äù says Jay Sweet, producer of the Newport Folk Festival and a longtime champion of Matt‚Äôs music. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs not California, he‚Äôs not Texas, he‚Äôs not Brooklyn‚Äîeven though he‚Äôs lived in all of those places. He‚Äôs a transplant and a vagabond, which is why he embodies folk and rock music. For a singer- songwriter, he is truly refreshing." Matt went solo for simple reasons-- to return to the style of rock he loves. And when he went solo he REALLY went solo. He plays every instrument on the record, except for two drum tracks and one guitar track. Delta Spirit undoubtedly will be back but he wanted to make a collection of music without the influence of his beloved brethren (it's only natural for a frontman to feel the need to let loose from time to time). You will hear his new material and you will hear Iggy Pop. Neil Young. Kurt Cobain. Gram Parsons. But ultimately, you're hearing Matthew Logan Vasquez. A man young at heart, who loves the shit out of rock music... loves it so much that it's been his life's goal to make the masses reconnect with her spirit. But he's become a father, and he's been through some shit. His dad was a bomb builder. Fact. At the end of the day, Matt‚Äôs objective as a singer, a poet, a preacher, a believer in this beautiful bullshit we call ‚ÄúRocknRoll,‚Äù is to find some harmony through life‚Äôs confusion and to make you feel good about yourself. He'll be spreading his message via his wonderful songs starting in the fall of 2015. You better go put your dimes in his collection basket. Are there better things you can be doin with those dimes?

Bella‚Äôs Bartok, Folkfaces & Smooth Hound Smith at Iron Works

Thursday, May 17, 2018

8:00PM

Buffalo Iron Works

Buffalo, NY

9
2097004160572929

Bella‚Äôs Bartok, Folkfaces & Smooth Hound Smith at Iron Works

Thursday, May 17, 2018 8:00PM - Thursday, May 17, 2018 11:00PM

Thursday May 17th - Bella‚Äôs Bartok, Folkfaces & Smooth Hound Smith Doors: 7:00pm, Show: 8:00pm - Tickets: $8 ADV/$12 DOS - Ages: 18+ __________________________________________ Bella's Bartok: All little children grow up, one day --- all except the bedazzled and glittered boys of Bella‚Äôs Bartok. Inspired by elements of Vaudeville, centuries of street performance, and an unyielding drive to promote camaraderie, Northampton, MA-based Bella‚Äôs Bartok delivers a passionate kaleidescope of sound. The songs are born of Americana and folk music of their immigrant grandparents, blended with the joy of a particular brand of pop sensibility. Their performances are at once a primal stand against oppression and a declaration of joy in the face of adversity. From quiet reflections on loss, to the howl of justice in four-part harmony, Bella‚Äôs Bartok sonically and lyrically delivers a sweaty, soulful dance-party that is sure to leave the audience happily breathless. Started in the dimly lit alleyways of Great Barrington, MA, Bella‚Äôs Bartok gradually evolved from street-punk performers to an electric, brass-filled, accordion-based spectacle that has continued to entertain audiences for nearly a decade. The line-up includes: Asher Putnam (Vocals, Bass, all-around entertainer), Dan Niederhauser (Guitar and Vocals), Amory Drennan (Trombone/Banjo and Vocals), Crisco (Drums/Percussion and Trumpet), Gershon Rosen (Trumpet), and Alex Kogut (Accordion, Keyboard). The band has shared the stage with musicians and acts such as Rubblebucket, Red Baraat, The Indigo Girls, Larry & His Flask, The Suitcase Junket, Parsonsfield, And the Kids, Kanye, Rough Francis, Beau Sasser‚Äôs Escape Plan, West End Blend, Adam Ezra Group, Meat Puppets, World Inferno/Friendship Society, Rupa & the April Fishes, Arc Iris, and many more. Find Bella‚Äôs Bartok on a variety of stages, at a myriad of festivals, or on the street across the continental United States. Audiences often pick up on the band‚Äôs main influences such as Frank Zappa, System of a Down, Tom Waits and Oingo Boingo. Folkfaces: Folkfaces is a group out of Buffalo, NY that plays a rowdy blend of rootsy Folk, Jazz, and Blues - fusing classic forms with contemporary feelings and irresistibly danceable energy. Their inspiration comes from the mountains of Appalachia to the deltas of Mississippi, the swamps of Louisiana to the Concrete Jungle of the Rustbelt. Specializing in merriment and sticking it to the system, Folkfaces make the crowd dance and the hierarchy shatter. Smooth Hound Smith: Smooth Hound Smith is a foot stompin‚Äô American roots duo comprised of ‚Äúone-man-band‚Äù Zack Smith (guitars/vocals/foot drums/harmonicas/banjo) and Caitlin Doyle (vocals/percussion). Established in 2012, and based in East Nashville, TN, they record and perform a varied and unique style of folky, garage-infused rhythm & blues. Using primal foot percussion, complex, fuzzed-out, finger-picked guitar patterns, warbled harmonicas, tasty harmonies and A LOT of tambourine, they are able to create something rugged and visceral- a modern interpretation of early blues, soul, and rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll music that harkens back to the traditions of hazy front porch folk songs as well as raucous back-alley juke joints. The duo has traveled over 150,000 road miles, playing over 800 shows across America, Europe, and Canada, all in the last five years. In addition to their own headlining shows, they have toured as support for bands such as the Dixie Chicks (25 dates in the US and Canada in 2016/2017), The Record Company, and Jamestown Revival. Their eponymous debut album garnered attention from media outlets such as Nashville‚Äôs independent radio, WRLT Lightning 100, as well as publications like American Songwriter and RELIX Magazine. They were also selected over thousands of other bands to perform at the 2015 Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival in Manchester, TN, headlined by Billy Joel, Mumford & Sons, Ben Harper & The Innocent Criminals, and more. In addition, the music of Smooth Hound Smith has been featured on CMT‚Äôs Nashville, MTV‚Äôs The Real World and the Esquire Network. Smooth Hound Smith‚Äôs second full-length album, Sweet Tennessee Honey, was released in 2016, and features appearances by Natalie Maines (Dixie Chicks), Sarah Jarosz, and Jano Rix (The Wood Brothers). They continue to tour heavily while working on new material for a third full-length album, expected to be released in 2018.

Church Girls / Total Yuppies / The Dave DiPrimo Band

Bug Jar

9
183614988922044

Church Girls / Total Yuppies / The Dave DiPrimo Band

$7/$9 Doors @ 8:00 pm Tunes @ 9:00 pm Church Girls - Philly, PA https://www.facebook.com/churchgirlsmusic/ Total Yuppies - ROC https://www.facebook.com/totalyuppies/ Dave DiPrimo Band - ROC https://www.facebook.com/davediprimomusic/

Culture ft. Kenyatta Hill at Nectar's

Thursday, May 17, 2018

9:30PM

Nectar's

Burlington, VT

9
1621177821334309

Culture ft. Kenyatta Hill at Nectar's

Thursday, May 17, 2018 9:30PM - Friday, May 18, 2018 12:30AM

Switchback Thursdays Nectar's and Mi Yard Present Culture Featuring Kenyatta Hill 9:30pm doors ‚Ä¢ 18+ $12 ADV ‚Ä¢ $15 DOS ~~~~~~~~~~~ Kenyatta Hill‚Äôs career began the day his father‚Äôs ended. Joseph Hill, singer and songwriter for the legendary Jamaican vocal trio Culture, collapsed and died while on a 2006 tour of Europe. To the amazement of promoters, fans and critics alike, Kenyatta stepped onstage and delivered electrifying performances time and again ‚Äì nineteen shows in all ‚Äì until the tour was complete. This was unheard of in any genre of music at any time. Kenyatta gave of himself so totally ‚Äì as his father had for so many years ‚Äì that the two seemed to become one, the eerily similar voices and the vibes igniting the critics and yielding a new reggae mantra ‚Äúmagic, not tragic!‚Äù At the Ranny Williams Center in Kingston Jamaica at the memorial concert for his father, Kenyatta‚Äôs performance with Culture was the highlight in a star studded night and garnered him the rousing support of the hard-to-please Kingston reggae audience. Kenyatta went on to front Culture in a series of performances in the US, Caribbean, Brazil, Argentina and Peru, again leaving audiences amazed and delighted. Influenced by elements of dancehall, grounded in the roots tradition and motivated to carry on his father‚Äôs work, Kenyatta set to writing ‚Äì to finish songs that Joseph had started and create new music of his own. On his poignant debut single, ‚ÄúDaddy,‚Äù (Tafari Records), backed by a masterful roster of musicians including Sly Dunbar and Dean Fraser, and produced by Lynford ‚ÄúFatta‚Äù Marshall, he confronted the emotional pain and uncertainty he felt after the loss of his father. He cried while he wrote, just as audiences in Europe had cried while he sang. Pass the Torch, the complete CD described as having ‚Äúa collector‚Äôs item feel,‚Äù was released in 2007 to longtime Culture fans and critics who have embraced the son, named for Jomo Kenyatta, the first Prime minister of Kenya. With its ‚Äúvery lovely and high level vibe‚Äù Kenyatta Hill‚Äôs first CD prompted one longtime Culture fan to proclaim ‚ÄúCulture is ALIVE.‚Äù Indeed, Culture featuring Kenyatta Hill continues to share the wisdom of Joseph‚Äôs conscious reggae overlaid with Kenyatta‚Äôs own lively and youthful musical vision. Touring in support of Pass the Torch with a number of festival appearances continued throughout 2009, including most recently a highly successful US tour with Beres Hammond. Solo tour dates with a new band can be expected in 2010 as Kenyatta Hill expands his musical horizons beyond his formidable roots. Switchback Brewing Company mi yard (reggae night)

Margaret Glaspy & Julian Lage at Higher Ground

Thursday, May 17, 2018

8:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
1815778138445608

Margaret Glaspy & Julian Lage at Higher Ground

Thursday, May 17, 2018 8:30PM

http://mglaspy.com/ Born Yesterday is a bookend to New York singer-songwriter, Margaret Glaspy‚Äôs lauded 2016 debut Emotions and Math (ATO Records). ‚ÄúIn releasing it, I feel set free to sink deep into my new inspirations while taking a break from the road and make something entirely new.‚Äù Glaspy continues, ‚ÄúThese songs are the end of this chapter and mark a new beginning!‚Äù Emotions and Math was featured on many Year-End lists when it was released in 2016, including The New York Times, NPR Music, Billboard, Mother Jones, and more. Glaspy toured the record intensely, playing countless shows throughout North America, Europe, and Asia. This season on the road birthed her new EP released on ATO Records, Born Yesterday. Margaret recalls, ‚ÄúI wrote these songs on the road, in my hotel, on the plane, and at soundcheck. They were the product of the little time that I had to myself - three songs about different sides of love: love gone wrong, love gone right, and love at a distance.‚Äù She continues, ‚ÄúBorn Yesterday is a bookend on the adventure that was my last record, Emotions and Math.‚Äù Glaspy self-produced the new EP, which frames these love stories in catchy choruses, dark harmony, and her ever evolving sense of the electric guitar. Her finely tuned ear for production and tone shine on Born Yesterday. ‚Äî http://www.julianlage.com The New York Times calls Julian ‚Äú‚Ä¶one of jazz‚Äôs breezier virtuosos, possessed of an unflappable technical facility and a seemingly boundless curiosity.‚Äù At age 27, Julian Lage already boasts a resume that an artist twice his age would be proud to claim. A former child prodigy‚Äîhe was the subject of the 1997 documentary Jules at Eight‚Äîthe California- born, now New York‚Äìbased guitarist has collaborated with such giants as Gary Burton, Jim Hall, David Grisman, B√©la Fleck, and Charles Lloyd. He‚Äôs released three albums as a leader, most recently 2016‚Äôs trio outing Arclight featuring Scott Colley and Kenny Wollesen. UK‚Äôs Jazzwise describes Arclight as '... a bright light shone on very specific, finely wrought musical miniatures that unfold untold pleasures.' Lage has also release several duo projects including Wilco guitarist Nels Cline, pianist Fred Hersch, and Punch Brothers guitarist Chris Eldridge.

Andrew live at Radio Bean!

Join me and a mystery guest as I take the stage at Radio Bean in Burlington, Vermont. I play a unique style of acoustic funky blues and folk music. Over the past year I've been compared to such diverse musicians as Ben Harper, Stephen Stills, and G. Love & Special Sauce. There is always an undeniable reggae groove, often hiding in plain sight throughout my music. My debut studio album VAGABOND drops in April 2018.

Folkfaces and Chaz Hearne

Friday, May 18, 2018

7:30PM

None Specified

None Specified, None Specified

9
199096824017616

Folkfaces and Chaz Hearne

Friday, May 18, 2018 7:30PM - Friday, May 18, 2018 11:30PM

Join us for a House Concert featuring the rowdy roots stylings of Folkfaces and the banjo-ing of Chaz Hearne! $5 Cover BYOB - Bring Your Own Booze - Duh 7:30 PM - Doors 8:00 PM - Chaz Hearne http://www.chazhearne.com/ 9:00 PM - Folkfaces https://www.folkfacesmusic.com/ 556 Forest Lawn Road: The White House at the bottom of the hill at the intersection of Forest Lawn Road and Forest Lawn Drive. PARKING: Please park next to the field on Forest Lawn Rd after turning in from Lake Rd. We will have limited spaces available at 556 Forest Lawn Road and 554 Forest Lawn Road. Folkfaces is a quintet out of Buffalo, NY that plays a rowdy blend of rootsy Folk, Jazz, and Blues - fusing classic forms with contemporary feelings and irresistibly danceable energy. Their inspiration comes from the mountains of Appalachia to the deltas of Mississippi, the swamps of Louisiana to the Concrete Jungle of the Rustbelt. Specializing in merriment and sticking it to the system, Folkfaces make the crowd dance and the hierarchy shatter. Chaz Hearne is a folk musician based out of Rochester, New York who thrives in extremes. From intricate fingerpicked acoustic numbers to all-out rock anthems, everything is topped off with thoughtful melodies and a barely restrained enthusiasm. Though the banjo may be his weapon of choice, he has also been known to wield the guitar, piano, violin and singing saw; all the while singing with a voice of fragile honey.

Rising Appalachia + Peia : A Come to Life Gathering

Friday, May 18, 2018

6:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
1974510496210535

Rising Appalachia + Peia : A Come to Life Gathering

Friday, May 18, 2018 6:30PM - Friday, May 18, 2018 11:30PM

Come to Life Presents Rising Appalachia + Peia (and Special Guests) Friday May 18, 2018 Doors: 6:30 PM Show: 7:00 PM All Ages $25 advance | $30 day of show Rising Appalachia brings to the stage a collection of sounds, stories, and songs steeped in tradition and a devotion to world culture. Intertwining a deep reverence for folk music and a passion for justice, they have made it their life‚Äôs work to sing songs that speak to something ancient yet surging with relevance. Whether playing at Red Rocks or in rail cars, at Italian street fairs or to Bulgarian herbalists, this fiercely independent band has blazed a unique and colorful path across the globe. 11 years into their movement, Rising Appalachia believes that the roots of all these old songs are vital to our ever evolving soundscape. As an archival songstress, Peia has gathered songs from ancient traditions that span across the globe. She carries melodies wrinkled and wise with time, laboring faithfully to revive their language, stories and original essence. Peia has just released her third studio album, Beauty Thunders, a collection of traditional and original songs tracing the movement of humanity and her own ancestors throughout the ages. This new album is produced by engineer and Grammy Award Nominee Kamal Engles and includes an array of phenomenal musicians from the world music community.

Sweet Megg at Radio Bean

Friday, May 18, 2018

11:30PM

Radio Bean

Burlington, VT

9
1891310894215893

Sweet Megg at Radio Bean

Friday, May 18, 2018 11:30PM - Saturday, May 19, 2018 1:00AM

Sweet Megg is returning to Burlington! Come hang with us! Sweet Megg and her wayfaring musicians will transport you, not to the past but to a new world of their own making. The band is lead by the charmingly enigmatic Sweet Megg, who imbues each song with her own concoction of melancholy and euphoria that will delight you, surprise you, and break your heart all at once. The band seamlessly incorporates elements of New Orleans Swing, Harlem swing, Parisian cabaret, and gut bucket blues into one charming musical performance. Saxophonist Ryan Weisheit reimagines a world where Sidney Bechet, Lester Young, and Charlie Parker blow side by side. Together Sweet Megg, Ryan, and all the Wayfarers create a world where jazz is alive and well and living in New York.

The Mammals at Higher Ground

Friday, May 18, 2018

8:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
200534687356285

The Mammals at Higher Ground

Friday, May 18, 2018 8:00PM

http://www.themammals.love/ Indie-roots trailblazers, The Mammals, are a high-octane Americana quintet from New York‚Äôs storied Hudson Valley carrying on the work of Pete Seeger & Woody Guthrie with a deep original repertoire, searing American roots sound, and a message of hope for humanity. Known for their jubilant, high-energy shows, The Mammals deftly move from older-than-dirt banjo duets to sound-the-alarm topical fare that‚Äôs right in line with the times, bouncing from rafter raising hoe-downs to hear-a-pin-drop a cappella balladry. Founded in 2001 by Seeger‚Äôs grandson, Tao, second generation fiddler/singer, Ruth Ungar, and multi-instrumental wordsmith, Mike Merenda, the original trio enjoyed a remarkable 7 year run that brought them to the largest folk festivals across North America, Australia and Denmark, Nashville‚Äôs Ryman Auditorium (with stringband peers Nickel Creek), New York‚Äôs Carnegie Hall as the special guest of folk legend Arlo Guthrie, and to the pages of numerous publications lauding their unique ‚Äútraditional-music-in-combat-boots-sound‚Äù including a feature in The New York Times handpicking them as a leader in a pack of new-wave stringbands ‚Äúupdating that old-time sound.‚Äù After a considerable break from the project during which time Merenda and Ungar married and started a family, a bi-annual folk festival, and a musical duo aptly called, Mike + Ruthy, and Seeger pursuing a solo career before retiring from music all together to start a family of his own, The Mammals returned fronted by Merenda and Ungar in 2017 ‚Äústronger than ever‚Äù (Folk Alley) with a pair of politically charged singles, ‚ÄúCulture War‚Äù and ‚ÄúMy Baby Drinks Water,‚Äù and the announcement of a new album in 2018. The Mammals treasure the timeless traditions of song, story-telling and dance. Their work is to continue a musical odyssey so that the same handmade music passed down to them makes it thru to future generations one song, one concert at a time.

Rising Appalachia + Arouna Diarra: A Come to Life Gathering

Saturday, May 19, 2018

6:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
188186278620622

Rising Appalachia + Arouna Diarra: A Come to Life Gathering

Saturday, May 19, 2018 6:30PM - Saturday, May 19, 2018 11:30PM

Come to Life Presents Rising Appalachia + Arouna Diarra (and Special Guests) Saturday May 19, 2018 Doors: 6:30 PM Show: 7:00 PM All Ages $25 advance | $30 day of show Rising Appalachia brings to the stage a collection of sounds, stories, and songs steeped in tradition and a devotion to world culture. Intertwining a deep reverence for folk music and a passion for justice, they have made it their life‚Äôs work to sing songs that speak to something ancient yet surging with relevance. Whether playing at Red Rocks or in rail cars, at Italian street fairs or to Bulgarian herbalists, this fiercely independent band has blazed a unique and colorful path across the globe. 11 years into their movement, Rising Appalachia believes that the roots of all these old songs are vital to our ever evolving soundscape. As an archival songstress, Peia has gathered songs from ancient traditions that span across the globe. She carries melodies wrinkled and wise with time, laboring faithfully to revive their language, stories and original essence. Peia has just released her third studio album, Beauty Thunders, a collection of traditional and original songs tracing the movement of humanity and her own ancestors throughout the ages. This new album is produced by engineer and Grammy Award Nominee Kamal Engles and includes an array of phenomenal musicians from the world music community. Arouna Diarra, originally from Burkina Faso, West Africa, is an accomplished n‚Äôgoni & balafon player. Performing a tradition of folk songs reflecting topics from war to building love for one another, Arouna sings with spirit, nostalgia, and great joy, in his native language, Bambara. Arouna brings a dynamic repertoire to the table, full of timing changes and improvisational prowess. He plays the kamale n‚Äôgoni, a 14-string harp-like instrument (which he makes himself), with a melodic and percussive sensibility. Arouna was born into a family composed of musicians, poets, and storytellers. Arouna, a twelfth generation musician was destined to bring traditional West African music into the modern day, further developing it while remaining true to it‚Äôs roots. His live performances often welcome a diverse group of musicians performing as the AZA Band. Musicians frequently joining Arouna onstage include percussionist Biko Casini and bassist/guitarist David Brown of Rising Appalachia. Whether performing on stage at Red Rocks, the jungle of Costa Rica, or intimate community settings Arouna and his band bring joy, harmony, and a connection to traditional folk music.

Charlotte's Web LIVE at State Theatre of Ithaca!

Sunday, May 20, 2018

3:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
1623852087627322

Charlotte's Web LIVE at State Theatre of Ithaca!

Sunday, May 20, 2018 3:00PM

The Tompkins Trust Company and CSP Management Family Series Presents: Charlotte's Web! Sunday, May 20th 2018 3pm showtime ** BACK TO SCHOOL SPECIAL :: ALL TICKETS ONLY $8 UNTIL SEPTEMBER 10TH!** Sponsored by Northeast Pediatrics Theatreworks' production of Charlotte's Web is based on E.B. White's loving story of the friendship between a pig named Wilbur and a little gray spider named Charlotte. Wilbur has a problem: how to avoid winding up as pork chops! Charlotte, a fine writer and true friend, hits on a plan to fool Farmer Zuckerman -- she will create a "miracle." Spinning the words "Some Pig" in her web, Charlotte weaves a solution which not only makes Wilbur a prize pig, but ensures his place on the farm forever. This treasured tale, featuring mad-cap and endearing farm animals, explores bravery, selfless love, and the true meaning of friendship. (Approximately one-hour in length, recommended for grades K - 5) Curriculum Connections: Communication and Language Arts, Literature-Based, Music, Relationships & Family.

Danielle Nicole at Higher Ground

Sunday, May 20, 2018

8:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
238941216646260

Danielle Nicole at Higher Ground

Sunday, May 20, 2018 8:00PM

http://www.daniellenicolekc.com Founding member, lead singer, and bass player of Kansas City blues-rock band Trampled Under Foot, Danielle Nicole stepped out on her own in 2015 with her debut album ‚ÄúWolf Den.‚Äù In 2018, Nicole returns with a follow-up release via Concord Records. "I grew up playing the blues, and the blues is still a big part of what I do. But now I'm reaching out more and trying different things. It still sounds like me, but I'm stretching out a lot more than I have previously." Nicole's distinctive, inventive bass work‚Äîwhich resulted in her becoming the first woman to win the Blues Foundation's 2014 Blues Music Award for Best Instrumentalist, Bass‚Äîis the product of years of intensive roadwork. Although she had no experience with the instrument when she became Trampled Under Foot's bassist, now she can't imagine life without it. "When I started doing my solo thing," she continues, "someone asked me if I was gonna hire a bass player. No, of course not! I originally picked up the bass to keep Trampled Under Foot a family band, but I really fell in love with it. It was a huge challenge, and it still is. But I really love being part of the groove and getting to sing on top of that. I had learned some stuff on acoustic guitar before I started playing bass, but I never really felt connected to it the way I do with the bass. It's empowering, walking onto a stage full of grown men who can play their asses off, and it's 'OK, I'm gonna play this bass, we're gonna do this, and it's gonna rock.'" Rounding out her band are longtime Danielle Nicole Band guitarist and multi-instrumentalist Brandon Miller, and drummer Rodd Bland, son of blues legend Bobby ‚ÄúBlue‚Äù Bland, who earned his chops playing in his dad‚Äôs band and later with BB King. "I think that it's a good time for the kind of thing I'm doing," she states. "From my years of playing blues festivals, I've seen that younger and younger audiences are getting into the blues. I think that people want to hear authentic music again.‚Äù

King Tuff w/ Cut Worms at Higher Ground

Tuesday, May 22, 2018

8:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
1952231728438517

King Tuff w/ Cut Worms at Higher Ground

Tuesday, May 22, 2018 8:00PM

When asked to describe the title track from his new record, Kyle Thomas‚Äîaka King Tuff‚Äîtakes a deep breath. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a song about hitting rock bottom,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúI didn't even know what I wanted to do anymore, but I still had this urge‚Äîthis feeling‚Äîlike there was this possibility of something else I could be doing‚Ä¶ and then I just followed that possibility. To me, that‚Äôs what songwriting, and art in general, is about. You‚Äôre chasing something, there is something out there calling to you and you‚Äôre trying to get at it. ‚ÄòThe Other‚Äô is basically where songs come from, it‚Äôs the hidden world, it‚Äôs the mystery. It‚Äôs the invisible hand that guides you whenever you make something. It‚Äôs the thing I had to rediscover‚Äîthe sort of voice I had to follow‚Äîto bring me back to making music again in a way that felt true and good.‚Äù After years of non-stop touring, culminating in a particularly arduous stint in support of 2014‚Äôs Black Moon Spell, Thomas found himself back in Los Angeles experiencing the flipside of the ultimate rock and roll cliche‚Äîthat of an exhausted musician suddenly unsure where to go or what to do, held prisoner by a persona that he never meant to create, that bore little resemblance to the worn out person they now saw in the mirror. Thomas was suddenly at odds with the storied rock and roll misfit mythology that he‚Äôd spent the past ten years, four full-length albums, a handful of EPs, and multiple live records, unwittingly bringing to life. ‚ÄúAt that point I had literally been on tour for years,‚Äù recalls Thomas. ‚ÄúIt was exhausting. Physically and mentally. At the end of it I was like, I just can't do this. I‚Äôm essentially playing this character of King Tuff, this crazy party monster, and I don‚Äôt even drink or do drugs. It had become a weird persona, which people seemed to want from me, but it was no longer me. I just felt like it had gotten away from me.‚Äù For a time, Thomas involved himself in projects that gave him space from all things King Tuff, and allowed him to, as he says, ‚Äúgo out and play music without having to actually be the boss.‚Äù Eventually, after being asked to play a handful of solo shows, Thomas began to see a way through to making new music. ‚ÄúI‚Äôd never played a show with just an acoustic guitar,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt just seemed like the scariest thing. I knew I wanted to write some new songs that could stand up in that kind of setting, which really opened the door to a new way of working.‚Äù ‚ÄúI knew I wanted to record myself on my own time in my own space, so I put together a studio in a room in my house we called the Pine Room. It was like being inside of a wood-paneled spaceship. Suddenly I had all of this new crazy gear that I had no idea how to use in any sort of technical or ‚Äòcorrect‚Äô way. I just embraced the beauty of not knowing, which I think is where you get interesting things happening." Thomas self-produced the record, as he did his debut, Was Dead, but on a far grander scale, this time playing every instrument aside from drums and saxophone. He pulled Shawn Everett (War On Drugs, Alabama Shakes) in to assist with the mixing process. "From the moment I started recording, it was like going home, like I had finally found myself again.‚Äù While it would be easy to think of The Other as a kind of reinvention for King Tuff, Thomas views the entire experience of the record as a kind of psychic reset, and something not totally removed from what he‚Äôs done in the past. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt help but sound like me,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs just that this time I let the songs lead me where they wanted to go, instead of trying to push them into a certain zone. King Tuff was always just supposed to be me. When I started doing this as a teenager, it was whatever I wanted it to be. King Tuff was never supposed to be just one thing. It was supposed to be everything.‚Äù

DarkDaze Presents: The Sounding Of The Drums

Thursday, May 24, 2018

8:00PM

Bug Jar

Rochester, NY

9
324726038035226

DarkDaze Presents: The Sounding Of The Drums

Thursday, May 24, 2018 8:00PM - Friday, May 25, 2018 2:00AM

18+ event 18-20 10$ 21+ 5$ Doors at 8 SpunDaze&Darkstep have come together to bring you awesome tunes and the best "feels" you can imagine. If your ready for some hard hitting bass provided by the bug jars great system with a little push from from outside sound then we hope you will grace us with your presence! Kicking off the night will be, Dj Savvy Tech/House 8-9 Howdy! My name is Savvy and I've been DJing since I was in high school. I always heard songs and though "This song would sound better faster, With this part cut out, Etc." but I didn't know how to do it. I always loved music since I was a kid but this was a whole new ball game. I downloaded virtual DJ (first program ever) and realized how much more I could do so I started teaching myself in my free time. I started downloading many songs from all genres and started experimenting. Over time I became the main DJ for my high school for major events. After graduation I stopped for a couple years being I didn't know how to continue and even if I did, I'd need a good job to afford what was needed. Once I secured this job, I bought my first board (Pioneer DDJ-SB for serato) and started practicing again. I was learning the different types of genres and sub genres as well as how to mix songs on the fly. Worked with different crews doing jobs all across Rochester gaining experience, friends and better equipment along the way. Though I'm not too too versed in CDJs yet, I plan to learn soon. ???? 9-10 Dj Geoff Haze Dirty Techno, Tech/House 10-11 4Star Electro-Funk, Tech 11-12 ???? 12-1 ???? 1-2 Also for your visual entertainment besides the lazers everywhere will be a lovely trio of dancers including Kat Walker, Kassaundra Austin, and Mara Moo. This is an Army Of Bass Production, please show your support by liking the page as well as all the djs and performers. There WILL be more to come... So stay tuned bassheads!

Western Centuries

Thursday, May 24, 2018

8:00PM

Abilene Bar and Lounge

Rochester, NY

9
2121059194847184

Western Centuries

Thursday, May 24, 2018 8:00PM - Thursday, May 24, 2018 11:00PM

Let's just say this....Last time "Western Centuries" played Abilene, it was one unforgettable night! Do NOT miss them this time through. They'll be at the corner saloon on Thursday, May 24 at 8pm..Super Low-dough Show..Ten Bucks at the Door Round up a country band and an early R&B group with three lead vocalists, weave in a hefty amount of vocal harmony and witty turns-of-phrase, and let ‚Äòem rock out like The Band. The sound of roots music mavericks Western Centuries sits at these crossroads, and their debut album Weight of the World introduces a band as skillful in their musicianship as they are innovative in their writing. With upbeat, barroom dance numbers, lilting, introspective tunes of heartbreak, and everything in between, the album strikes an oft-strived-for but rarely achieved balance between genre-busting experimentation and thoughtful continuity. Comprised of Seattle-based country musician Cahalen Morrison, jam band veteran Jim Miller (co-founder of Donna the Buffalo), R&B and bluegrass-by-way-of-punk rock songwriter Ethan Lawton, pedal steel player Rusty Blake, and bassist Dan Lowinger, Western Centuries are clearly a diverse bunch. The band is collaborative in nature, but they are ‚Äì albeit subtly ‚Äì helmed by Morrison. After years of performing in prominent roots duo Cahalen Morrison & Eli West (whose music made fans of Tim O‚ÄôBrien, Jim Lauderdale, Dirk Powell, and BBC Radio‚Äôs Bob Harris along the way), Morrison formed and led the band Country Hammer, made up of members who have mostly crossed over into Western Centuries. Produced by Bill Reynolds (Band of Horses) and recorded in his Nashville studio, Weight of the World features three different songwriters and lead vocalists (Morrison, Miller, and Lawton); the result is a sound that deftly defies neat categorization. Yet the album doesn‚Äôt come off as scattered. Instead, it feels like the natural confluence of the band‚Äôs wide-ranging influences, laced together by the interconnected histories of the musical styles at its foundation, and by its writers‚Äô commitments to imaginative songwriting. The progressive, almost psychedelic nature of the album‚Äôs lyrics infuses the 12-track record with a distinctly modern sensibility. Sure, there‚Äôs ample pedal steel and plenty of country telecaster twang, but Western Centuries elevate these neo-traditional two-stepping tunes into transcendental, rootsy rock ‚Äòn roll doused think-pieces. Upon first listen, Weight of the World provides all the familiar satisfaction of traditional country lyricism ‚Äì rife with simultaneously hilarious and heart-breaking one-liners, tales of hitting the bottle and scraping bottom, and so on ‚Äì but these songs yield new and deeper meaning with every listen. Each songwriter brings his own flair to Weight of the World, but there is a deeply literary approach to the songwriting woven throughout. The metaphors cleverly extend on, sometimes for an entire song as with Lawton‚Äôs ‚ÄúOff the Shelf‚Äù -- a love song written for a bottle of booze. While its lyrics are impressively layered with meaning, Weight of the World will appeal to just about any fan of roots music; the album certainly showcases the band‚Äôs great range and ability to blend influences ranging from early rhythm and blues, all the way to straight up country. But it‚Äôs also marked with a profound ingenuity ‚Äì the type that feels instinctual rather than intentionally labored for, the kind that continues to flourish and snake into new realms as time wears on. This is just the beginning for Western Centuries, and it‚Äôs not likely their creative well is going to dry

Tickets: https://camproc.bpt.me Lee is the head writer and host of the national TV show Redacted Tonight with Lee Camp on RT America. He's a former contributor to The Onion, former staff humor writer for the Huffington Post, and his web series "Moment of Clarity" has been viewed by millions. He's toured the country and the world with his fierce brand of standup comedy, and George Carlin's daughter Kelly said he's one of the few comics keeping her father's torch lit. Bill Hicks's brother Steve said Lee is one of only a handful with Bill's "message and passion." For more go to LeeCamp.net. "An incredibly funny man." John Oliver "An amazing writer and a great political thinker. He's the change you and I want to see." Janeane Garofalo "Imagine Jon Stewart if he gave a damn. He's like Howard Zinn after 12 beers." David Swanson "Lee Camp has found the hole in Americas brain where reason has been replaced by Wal-Mart. Lees rants channel the gunk oozing out. You have to admit, thats why he's so fucking funny." Greg Palast "A comedy evangelist Blistering punchlines" The Guardian

The Billboard and international award winning musicians have recorded 5+ albums of original material that received critical acclaim in both the USA and Europe. Sharing the stage with such acts as Aldo Nova, Toto, April Wine, Warrant, Edgar Winter, Blue Oyster Cult, Henry Lee Summer, the group has toured throughout the Northeast, Mid-Atlantic and Southern States, as well as Quebec and the Maritime Provinces. Alvvays at Higher Ground

Wednesday, May 30, 2018 8:00PM

http://alvvays.com/ Alvvays released their second full-length, Antisocialites, this last September. The album is followed-up to their critically acclaimed debut album which received accolades from Pitchfork, NPR, Rolling Stone and more. Across its 10 tracks and 33 minutes the Toronto-based group dive back into the deep-end of reckless romance and altered dates. Ice cream truck jangle collides with prismatic noise pop while Molly Rankin's wit is refracted through crystalline surf counterpoint. Through thoughtful consideration in basement and abroad, Alvvays has renewed its Scot-pop vows with a powerful new collection of manic emotional collage.

‚ÄúExpect the Unexpected‚Äù from the Security Project as they bring the timeless masterpieces of Peter Gabriel plus Genesis and Kate Bush into the 21st Century. Featuring Jerry Marotta, the drummer from Gabriel‚Äôs classic line-up (1977-1986), plus Trey Gunn from King Crimson, on a 10-string touch guitar. The recent addition of Happy Rhodes, with her 4-octave vocal range, fulfills the band‚Äôs promise of re-envisioning the music of Peter Gabriel. Rounding out the band from Shriekback and Sky Cries Mary is Michael Cozzi on guitar and co-founder of Gig Performer and computer scientist David Jameson on keyboards and Eigenharp. Leave your expectations at the door and be prepared to hear Peter Gabriel‚Äôs genre-less music like you‚Äôve never heard it performed before. 2 nights of Ben Harper & Charlie Musselwhite at Higher Ground

Friday, June 1, 2018

9:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
1587324054697103

2 nights of Ben Harper & Charlie Musselwhite at Higher Ground

Friday, June 1, 2018 9:00PM - Sunday, June 3, 2018 1:00AM

Sierra Nevada and Farrell Distributing proudly present 2 nights of Ben Harper & Charlie Musselwhite at Higher Ground! http://www.benharper.com // http://www.charliemusselwhite.com/ There‚Äôs a moment in the title song of the new Ben Harper and Charlie Musselwhite album called No Mercy In This Land. A mere few seconds that powerfully capture the friendship and unique collaboration between the two storied musicians. The music, a primal and intimate blues, stops with the exception for a sustained organ note. Musselwhite, survivor and harmonica virtuoso, cohort of Muddy Waters, Howlin‚Äô Wolf and Little Walter in the early sixties, life nearly ended by alcohol and other maladies, leans in and delivers the lines, ‚ÄúFather left us down here all alone, my poor mother is under a stone. With an aching heart and trembling hands, is there no mercy in this land.‚Äù And with those words, that weary voice, you can hear it all - the highs and lows, the adventures, the sadness and all the loss. ‚ÄúI never asked Ben about the lyrics,‚Äù Charlie reflects, ‚Äúbut my mom was a single mom and I was an only child. And the line, ‚Äòmy poor mother is under a stone,‚Äô well, she was murdered. So she's gone and she's under a stone. This is personal to me. It's the essence of blues. People talk about the blues from an academic standpoint, but to me it's about feeling. And that feeling there is pure. That song moves me every time.‚Äù Ben says the two never discussed the meaning of the lyrics. ‚ÄúIt's fragile territory what he went through with his mom,‚Äù Ben says. ‚ÄúI was scared to bring that to him, because I know what happened. And that line, it‚Äôs me being affected by my friend and what happened to him. With Charlie, some things I pick up on are spoken and some are unspoken, but we know a lot about each other. But the deepest part of our friendship doesn't need to be said. ‚ÄúNo Mercy In This Land,‚Äù that song is for Charlie. It‚Äôs gotta hurt sometimes. I take this shit seriously.‚Äù

IU: Wormrot, Escuela, Monolith

Ithaca Underground Presents Wormrot, Escuela Monolith at The Haunt on 6/1!! 7:00pm Doors 8:00pm Show Wormrot Wormrot plays grindcore and was signed to Earache Records (UK) in 2010. Ever since Wormrot was formed in 2007, they have been doing months-long tours in the US, EU and the neighbouring Asian countries. Aside from the usual underground shows in a converted garage in Denver, a squat in Berlin or a cave in Penang, they've also played in festivals like Glastonbury Festival (UK), Obscene Extreme Festival (CZ), Scion Rock Fest (US), SXSW (US), Netherlands Death Festival (NL), Incubate Fest (NL), Bloodshed Fest (NL), Baybeats (SG) and many more. Photo: Escuela Explosive grind. Knowledge is powerviolence. Speed kills. Monolith https://www.facebook.com/monolith315/ Dark sludgy doom / black metal from Cortland, NY. Their destructive melodic long-form arrangements have been hailed as one of the best-kept secrets in the doom metal underground.

Scott Helman at Higher Ground

Friday, June 1, 2018

7:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
904265489747970

Scott Helman at Higher Ground

Friday, June 1, 2018 7:30PM

http://www.scotthelmanmusic.com/ Finding his musical influences in album-focused artists like Arcade Fire, Bruce Springsteen, Neil Young, The Cure, Bon Iver and Paul Simon, Canadian singer-songwriter Scott Helman returns May 12, 2017 with his debut full-length album, H√¥tel de Ville. Recorded in Toronto at Revolution Recording and produced by Tawgs Salter (Lights, Walk Off The earth, USS), the album's first single is the irresistible pop alternative track "Kinda Complicated" which applies breezy, catchy songwriting and winking-lyricism to either a failed relationship or his own daily struggle with ADHD. "The more that I write music the more that I feel that I'm curing myself," Scott explains. "How am I gonna be a better person and how am I gonna be a better lover? I have to figure out all those things that are knocking around in my head." In 2014, Scott Helman released the song "Bungalow" as the first single from his debut EP Augusta. The track introduced a fresh new voice to the musical landscape and his versatility led to tours across Canada, playing with the likes of Tegan and Sara, Shawn Mendes and Matthew Good. Opening for Walk Off The Earth on extensive tours of the U.S. and Europe, Scott stood alone on stage and, night after night, won over skeptical audiences and began building an international fan base. In January 2016, he topped the Teen Vogue lsit of voices to look out for that year over the likes of Melanie Martinez and Elle King. By the time Scott went back in to the studio to begin work on Hotel de Ville he had been nominated for multiple 2015 MuchMusic Video Awards and 2016 Juno awards and performed to massive national TV audiences on both award shows. "Bungalow" was certified platinum in Canada and he rang in 2017 with a raucous tribute to Leonard Cohen, performing "Bird On A Wire" in Cohen's hometown of Montreal in front of 50,000 people and broadcast live on CBC TV.

Luna Collective at Radio Bean

Saturday, June 2, 2018

8:00PM

Radio Bean

Burlington, VT

9
419536791822349

Luna Collective at Radio Bean

Saturday, June 2, 2018 8:00PM - Saturday, June 2, 2018 9:30PM

The Luna Collective performs at Radio Bean during the Burlington Jazz Fest. The Luna Collective is a Boston based quintet dedicated to preserving and performing the music of Art Blakey‚Äôs many Jazz Messengers. The band works to transcribe and perform the original arrangements performed by the Messengers, sharing what they learn about those recordings and the musicians who made them with audiences as they go. In addition to club dates and other appearances around New England the Luna Collective hosts two monthly jam sessions in the Boston area; Luna Sessions every Thursday night at The Luna Theater in Lowell and Devlin‚Äôs Restaurant in Brighton the last Wednesday of each month.

Steve Forbert

Saturday, June 2, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
150535435655634

Steve Forbert

Saturday, June 2, 2018 8:00PM - Saturday, June 2, 2018 11:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Steve Forbert at The Haunt on 6/2!! *This show was rescheduled from 11/3/17 at The Dock and has been moved to The Haunt on 6/2 - ALL tickets will be honored!!* Doors at 7:00pm Show at 8:00pm Steve Forbert http://www.steveforbert.com/ ‚ÄúCompromised‚Äù is Steve Forbert‚Äôs newest and from the comparative essay of the disc‚Äôs title song,(complete with catchy chorus and signature harmonica solo), to the exasperated advice for ‚Äúeveryman‚Äù on the album closer, ‚ÄúWhatever, Man,‚Äù Steve Forbert leaves no stone unturned in his exploration of life, love, turmoil and survival. After years with local bands, Steve Forbert left his hometown of Meridian, Mississippi in his early 20s and headed for the Big Apple in search of recording deals and larger audiences. He started out playing for change at Grand Central Station and hitting every open mic night he could before eventually moving into the club scene at infamous spots like New York City‚Äôs CBGB‚Äôs. At a time when rootsy rock was fading in favor of punk edged bands such as the Ramones, Talking Heads, and Blondie, Forbert‚Äôs folk pop ‚ÄúRomeo‚Äôs Tune‚Äù hit #11 on the charts and brought him into the international spotlight. Critics and the public embraced his melodic and lyrical styles, a more traditional sound among the post disco punk and rock of the late ‚Äô70s and early ‚Äô80s. Always following his own instincts, Forbert says, ‚ÄúI‚Äôve never been interested in changing what I do to fit popular style and needs.‚Äù And that‚Äôs the motto he has lived by since the release of his debut album, Alive on Arrival, in 1978. Rolling Stone contributing editor David Wild recently wrote that ‚Äúnow or then, you would have been hard pressed to find a debut effort that was simultaneously as fresh and accomplished as Alive on Arrival. It was like a great novel by a young author who somehow managed to split the difference between Mark Twain and J. D. Salinger.‚Äù

Hop Along w/ Bat Fangs at Higher Ground

Sunday, June 3, 2018

8:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
147849979255218

Hop Along w/ Bat Fangs at Higher Ground

Sunday, June 3, 2018 8:00PM

http://www.hopalongtheband.com/ Frances Quinlan has been meditating a lot on power. ‚ÄúWhen I was younger, I kept thinking that one day I would have a partner and that person would give me power,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúThat never came to be.‚Äù Instead, what Quinlan, the songwriter, lead vocalist, and rhythm guitarist of Hop Along, has found is that ‚Äúpower has an inherent awfulness to it and people who have it tend to be disappointing in how they wield it.‚Äù In this particular moment in history, this thought begs a greater question: what do we do with power and the men who so freely brandish it? ‚ÄúI‚Äôm angry that I believed in this false idea for so long, that a man would come along and show me what I was worth.‚Äù This theme propels the Philadelphia-based band‚Äôs third studio record, Bark Your Head Off, Dog. Written over the course of 2016 and 2017 and recorded in the summer of the latter year by Quinlan, Tyler Long (bass), Joe Reinhart (guitar), and Mark Quinlan (drums), the album imagines what it‚Äôs like to cast off longheld perceptions, often without being certain about the new ones that will replace them. Much like on Hop Along‚Äôs first and second records, Get Disowned and Painted Shut, Quinlan seeks in real time to work through these emotions. On Bark Your Head Off, Dog, she also grasps at something more complicated. ‚ÄúGrowing up I was constantly in my head and not a part of the world,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúNow I‚Äôm trying to force myself into the world.‚Äù ÔøΩ Throughout Bark Your Head Off, Dog, one gets the sense that Quinlan is wandering in the thicket of a forest‚Äîa state of being that will feel familiar to longtime listeners‚Äîand on this outing, she hasn‚Äôt left a trail of breadcrumbs behind her. The album‚Äôs artwork, which Quinlan painted herself, invites the listener into that forest, as well. ‚ÄúThere is a terror in getting lost,‚Äù she says, ‚Äúthe woods are at the same time beautiful and horrifying.‚Äù This curious wandering gives the album, both lyrically and musically, a heightened dimensionality. On ‚ÄúSomewhere a Judge,‚Äù Hop Along explores a dancier side to their sound, while ‚ÄúWhat the Writer Meant‚Äù showcases a string section and enormous, full harmonies. ‚ÄúOne That Suits Me‚Äù welcomes and embraces the sound of a Rhodes and tambourine, but with a syncopated vocal rhythm on top, almost building to a call-and-response. Throughout, the music is full of gratifying, new deviations.
