Disc Jam 2018 is coming in HOT Thursday June 7th - Sunday June 10th Tickets on sale NOW>>> https://www.theticketingco.com/event-discjam2018 Musical Performances by ‚Ä¢LOTUS ‚Ä¢BEATS ANTIQUE ‚Ä¢GALACTIC ‚Ä¢THE MOTET ‚Ä¢ELECTRON (featuring Marc and Aron of the Disco Biscuits, Tom Hamilton of JRAD, and Mike Greenfield of Lotus) ‚Ä¢BARBER ACOUSTIC (Jon Gutwilling of The Disco Biscuits) ‚Ä¢GUBBULIDIS (featuring Mihali and Gubb of Twiddle) ‚Ä¢KUNG FU ‚Ä¢MOON HOOCH ‚Ä¢AQUEOUS ‚Ä¢TOM MARSHALL PRESENTS THE AMFIBIAN ALL-STARS ‚Ä¢GHOST LIGHT (featuring Tom Hamilton of JRAD and Holly Bowling and more) ‚Ä¢CONSIDER THE SOURCE (electric and acoustic sets) ‚Ä¢GHOST-NOTE (Snarky Puppy side project) ‚Ä¢WOLF! (featuring Scott Metzger of JRAD and more) ‚Ä¢SOULE MONDE (Russ and Ray of Trey Band) ‚Ä¢THE Brandon TAZ Niederaurer BAND ‚Ä¢BELLA‚ÄôS BARTOK ‚Ä¢COMPA/GANTZER (Rob Compa of Dopapod and Mike Gantzer or Aqueous) ‚Ä¢RYAN DEMPSEY SOLO (Ryan of Twiddle) ‚Ä¢MARBIN ‚Ä¢BIG MEAN SOUND MACHINE ‚Ä¢WEST END BLEND ‚Ä¢THE FUNKY DAWGZ BRASS BAND ‚Ä¢DUB APOCALYPSE (featuring members of John Brown's Body, Morphine and more) ‚Ä¢STRANGE MACHINES ‚Ä¢SPACE BACON ‚Ä¢ESCAPER ‚Ä¢G-NOME PROJECT ‚Ä¢THE A BEEZ ‚Ä¢CONGO SANCHEZ (featuring Jeff Franca of Thievery Corporation) ‚Ä¢ROOT SHOCK ‚Ä¢BEARLY DEAD (3 sets daily) ‚Ä¢FORMULA 5 ‚Ä¢SHWIZZ ‚Ä¢GOOSE ‚Ä¢FUNKTIONAL FLOW ‚Ä¢MAMMAL DAP ‚Ä¢THE NEW MOTIF ‚Ä¢POLITICAL ANIMALS ‚Ä¢SWIMMER ‚Ä¢COUSIN EARTH ‚Ä¢OF CLOCKS AND CLOUDS ‚Ä¢COUSIN EARTH ‚Ä¢SPACE CARNIVAL ‚Ä¢OF TOMORROW ‚Ä¢HARSH ARMADILLO ‚Ä¢FAKE FLOWERS REAL DIRT ‚Ä¢THE CLOCK TURNS ‚Ä¢THE WILEY GRIFFIN BANK ‚Ä¢REZIN HEADS ‚Ä¢THE MUSHROOM CLOUD ‚Ä¢CATULLUS ‚Ä¢LORD ELECTRO ‚Ä¢DIZGO ‚Ä¢DEW POINT ‚Ä¢LETS BE LEONARD ‚Ä¢CYPHER Disc Jam Music Festival is 4 days and nights of cutting edge live music on side-by-side main stages fitted with the top in professional sound and lights, a massive tent stage that hosts both day sets and the late night sets. Our venue is located on an absolutely gorgeous piece of flat, spacious property with grass so soft and lush your shoes are going to be jealous that you‚Äôre not wearing them all weekend. Camping areas are within an earshot of the main stage and within eyesight away from vending and art installations! No long walks exist anywhere at Disc Jam. True to it‚Äôs name the event hosts an on site permanent disc golf course open for free play throughout the weekend for anyone who wants to play a round. We offer 2 different tournaments on Saturday and Sunday morning that will be hosted by 2018 Team Innova touring pro Gregg Barsby, with so many prizes and giveaways you‚Äôll need two hands to carry them all back to your camp site. Late night at Disc Jam has a little bit for everyone...strike that, a LOT A BIT for everyone! The Woods Stage is dedicated for the sexiest and wompiest of late night sets with nightly takeovers by four of the northeast premier EDM promoters in the scene including Rezinate, NV Concepts, Sermon, and The Rust each curating late night sets that will be followed by The Wook of Wall Street‚Äôs nightly silent disco parties that go until the sun rises. If the EDM isn‚Äôt what you fancy after the main stages end then don‚Äôt you fret we got you MORE THAN COVERED!! Late night sets in the Tent Stage by Gubbulidis and Ryan Dempsey on Thursday, DJ Logic and Friends and Barber Acoustic on Friday night, Electron on Saturday with a special acoustic set to follow...the JAM part of Disc Jam will be in full effect for 2018! Some of our favorite sets of the weekend will be our VIP sets! They are going to be some of the most interesting and intimate of all the music played this year and we cannot wait to tell you who you can expect to see! So stay tuned or just trust us and grab a VIP pass and get pampered Disc Jam style with us! What we can promise is you‚Äôve never seen these acts in ANY environment like you will this weekend! Our 2018 Disc Jam Flow Tribe is set to be by far our dopest group of flow arts and fire performers we have ever assembled and that‚Äôs saying A LOT if you‚Äôve seen out Flow Tribe spin fire and flow props in the last few years! A one miss Rachel Lust will be our first time featured flow artist at the festival and we couldn‚Äôt be more excited to have her and her jaw dropping hoop skills a part of 2018! She and the rest of the Flow Tribe will be hosting a TON of flow workshops over the weekend so bring your hoops and props and join us to learn from some of the genuinely nice and helpful people ever! Speaking of workshops, no true festival is complete without the list of interactive workshops, healers, and speakers. We have spent the last 12 months compiling what we feel will be some of the most powerful and moving set of workshops we‚Äôve hosted to date. Art on so many levels has always been a huge aspect at Disc Jam and this year will be no different. We‚Äôve literally out done ourselves every year and last year will be pretttty tough to beat as we set the bar high in 2017. With the core of amazing pigment pushers and spray can controllers we have in place the installation and live artist gallery by Disc Jam Artist Collective will yet again be the talk of the summer. In addition to the team members we‚Äôve pulled in one of the most talented and dedicated visionary artists in the game to join us in Gabriel Welch, if you‚Äôre familiar with his wok you know the caliber of art you‚Äôre going to get when you see him create, if you‚Äôre not...be prepared to have your eyes and mind blown ü§Ø Now that we‚Äôve tuckered your mind body and souls out it‚Äôs time to refuel your temple and treat yourself to some of the best food vending selections in the scene! From full on vegan and vegetarian options to deep fried crunchy goodness we have you covered. Smoothies to pizza, ramen to wraps, breakfast, lunch and dinner and everything in between... we got you! Oh did we mention we literally have an on-site mini golf course, an ice cream parlor, and breakfast diner! Don‚Äôt really want to camp out? There is a 4 star resort hotel just 3 miles away at Jiminy Peak Ski Resort and 15 minuets away are a ton of hotel choices in nearby Pittsfield, MA ‚Ä¢Gates open Thursday June 7th at 10:00am. ‚Ä¢Camping is included with ALL ticket options. ‚Ä¢On-Site Parking is always FREE never wait for a shuttle or bus to get to your car/gear. ‚Ä¢Sunday Night Camping is allowed - please follow the very few rules we do have, be kind to yourselves and your neighbors üçç New to Disc Jam? Check out our 2016 and 2017 recaps videos, shot by our in-house team of videographers and edit by Rob Kennedy, enjoy! ‚Ä¢2017> https://youtu.be/uLjJtbYwBhE ‚Ä¢2016> https://youtu.be/J-ee9Vehy2Y www.discjammusicfestival.com

DSP Shows Presents Start Making Sense: Talking Heads Tribute with Swift Technique at The Haunt on 6/8!! 7:00pm Show 8:000pm Doors Start Making Sense: Talking Heads Tribute http://www.startmakingsenseband.com/ If David Byrne is one of the geniuses of modern times, then Start Making Sense is a tribute to genius. The musicians in this 7-piece Talking Heads Tribute take pride in faithfully recreating the music of Talking Heads entire career. Together they bring much of the Heads unique live show to the stage, with front man Jon Braun as a spot-on David Byrne, giving you a "once in a lifetime" experience. Prepare yourself for a rockin', funkin', danceable celebration of the new-wave art punk you loved from the 80's !!!

Dionysia w/ Justin Panigutti Band at Higher Ground

Saturday, June 9, 2018

8:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

198238547438365

Dionysia w/ Justin Panigutti Band at Higher Ground

Saturday, June 9, 2018 8:00PM

ONSALE NOW! ABOUT DIONYSIA: A powerhouse Alt/Indie Rock four piece hailing from Boston, Dionysia is a true example of raw, unbridled energy. Their sound is a vivacious medley of blues, rock and funk overtones with a dynamic blend of contemporary influence that pays homage to the music that they were raised on and the world that continues to drive their creative passions. With musical influences ranging from Led Zeppelin to the Red Hot Chili Peppers and everything in-between, these gentlemen are sure to grab your attention when they take the stage. Currently promoting the release of their EP, The Breach, Dionysia aims to continue playing their authentic and original high-octane music while delving deeper into the creation of their own unique sound. http://www.dionysiaband.com/ ABOUT JUSTIN PANIGUTTI BAND: Throughout the course of my musical career, I have learned three life lessons that continue to instruct and direct my actions, as I navigate the ever changing waters of life: Music is and always will be my home. Be it a garage, vehicle, stage, field, porch, kitchen line... No matter what we do or where we go, music follows us. So, I guess I'm always at home. Music and it's frequency is extremely powerful. It can, and will, change the world for the better. Not on some cheesy, hippy dippy level, in reality. No doubt. I am deeply humbled to be a part of the musical community to which I call home. So long as there is good music and ample love in the world I have nothing to fear. Drawing from this knowledge, I am committed to creating and performing music with feeling. If you can't feel music, then you're just hearing things. Whether leading a big band, my own band, or performing a solo show, I am always at home knowing I am on stage with all my friends. Every performance I take on is a true depiction of me and my craft and how I connect with my fellow musicians and audiences.

Danielle Ponder & The Tomorrow People (NY/USA)

Sunday, June 10, 2018

5:00PM

BEL AIR BREDA Caf√© Zaal Live Podium

Breda, None Specified

9
978928698950079

Danielle Ponder & The Tomorrow People (NY/USA)

Sunday, June 10, 2018 5:00PM - Sunday, June 10, 2018 7:00PM

When Danielle Ponder and the Tomorrow People hit the stage things get torqued up quickly like a tent revival during tornado season. Named Top Ten Bands to watch by CityPaper, and winner of the 2015 and 2016 Roc Awards, "Best Band", Danielle Ponder and the Tomorrow People transcend musical genres with a blast of deep, powerful groove and soul. The band is the groove while Ponder‚Äôs pipes keep it rooted in soul. And according to Ponder, soul is more than a sound. ‚ÄúSoul music is something you feel,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúIt gives you goose bumps.‚Äù This Rochester, NY Native has spent the past years rendering goose bumps by perfecting her style and charismatic performance. She sings, you listen, you melt. The result of her focus and dedication is a tone that is both enchanting and seductive along with a riveting, honest stage presence. It is this voice that has helped her secure gigs opening up for powerhouses such as George Clinton, Ledisi and The Roots. The band has also completed two successful European tours. Boyd Kletter of Bourbon Street Blues Club in Amsterdam said "Danielle shines bright both on and off the stage. She's truly is a star!" In 2016 the singer released her debut EP Blow Out The Sun. Soultracks.com said ‚ÄúPonder‚Äôs vocals combine the spirit of the church with the speak-truth- to-power assertiveness of a movement leader. ‚Äú Jeff Speak of the Democrat & Chronicle wrote "Ponder‚Äôs tough-sounding vocals on ‚ÄúThree Word Revolution (I Love Myself)‚Äù is a defiant call to self worth. That title track feels custom built as a room-shaking anthem for women in the audience.‚Äù In 2016 the band would also enter the AfroPunk Battle of the Bands contest, where they surpassed hundreds of bands and made it to the final four. To Ponder, the audience is integral to the performance. They are, in a sense, part of the band. We are all tomorrow people. "When I get on stage I want the audience to be just as important as the musicians. I want to hear them, feel them, and see them dancing and moving.‚Äù And the crowd does just that. This daughter of a preacher take the audience to church, as she dances across stage and belts out her notes, it is clear that her gospel roots have had a strong influence. This sensational singer also lists powerful influences that lit her fuse like Nina Simone, Big Mama Thornton, Koko Taylor, and Lauryn Hill. Ponder opens her mouth to sing and it‚Äôs readily apparent; there‚Äôs another name that belongs in that pantheon as well. Danielle Ponder, and her time is now.

Pope Paul & The Illegals at Radio Bean

Pope Paul & The Illegals are excited to return to Vermont and play Radio Bean for the first time! Hailing from Santa Ana, California, Pope Paul brings an eclectic mix of rockabilly, western swing, outlaw country, psychobilly punk rock, and general guitar slingin' wizardry. You won't be able to stop yourself from dancing, drinking, and having a great time. Pope Paul & The Illegals have brought their high-energy show to 27 different states and have played festivals in locales as diverse as Nashville, TN, El Paso, TX, Apalachicola, FL, and Riverside, CA. Come see the rock n roll sensation that's sweeping the nation! https://www.facebook.com/PopePaulandtheIllegals/ https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ox-LlSSnu_U (Live in the studio)(Honky Tonk/Rockabilly) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=24QBD-5I9es (Bopflix session at Nashville Boogie) https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SUdSzvGtjSo (Live in the studio) (Instrumental Rockabilly)

X Ambassadors w/ Flint Eastwood at Higher Ground

Tuesday, June 12, 2018

8:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
2104058033149519

X Ambassadors w/ Flint Eastwood at Higher Ground

Tuesday, June 12, 2018 8:30PM

http://www.xambassadors.com/ X Ambassadors‚Äô debut album VHS reflects on the events that shaped lead vocalist and lyricist Sam Harris and his older brother, keyboardist Casey Harris‚Äô life growing up in Ithaca, NY. ‚ÄúIt was us looking back on everything that made us who we are,‚Äù says Sam. The gold-certified album, which Rolling Stone called ‚Äúbombastic rock that‚Äôs as stomping as it is diaristic, leavened by big-tent pop hooks and a hint of hip-hop swagger,‚Äù debuted at No. 7 on Billboard‚Äôs Top 200 chart and spawned the platinum-selling ‚ÄúRenegades,‚Äù which spent 12 consecutive weeks at No. 1 on the Alternative chart, and the double-platinum ‚ÄúUnsteady,‚Äù which went Top 10 at Alternative, Hot AC, and Top 40 radio. The success of VHS sent X Ambassadors on a nearly two-year touring odyssey that found them winning over fans around the world and performing at the Lollapalooza, Bonnaroo, Life is Beautiful, and Shaky Knees festivals, among others, and establishing themselves as a world-class rock band. Their rise has been studded by an impressive list of accomplishments. The band, which also includes Sam‚Äôs college friend, Los Angeles-raised drummer Adam Levin, were nominated for an iHeartRadio Music Award, two Teen Choice awards, two Billboard Music awards, and an American Music award. They guested on tracks by Eminem, The Knocks, Zedd, Skylar Grey, and Lil Wayne, Wiz Khalifa, and their KIDinaKORNER labelmates Imagine Dragons (‚ÄúSucker for Pain‚Äù). ‚ÄúCollider,‚Äù a song they wrote with Rage Against The Machine‚Äôs Tom Morello, was chosen as the soundtrack to ESPN‚Äôs season-long college football marketing campaign. Sam co-wrote a song for Rihanna called ‚ÄúAmerican Oxygen,‚Äù produced by Alex da Kid and Kanye West. And finally, at last year‚Äôs SXSW, Sam and Casey sat in with The Roots, performing two X Ambassadors songs and a cover of Sam Cooke‚Äôs ‚ÄúBring It On Home To Me.‚Äù ‚ÄúThat was a dream come true for me,‚Äù Sam says. X Ambassadors returned the favor by inviting The Roots to co-headline the band‚Äôs inaugural Cayuga Sound Festival, which takes place in Ithaca this fall. ‚ÄúWe wanted to give back to the community that raised us,‚Äù Sam says of the festival, which is curated by the band, and also features K.Flay, The Knocks, and Tei Shi on the bill. Proceeds will be donated to the city‚Äôs Community School of Music and Arts, where Sam took music and dance lessons as a kid, along with other local programs and organizations. Ithaca looms large in the story of X Ambassadors. Not only did it serve as major thematic inspiration on VHS, but Sam cites returning to their hometown to headline a sold-out fundraiser for the city‚Äôs State Theatre in May 2016 as one of his highlights of the last two years. ‚ÄúMy teachers and mentors were there, my mom was there,‚Äù he recalls. ‚ÄúShe came up on stage and sang ‚ÄòGeorgia on My Mind‚Äô with me while Casey accompanied us. It was really incredible. Everything kind of came full circle in that moment.‚Äù Since coming off the road, X Ambassadors have been writing songs for their second album, pushing themselves to infuse each new song with a soulful feeling. ‚ÄúThese are influences we‚Äôve had forever ‚Äî artists like Ray Charles, Joe Cocker, Otis Redding, and The Band ‚Äî but I think I held back a lot on the last record,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúI was so focused on coming up with something that would really open doors for us that I forgot to use my voice to its fullest extent.‚Äù Not any longer. The album‚Äôs first single, ‚ÄúAhead of Myself,‚Äù is an impassioned, fervid song inspired by Sam‚Äôs tendency to jump into things before thinking them through. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs the story on paper, but in reality, it tells a much bigger story,‚Äù he says. X Ambassadors‚Äô fans got a taste of the band‚Äôs current sonic direction with three songs released earlier this year, the rollicking ‚ÄúThe Devil You Know‚Äù (which was featured in a trailer for the upcoming Tom Cruise film American Made), the slow-burning ‚ÄúTorches‚Äù (which was heard in the film Transformers: The Last Knight), and the inspirational ‚ÄúHoping,‚Äù which was written in the days after the presidential election. For six months, all proceeds from ‚ÄúHoping‚Äù went to benefit the American Civil Liberties Union (ACLU), which is fighting Donald Trump‚Äôs immigration ban, among other things. X Ambassadors also performed at a benefit concert to support Planned Parenthood on the eve of International Women‚Äôs Day at the Roxy in Los Angeles in March. ‚ÄúI believe that life and politics are inseparable,‚Äù Sam says. ‚ÄúAnd this is a time when a lot of people are feeling very scared, so to show a bit of solidarity can't hurt. And we really, truly believe in human rights and equal rights for everyone.‚Äù

The Black Dahlia Murder / Whitechapel at FnW Music Hall

The Felice Brothers wsg. Folkfaces & The Old Main

Friday, June 15, 2018

9:00PM

Waterhole

Saranac Lake, NY

9
1881102122179973

The Felice Brothers wsg. Folkfaces & The Old Main

Friday, June 15, 2018 9:00PM - Saturday, June 16, 2018 1:00AM

The Felice Bothers wsg. Folkfaces & The Old Main At The Waterhole Music Lounge June 15th, 2018 Doors 8pm Show 9pm 21+ $18.00 Advanced $22.00 Door www.saranaclakewaterhole.com 48 Main St. Saranac Lake, NY The Felice Brothers - Catskills, NY http://www.thefelicebrothers.com The Felice Brothers‚Äô new album Life in the Dark, out now on Yep Roc, is classic American music. At once plainspoken and deeply literate, the band‚Äô s latest features nine new songs that capture the hopes and fears, the yearning and resignation, of a rootless, restless nation at a time of change. Life in the Dark also coincides with The Felice Brothers‚Äô 10th anniversary as a band. Hailed by the AV Club for a sound at once ‚Äú timeless, yet tossed-off,‚Äù they‚Äô ve released plenty of music over the past decade, often on their own without a record label, but the new album is the fullest realization yet of the band‚Äô s DIY tendencies. Self-produced by the musicians and engineered by James Felice (who also contributed accordion, keyboards and vocals), the Felice Brothers made Life in the Dark themselves in a garage on a farm in upstate New York, observed only by audience of poultry. ‚ÄúThe recording is definitely rough around the edges and cheap,‚Äù James Felice says, laughing. ‚Äú It was liberating and really cool to do. It allowed us to untether ourselves from anything and just make music.‚Äù Because of makeshift studio set-up, the music they made was necessarily stripped down, emphasizing acoustic instruments and spacious arrangements on songs that showcase the sound of a band playing together live, with echoes in the music of Woody Guthrie, Townes Van Zandt, John Prine and rural blues. ‚Äú We tried to make it as simple and folk-based as possible, because we were working with limited resources,‚Äù singer and guitarist Ian Felice says. ‚Äú We wanted to take all the frills out and make it just meat and potatoes.‚Äù Still, there are hints of seasoning: among the folk and blues touchstones, the band took a certain inspiration from Neil Young and the Meat Puppets, too. Ian Felice says he was trying to channel the spirit of Meat Puppets II on opener ‚Äú Aerosol Ball‚Äù ‚Äî‚Äú They played kind of weird, freaky folk music, so there‚Äô s a connection there,‚Äù he says ‚Äî while James Felice says listening to Neil Young‚Äô s Tonight‚Äôs the Night was like getting permission to make Life in the Dark. ‚Äú If you listen to that record, it‚Äô s fucking crazy,‚Äù he says. ‚Äú We listened to that to know that what we were doing was legal and had precedent. If Neil Young could make a record that sounds like that, we can make a record that sounds like this.‚Äù He‚Äô s referring to the wild, whirling accordion and big, loose rhythm on ‚Äú Aerosol Ball,‚Äù mournful glimmers of electric guitar and fiddle on ‚Äú Triumph ‚Äô 73‚Äù and the ramshackle, blues-rock feel of ‚Äú Plunder,‚Äù full of grainy lead guitars, blasts of organ and a shout-along chorus inspired by the rhythm of Shakespeare‚Äô s ‚Äú Double, double toil and trouble‚Äù incantation in Macbeth. Though The Felice Brothers often share songwriting duties, the band gravitated toward Ian Felice‚Äô s songs for Life in the Dark. Along with Shakespeare and the Meat Puppets, Ian Felice absorbed the essence of writers from Anne Sexton to Anne Frank, Raymond Carver to Dr. Seuss, on tunes with clear, if unintentional, political undertones. ‚Äú It‚Äô s just what was going on when I was writing the songs,‚Äù Ian Felice says. ‚Äú It‚Äô s a pretty politically charged climate right now.‚Äù To say the least. The singer‚Äô s characters on ‚Äú Aerosol Ball‚Äù exist in a dystopian culture bought, and ruled, by corporations; while ‚Äú Jack at the Asylum‚Äù catalogs cultural ills including climate change, economic inequality and the numbing aspects of televised warfare, themes that recur again on ‚Äú Plunder.‚Äù He wrote the title track after re-reading The Diary of a Young Girl, the journal that Frank kept while in hiding from the Nazis during World War II. ‚Äú The idea of living in a dark attic unable to fully grasp what is going on in your life and feeling powerless to change it seemed like a relevant metaphor for me at the time,‚Äù Ian Felice says. Elsewhere, he offers his own interpretation of classic American archetypes: ‚Äú Triumph ‚Äô 73‚Äù follows a young man on the cusp of adulthood desperate to ride his motorcycle away from the life changes overtaking him, while the ballad ‚Äú Diamond Bell‚Äù tells the story of a folk heroine gunslinger in the vein of Pretty Boy Floyd or Jesse James, and the hapless, lovestruck kid she ensnares. ‚Äú It‚Äô s part-love song, part-adventure story, part-tragedy, told in the Mexican folk tradition of singing about bandits,‚Äù Ian Felice says. ‚Äú I think it‚Äô s one of the most straight-ahead narratives I‚Äô ve written.‚Äù The band, also including Josh Rawson on bass and Greg Farley on fiddle, with drums by David Estabrook, spent about a month recording Life in the Dark in the late winter of 2015. James Felice learned engineering on the fly ‚Äî‚Äú I literally had a book, like, ‚Äò Where do you put the mic? How do you mic the kick drum?‚Äô‚Äù he says ‚Äî and the band managed to nail most of the tunes within a few takes. ‚Äú There wasn‚Äô t too much agonizing, just the joy of playing music,‚Äù James Felice says. ‚Äú We had an audience of chickens, and an audience of each other, and we were just really enjoying making it.‚Äù The resulting album is more than just classic American music ‚Äîit‚Äô s a parable for modern America.

Anthony Jeselnik at Flynn Theatre

Saturday, June 16, 2018

8:00PM

Flynn Center for the Performing Arts

Burlington, VT

9
140999739923218

Anthony Jeselnik at Flynn Theatre

Saturday, June 16, 2018 8:00PM

Anthony Jeselnik at Flynn Theatre Tix on sale Friday, Jan. 26th at 10am Anthony Jeselnik is a stand-up comedian from Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. Anthony starred in and created THE JESELNIK OFFENSIVE, which ran for two seasons on Comedy Central. Anthony has written for and appeared on several roasts for Comedy Central, most notably THE ROAST OF DONALD TRUMP and THE ROAST OF CHARLIE SHEEN. Anthony has performed on CONAN, THE TONIGHT SHOW, JIMMY KIMMEL LIVE and was the first ever stand-up comic to appear on LATE NIGHT WITH JIMMY FALLON. He has also written for LATE NIGHT WITH JIMMY FALLON and received an Emmy Nomination for his work on A NIGHT OF TOO MANY STARS: AN OVERBOOKED CONCERT FOR AUTISM EDUCATION. Anthony was named one of Variety‚Äôs 10 Comics to Watch in 2008 and one of Comedy Central‚Äôs Hot Comics in 2009. In 2010, Anthony released his debut comedy album, SHAKESPEARE, through Comedy Central Records. In 2013, he released CALIGULA, his first hour long special, to critical acclaim. Anthony hosted season nine of NBC‚Äôs LAST COMIC STANDING alongside judges Norm Macdonald, Roseanne Barr and Keenen Ivory Wayans. Anthony received praise for his hour long special THOUGHTS AND PRAYERS, which was released by Netflix in 2015.

AWOLNATION at Higher Ground

Sunday, June 17, 2018

7:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
341810066307880

AWOLNATION at Higher Ground

Sunday, June 17, 2018 7:30PM

http://awolnationmusic.com/ Creating a modern-day version of an American rock-n-roll album is no easy task in today‚Äôs world of Pro Tools and multiple producers, but Awolnation were up to challenge when the multi-platinum rock act set out to record their third studio album. Released February 2, 2018, Here Come the Runts (Red Bull Records) sees founding member Aaron Bruno once again at the helm producing, writing and recording. ‚ÄúWith this record I really wanted to make a rock n‚Äô roll/pop album,‚Äù says Bruno. ‚ÄúAnd I say ‚Äòpop‚Äô how I grew up listening to it, in the sense of Dire Straits or Born In The U.S.A or The Cars or Tom Petty.‚Äù Here Come the Runts is the follow up to the platinum-certified debut album Megalithic Symphony, and 2015‚Äôs Run, which included the #1 hit ‚ÄúHollow Moon (Bad Wolf)‚Äù as well as ÔøΩTop 5 tracks ‚ÄúI Am‚Äù and ‚ÄúWoman Woman.‚Äù Bruno spent 2017 crafting the album in his home studio nestled in the coastal mountain range separating the Pacific Ocean and the suburbs of Los Angeles where he grew up. The secluded location is reflected throughout the album. ‚ÄúThe record definitely has a feel to it that seems parallel to the vibe of this mountain and the land,‚Äù Bruno notes. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like a non-GMO record. There‚Äôs no fake shit on there, none of the vocals are tuned. It‚Äôs all real playing.‚Äù Fourteen tracks later, Here Come the Runts was inspired by the albums he grew up listening to as a sort of goal post. Bruno set out to create his version of an all-American rock n‚Äô roll album, AWOLNATION style. ‚ÄúI wanted to make an album that felt like the dream of America that isn‚Äôt necessarily true, certainly not as much as it once was. Or maybe it never has been‚Ä¶ but the idea of when you listen you just feel this nostalgic sentiment of a high school reunion, or that girl you fell in love with that you never got to talk to in junior high. The feeling of unity and anthemic songs. The spirit of what I thought Born In The U.S.A was, inspired this record in a lot of ways.‚Äù Formed in 2010, Awolnation crafted one of the most influential songs in years with the chart-topping, record-breaking track ‚ÄúSail.‚Äù The first single off the gold-certified full-length debut Megalithic Symphony, ‚ÄúSail‚Äù was certified 6x platinum in the US and holds the record for the most weeks on the Billboard Hot 100 chart by an independent artist, the second longest for any artist. The song has also achieved global success: certified 10x platinum in Norway, 6x platinum in Canada, 3x platinum in Sweden, 2x platinum in Australia and New Zealand, platinum in Switzerland, gold in Austria, Germany, and the UK. The critically-acclaimed sophomore release Run spawned three other Top 10 US singles, including their first #1 hit on the Billboard Alternative Chart, ‚ÄúHollow Moon (Bad Wolf).‚Äù Awolnation have chosen to use their success as a platform for good, partnering with various charities including Music Saves Lives, Love Your Melon, and The Lance McCullers Jr. Foundation. Awolnation have a direct relationship with their devoted fans through Awolnation Builders‚Äîmuch more than just a fanclub, the Awolnation Builders are a continuous call to action on all things Awol including tour dates, videos, exclusive content, charity initiatives and more. They continue to sell-out headlining shows across the globe and have secured spots on festivals like Coachella, Voodoo Festival, Austin City Limits, Osheaga, Austria‚Äôs Frequency Festival, Bonnaroo, Leeds, Redding, and Brazil‚Äôs Mix FM Festival.

Robert Earl Keen at Higher Ground

Thursday, June 21, 2018

8:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
337235723450251

Robert Earl Keen at Higher Ground

Thursday, June 21, 2018 8:00PM

http://www.robertearlkeen.com/ "The road goes on forever ..." It's not always easy to sum up a career - let alone a life's ambition - so succinctly, but those five words from Robert Earl Keen's calling-card anthem just about do it. You can complete the lyric with the next five words - the ones routinely shouted back at Keen by thousands of fans a night ("and the party never ends!") - just to punctuate the point with a flourish, but it's the part about the journey that gets right to the heart of what makes Keen tick. Some people take up a life of playing music with the goal of someday reaching a destination of fame and fortune; but from the get-go, Keen just wanted to write and sing his own songs, and to keep writing and singing them for as long as possible. "I always thought that I wanted to play music, and I always knew that you had to get some recognition in order to continue to play music," Keen says. "But I never thought of it in terms of getting to be a big star. I thought of it in terms of having a really, really good career and writing some good songs, and getting onstage and having a really good time." Now three-decades on from the release of his debut album - with eighteen other records to his name, thousands of shows under his belt and still no end in sight to the road ahead - Keen remains as committed to and inspired by his muse as ever. And as for accruing recognition, well, he's done alright on that front, too; from his humble beginnings on the Texas folk scene, he's blazed a peer, critic, and fan-lauded trail that's earned him living-legend (not to mention pioneer) status in the Americana music world. And though the Houston native has never worn his Texas heart on his sleeve, he's long been regarded as one of the Lone Star State's finest (not to mention top-drawing) true singer-songwriters. He was still a relative unknown in 1989 when his third studio album, West Textures, was released - especially on the triple bill he shared at the time touring with legends Townes Van Zandt and Guy Clark - but once fellow Texas icon Joe Ely recorded both "The Road Goes on Forever" and "Whenever Kindness Fails" on his 1993 album, Love and Danger, the secret was out on Keen's credentials as a songwriter's songwriter. By the end of the decade, Keen was a veritable household name in Texas, headlining a millennial New Year's Eve celebration in Austin that drew an estimated 200,000 people. A dozen years later, he was inducted into the Texas Heritage Songwriters Hall of Fame along with the late, great Van Zandt and his longtime friend from Texas A & M, Lyle Lovett. But the road goes on and on, with no time for resting on laurels. Not that Keen's complaining. "I had a relatively open schedule for 2016 back at the beginning of the year, but it has just filled in like you wouldn't believe," he marvels during a rare day off in Kerrville, Texas (where he lives with his wife and two daughters). "I've broke my record this year - I've packed for five trips at one time, because I wasn't going to be starting any of them in the same place. It's been crazy! It isn't always easy being Robert Earl Keen, but somebody's got to do it. And now more than ever, he's up to the task and loving every minute of it.

Cold War Kids at Higher Ground

Friday, June 22, 2018

9:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
199611670793465

Cold War Kids at Higher Ground

Friday, June 22, 2018 9:00PM

http://www.coldwarkids.com On their sixth album LA Divine, Cold War Kids pay tribute to Los Angeles and all its strange glory. The follow-up to 2014's Hold My Home -- featuring the gold-certified single "First" -- the band's latest is slightly tongue-in-cheek in its title. "In many ways LA is the least divine city, the most hedonistic and irreverent and disconnected from history," says Cold War Kids singer/guitarist/pianist Nathan Willett. Still, LA Divine embodies the Long Beach-bred band's endless fascination with their adopted hometown. "LA's so massive, I feel like I'm always finding something new in it," says bassist Matt Maust. "It's an incredibly weird place, and I'm happy to have made a record that totally honors that weirdness." A feeling of infinite discovery instills much of LA Divine, the band's most expansive and ambitious effort so far. With Cold War Kids having recently marked the 10-year anniversary of their acclaimed debut Robbers & Cowards (a 2006 release that spawned their breakthrough single "Hang Me Up to Dry"), the album channels the kinetic energy of a newly revitalized band. "The excitement I have about this new album -- it feels so much like the way I felt back when our first record came out," notes Maust. For Cold War Kids -- whose lineup also includes drummer Joe Plummer, multi-instrumentalist Matthew Schwartz, and guitarist David Quon -- that rejuvenation follows a creative rebirth of sorts. As Willett explains, the band took a more pop-informed and decidedly inventive approach to the making of LA Divine. "From the start of the band, our tastes have always been very backward-looking in terms of the tones and sounds and instrumentation we're working with," he says. "On this album we wanted to embrace something more modern, because in many ways the most creative sounds happening right now are coming from the world of pop and out of that influence we've ironically created what sounds like our most rock record yet "

Just in case you aren‚Äôt familiar with Bela Fleck, there are some who say he‚Äôs the world‚Äôs premier banjo player. Others claim that B√©la has virtually reinvented the image and the sound of the banjo through a remarkable performing and recording career that has taken him all over the musical map and on a range of solo projects and collaborations. If you are familiar with B√©la, you know that he just loves to play the banjo, and put it into unique settings.

Southern Culture on the Skids

Saturday, June 30, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
1932630750098602

Southern Culture on the Skids

Saturday, June 30, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Southern Culture on the Skids at The Haunt on 6/30!! **Previously scheduled to be at the Dock** 7:00pm Doors 8:00pm Show Southern Culture on the Skids http://www.scots.com/ Southern Culture On The Skids has been spreading the rock and roll gospel since since they formed in Chapel Hill, NC in 1983. Guitarist/singer Rick Miller, drummer Dave Hartman and bassist/singer/heartbreaker Mary Huff, play a greasy mix of surf, rockabilly, R&B and country-fried garage with a side of psych, all the while driving fans into ecstatic, sweat-drenched paroxysms of joy. It's a musical gumbo Miller calls, ‚ÄúAmericana from the wrong side of the tracks.‚Äú The band has been prolific and ubiquitous for over thirty years, touring everywhere from the North Carolina Prison System to Mt. Fuji, Japan and delivering what Rolling Stone calls ‚Äúa hell raising rock and roll party.‚Äú In 2014 the band was honored by the Southern Folk Life Collection at the University of North Carolina Chapel Hill with an exhibition featuring their music and cultural contributions. The flame-adorned La-Z-Boy from the cover of their Plastic Seat Sweat LP now resides at UNC-CH! THE ELECTRIC PINECONES Southern Culture On The Skids' newest album, The Electric Pinecones, will be released on September 16, 2016. It's the band's fifth album on their own label, Kudzu Records. The album features 12 original SCOTS tunes - 11 brand new songs and a whole-lotta NOLA remake of the SCOTS classic, ‚ÄúSwamp Fox - The Original.‚Äú All the tunes were produced and recorded at Rick's studio in NC, The Kudzu Ranch. The Electric Pinecones is a bit of a departure for the band conceptually and sonically. The inspiration for the record was born in an alter-ego side project from the early years of the band. ‚ÄúThe Pinecones was folk-a-hill-a-billy garage band we used to put together just for kicks,‚Äú Miller relates. ‚ÄúWe loved the sound of '60s west coast folk rock and psych bands. The Pinecones was our outlet for material that was not in the SCOTS vein. We even opened for ourselves occasionally. The Pinecones set list was the jumping off point for this latest collection of songs.‚Äú The first single off the album, ‚ÄúGrey Skies,‚Äú is a minor key mood piece with that folk-a-billy, psychedelic sound. Listen to how the acoustic 12-string riff slides into the band's hypnotic rhythms that propel Mary Huff's reflective vocal into the mind's eye of times past and love lost. ‚ÄúCheck out the Mellotron on the chorus - that is a first for us,‚Äú Miller says. The lead off track, ‚ÄúFreak Flag,‚Äú is more upbeat, but no less tweaked, with modulating guitars riding on pounding drums after the first verse. The song's message is a good one - it is okay to be different and always respect yourself. The band debuted the song to an auditorium full of rowdy students at Carrboro Elementary School. ‚ÄúI was nervous,‚Äú Miller says ‚Äúif the kids don't like something they let you know, but when they started singing along with the second chorus and waving their imaginary freak flags in the air, I knew it was a hit!‚Äú ‚ÄúDirt Road‚Äú is Mary's three-minute ode to sances, thunderstorms and good lovin' long gone. The song is a backwoods southern gothic ghost story that opens with a big tom fill then twists and turns around a folky strum and a fuzz guitar. Mary's spooky-good vocal takes it down that dirt road way back into the piney woods. The album also has some country rock songs that highlight the melodic side of SCOTS, with ‚ÄúBaby I Like You,‚Äú ‚ÄúI Ain't Gonna Hang Around‚Äú and ‚ÄúGiven To Me‚Äú featuring some of the best harmonies Rick and Mary have ever recorded.‚ÄúWaiting On You‚Äú is the longest song on the album, coming in at 4:22; it's a folk-garage-rocker with a sing-a-long chorus that segues into a surf raga breakdown before heading back to the big riff and out. The album has traditional Southern Culture flavor too. Check out the remake of ‚ÄúSwamp Fox - The Original‚Äú. This take goes back to the beginnings of the song and is much closer to capturing the essence of the many all-nighters the band pulled in NOLA with friends and colleagues. The country funk of ‚ÄúRice and Beans,‚Äú is a good humored tale of a cash strapped southern courtship, and ‚ÄúMidnight Caller‚Äú is Mary's slinky R'n'B flavored woman-to-woman warning about bad men looking for good times. Song for song, on The Electric Pinecones, Southern Culture On The Skids continues to blow minds and blur the lines between genres delivering a stellar album. From their 1985 debut Voodoo Beach Party, to their 1988 international smash, Dirt Track Date (featuring the hit single ‚ÄúCamel Walk‚Äú), and now to the SCOTS-ified tunes of The Electric Pinecones, 30 years, 200 songs and 1,000,000 road miles in, Southern Culture On The Skids just continues to get better with time.

The Great Blue Heron Music Festival 2018

Friday, July 6, 2018

9:00AM

The Great Blue Heron Music Festival

Sherman, NY

9
546562705696518

The Great Blue Heron Music Festival 2018

Friday, July 6, 2018 9:00AM - Sunday, July 8, 2018 10:00PM

The 27th Annual Great Blue Heron Music Festival. Since 1992, music lovers of all ages have trekked to The Heron, the Chautauqua County farm that hosts thousands of family and friends each year over Independence Day weekend. Many who started coming to the festival with their parents now return with children of their own. The Blue Heron has become a very family-oriented event with activities for all ages. See all about Heron Family Fun on this webpage. http://greatblueheron.com/wp/ While the site has gradually expanded to accommodate the growing number of visitors (about 7000 attendees currently), the fundamentals of the festival remain the same: Present a diverse assortment of original music from regional and national artists; create a collaborative artistic space where all are encouraged to participate and interact; and foster a cooperative and positive environment for celebration, while ensuring a safe and satisfying experience for the whole community.

Femi Kuti & The Positive Force w/ Jupiter & Okwess at Higher Ground

Wednesday, July 25, 2018

8:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
1862539163770616

Femi Kuti & The Positive Force w/ Jupiter & Okwess at Higher Ground

Wednesday, July 25, 2018 8:30PM

http://www.femiakuti.com/ Femi Kuti is the heart and soul of modern Afrobeat. Femi‚Äôs father, Fela Anikulapo- Kuti, created the style - a blend of traditional Nigerian drum patterns, the smooth groove of highlife and American soul, funk and R&B ‚Äì and took it to the world, inspiring people with insistent dance beats and lyrics bristling with political statements. One People One World will be released by Knitting Factory Records on February 23, 2018. Femi recorded most of the album in chaotic Lagos, with musicians from The Positive Force, and his son, Omorinmade Anikulapo ‚Äì Kuti. ‚ÄúOn this album, I kept to my roots and let the music flow through me, without diluting it. I didn‚Äôt think funk, or Afrobeat, or anything else. If you hear something in the melodies, it may be there, but as a composer, I surrendered to the higher forces that give me this gift to play music and let it flow out of me.‚Äù

July 26-29: Fiddlers Picnic

Thursday, July 26, 2018

8:00PM

Herby1 Presents

Marion, NY

9
1341525159285639

July 26-29: Fiddlers Picnic

Thursday, July 26, 2018 8:00PM - Sunday, July 29, 2018 6:00PM

Pickin' and grinnin' all weekend long, featuring top acts from Upstate NY and beyond. Regional and local favorites playing americana, bluegrass, newgrass, folk, and roots music staged under a patch of 40 foot Norway Spruce. Arts, crafts and food vending area. Friends and family welcome, kids 16 & under are free. Located 30 min east of downtown Rochester in western Wayne County. vendors: Colleen Bielemeier all others: Herby1 Presents

Punch Brothers at Flynn Theatre

Thursday, July 26, 2018

8:00PM

Flynn Center for the Performing Arts

Burlington, VT

9
194791274624261

Punch Brothers at Flynn Theatre

Thursday, July 26, 2018 8:00PM

Tix on sale Friday, 3/2 at 10am Punch Brothers' latest album, the T Bone Burnett‚Äìproduced The Phosphorescent Blues, addresses with straight-up poignancy and subversive humor the power and the pitfalls of our super-connected era. Digitally fueled isolation may be a theme, but this virtuosic acoustic quintet offers its warmest, most emotive and elegantly melodic work to date. A longing for community and connection was both impetus and inspiration for this disc. Punch Brothers had been touring almost non-stop since uniting to support mandolin player Chris Thile's 2006 solo album, How to Grow a Woman From the Ground. After scaling back in February 2013, the band began writing sessions where, Thile relates, they had animated debates about how they relate to music, and to each other, through a digital filter.

Add a deep bass line and 3 part vocal harmonies and the result is tasty and something everyone can move to! See you then!

The Gathering at Chaffee‚Äôs Music Festival 2018

Friday, July 27, 2018

12:00PM

Burlington, VT

9
211703376080960

Tumbledown Afterparty ft. Hayley Jane and the Primates, Formula5

Saturday, July 28, 2018 11:00PM - Sunday, July 29, 2018 2:00AM

Official Tumble Down Afterparty ft. Hayley Jane and the Primates and Formula 5 11pm doors ‚Ä¢ 21+ $10 ADV ‚Ä¢ $10 DOS ~~~~~~~~~~ Hayley Jane and the Primates Hayley Jane & The Primates combine Americana, soul and rock & roll with rich lyrical imagery that electrifies the heart. At the helm is rising star, Hayley Jane. She leads the band through an infectious live experience filled with powerful vocal range, vibrant dance choreography and dramatic performance that captivates her devoted fanbase. Hailing from Boston MA, the band was the winner of the 2014 New England Music Awards‚Äô Roots/Americana Act Of The Year and has been performing at premiere venues and festivals across the country. Hayley Jane has also established herself as a strong female presence in the national music scene and was recently featured in the RELIX ‚ÄúWomen Who Rock‚Äù Issue. The band‚Äôs first full-length album, Gasoline, was engineered by Brian Wallace of Sublime and released in 2014. The album was recorded during a West Coast Tour that kicked off at the iconic Whisky a Go Go and ended with a Monday Night Football performance at Qualcomm Stadium. Hayley Jane and the Primates are releasing their sophomore album‚ÄúWe‚Äôre Here Now‚Äù in the Fall of 2017. Produced by Craig Brodhead of Turkuaz, the album carries an energy and poetry that represents the best of American music. Hayley Jane- Lead Vox/ Washboard Justin "Juice" Hancock- Guitar/Vox Josh "Tree Beard" Carter- Bass/Vox Greg "Smitty" Smith- Guitar/Vox Ryan "The Claw" Clausen- Drums Formula 5 Formula 5 is your source for unique jams, infectious energy, and impressive musical prowess. "Their music celebrates all corners of the music landscape and a true strength of Formula 5 is a clean cohesiveness to their jams that never quits." - Jambase / Live Music News Check Us Out: Music: F5Jams.com Website: Formula5music.com FB: facebook.com/formula5music/

Angela Perley & The Howlin' Moons

Tuesday, July 31, 2018

8:00PM

Abilene Bar and Lounge

Rochester, NY

9
1468679853242482

Angela Perley & The Howlin' Moons

Tuesday, July 31, 2018 8:00PM - Tuesday, July 31, 2018 11:00PM

Angela Perley & The Howlin' Moons Live at Abilene Bar and Lounge Tuesday, July 31---8pm Super Low-Dough Show--Only $8 at the Door Armed with electric guitars, swooning vocals, and songs that split the difference between rock & roll and dreamy psychedelia, Angela Perley & the Howlin‚Äô Moons pack the biggest punch of their career with Homemade Vision. Like the band‚Äôs debut, Hey Kid ‚Äî an album whose kickoff track, ‚ÄúAthens,‚Äù earned Perley an International Songwriting Award in 2014 ‚Äî Homemade Vision was recorded in the Howlin‚Äô Moons‚Äô hometown of Columbus, Ohio. Many of the songs were dreamt up somewhere along the highways and backroads that crisscross America, though, coaxed into life by a group of roots-rock road warriors who regularly play more than 100 shows a year. As a result, Homemade Vision is the sort of wide-ranging record that creates its own geography, building an imaginary place where the influences of David Gilmour, Tom Petty, Led Zeppelin, and Nebula all intersect. It‚Äôs also the work of a genuine band. Chris Connor‚Äôs guitar playing ‚Äî a flurry of fuzz, crunch, twang and bang ‚Äî occupies just as large a role as Perley‚Äôs voice, while Billy Zehnal‚Äôs bass ‚Äî coupled with cymbal crashes and snare hits from an arsenal of heavy-hitting drummers ‚Äî glues the mix together. Inspired by love, heartbreak, and everything in between, Homemade Vision is a battle cry from a band that‚Äôs spent years fighting the good fight, carving out their own brand of atmospheric, aggressive Americana along the way.

Descendents at Higher Ground

Sunday, August 5, 2018

8:00PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
992767217548273

Descendents at Higher Ground

Sunday, August 5, 2018 8:00PM

http://descendents.tumblr.com/ The DESCENDENTS invented pop punk. Overstatement? Perhaps, but spend ten minutes scanning FM or the idiot box and you're bound to witness a ditty or video that tips its hat to a musical genre that was refined to a high art -- if not created outright -- by the 'Dents. Formed in 1978 against the fertile musical backdrop of Los Angeles' South Bay scene (see: Black Flag, Minutemen, SST Records, etc.), the caffeine-addled crew released their first 7" single "Ride The Wild" as a trio in 1979. Not long after, the boys recruited one Milo Aukerman (microbiology Ph.D. in waiting and poster boy for adolescent ne'er-do-well alienation) for vocal duties. Milo's fervent mic delivery coupled with his knack for hitting the lyrical nail on its heartrending head plunged him headfirst into the band's fold, and together they released the "FAT" EP in 1981. 1982 saw the release of the stellar "Milo Goes To College," a penultimate fusion of hooks and heartache which inspired the LA Times to write, "perfect for the little guy who was ever called a nerd and never got the girl... (its) earthy humor conveys what is often an inarticulate rage". And Milo really did go to college, leaving the practice room for the hallowed halls of higher education. Drummer Bill Stevenson went on to beat the skins for Black Flag while the guys temporarily hung up the DESCENDENTS moniker, only to reunite with Aukerman for 1985's "I Don't Want To Grow Up" and 1986's "Enjoy!" The two releases comprise the perfect case study in the dualistic, yin/yang nature of the band's output. While the former is a veritable user's manual for post-pubescent angst, sizing up the themes of life, love, and uncertainty with infectious wit and dizzying energy, the latter is perhaps most notable for its testaments to the, umm... follies of flatulence. Their cover of the Beach Boy's "Wendy" on "Enjoy!" is at once familiar and revelatory, the perfect amalgam of pop sensibilities and punk execution that would earn them fans the world over. With the introduction of new members Karl Alvarez and Stephen Egerton on bass and guitar respectively, the release of 1987's "ALL" full-length saw a band that had truly come into its own. While the tongue in cheek delivery remained intact, the music had become at once visceral and from the gut, a complex balance of straightforward delivery ("Clean Sheets", "Coolidge") and fringe-y, free jam inflections ("Schizophrenia", "Uranus"). The band toured incessantly throughout the mid and late '80s; all that time on the road paid off in spades in the form of two live albums, "Liveage!" and "Hallraker." And then Milo went back to college. The extant members went on to form the band ALL with ex-Dag Nasty vocalist Dave Smalley, continuing their prodigious musical output while maintaining a hectic tour schedule. It was not until 1996 that we'd see another DESCENDENTS release with "Everything Sucks," a perfect return to the pop punk form that the band had become known for. Fast forward to 2003, and lo and behold, the DESCENDENTS are back in the saddle with two new efforts slated for the release in 2004: a four song EP entitled "'Merican," and a bona fide full-length LP's worth of new material that goes by the name "Cool To Be You." Seeing as how punk is now a household name, and the ubiquitous "girl song" milieu infests the airwaves, will the DESCENDENTS reclaim their title as Kings of the Lovelorn Anthem? Only time will tell, but this much is certain: If imitation is the sincerest form of flattery, the DESCENDENTS must go to sleep with flushed cheeks every night of the week.

A Beatles Tribute: Spencer Albee & His Friends Are The Walrus at Higher Ground

Saturday, August 11, 2018

8:30PM

Higher Ground

South Burlington, VT

9
1526669114054935

A Beatles Tribute: Spencer Albee & His Friends Are The Walrus at Higher Ground

Saturday, August 11, 2018 8:30PM

http://www.spencerandthewalrus.com Portland Maine‚Äôs Spencer Albee (Rustic Overtones, AS FAST AS) leads an all star band through Beatles hits and deep cuts in what Rolling Stone calls ‚Äúa mind blowing tribute.‚Äù The band will be joined by some of Burlington‚Äôs favorite musicians as guest vocalists, The Maine Youth Rock Orchestra and The Fogcutters horns. The music of The Beatles is presented respectfully and energetically with all the orchestration, bells and whistles and none of the wigs, fake accents or costumes. Founded in 2002. The band: Spencer Albee (Rustic Overtones, AS FAST AS): vocals, keys, guitars Sean Morin (The Cambiata, Fort Gorgeous): Musical Director, guitar, keys Jon Roods (Rustic Overtones, Paranoid Social Club, Armies): bass Andrew Hodgkins (AS FAST AS, Elijah Ocean): drums Dan Capaldi (SeepeopleS, Sea Level): vocals, guitars, keys, percussion, samplers Blythe Armitage (Spencer Albee): Vocals, percussion The Maine Youth Rock Orchestra: Director: Kevin Oates The Fogcutters Horns & more!

Agent Orange

Agent Orange

Agent Orange

Sunday, August 12, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
1899674120298013

Agent Orange

Sunday, August 12, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents Agent Orange at The Haunt on 8/12/18!! *Tickets on sale Friday, 11/3 at 10AM* 7:00PM Doors 8:00PM Show Agent Orange http://www.agentorange.net/ The Original Southern California Punk/Surf Power Trio, Agent Orange, is one of only a handful of bands who have been continually active since the earliest days of the West Coast Punk Scene. A small circle of musical rebels who came together to form a movement, they took their place front and center to experience and participate in the explosion of now legendary underground music that was created during the golden era of American Punk Rock. Being the first to combine the melodic California surf guitar sound with the frantic energy of punk, Agent Orange invented the formula that would come to define the Orange County punk sound. Highly influential to many of the bands who have followed in their path, Agent Orange have always stayed one step ahead. Their strong connection to the Action Sports world has resulted in their music providing the soundtrack to numerous major motion pictures, video games, surf and skate films, television, and live sports events. The last of the true independents, Agent Orange have managed to stay true to their roots, while always moving forward. Powered by a loyal following built up through years of explosive live performances all over the world, Agent Orange continue to deliver their Fullblown-Supercharged-Punk-Surf Sound on an international basis, with a never ending schedule of tours in the United States, Canada, South America, Europe, Australia, and Japan. C‚Äômon down front and expose yourself to Agent Orange.

The Blasters

Thursday, August 23, 2018

8:00PM

The Haunt

Ithaca, NY

9
2038929679725049

The Blasters

Thursday, August 23, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents The Blasters with special guests Lara Hope & The Ark-Tones at The Haunt on 8/23!! 7:00pm Doors 8:00pm Show The Blasters http://theblasters.com/ The Blasters exemplify the best traditions of American Music, performing with passion and honesty that for over three decades has won the hearts and souls of fans worldwide. Composed of founding members vocalist-guitarist Phil Alvin, drummer Bill Bateman and bassist John Bazz with Keith Wyatt on guitar, they carry on a hard-won legacy as one of the most recognizable and credible bands in American Music. Their influences range from the likes of George Jones and Carl Perkins to Ike Turner, Howlin‚Äô Wolf, James Brown and Big Joe Turner, all blending into a sound that ignores the lines between Rock & Roll, Country, Blues and Rockabilly. "Fun On Saturday Night" (Rip Cat Records) is the Blasters' sixth and latest studio album, featuring twelve tracks that extend the band‚Äôs legacy of classic recordings. Fronted by Phil Alvin's powerful vocals, the band follows through with spontaneity, power and grit that make their live performances into experiences not to be missed. Lara Hope & The Ark-Tones https://www.larahopeandtheark-tones.com/ Winner of the 2017 Ameripolitan Music Award for Best Female Rockabilly Artist, and named the ‚ÄúBest Up-And-Coming Band‚Äù by Hudson Valley Magazine, Lara Hope and the Ark-Tones are New York‚Äôs premier roots rock n‚Äô roll, rockabilly, rhythm & blues outfit. The Ark-Tones recently released their 2nd full length album, "Love You to Life", on August 11th, and they will be hitting the road, spreading the gospel of American music wherever they go for the majority of 2018. Describing their sound, Hope explained to Rockabilly Online ‚ÄúI would say we are a new take on an old sound. It‚Äôs been described as ‚Äòpan-americana‚Äô which means we use many areas of early rock and roots music as a creative launchpad. Where it goes from there is anyone‚Äôs guess, because while we appreciate old music, we don‚Äôt want to write songs that have already been written." They‚Äôve built a great network of venues in the US by touring heavily, and like many American bands, they have gained supportive fans and excellent press overseas as well. They will be touring Europe for the first time in the coming year, spending the month of April 2018 in Belgium and Holland. Hope was featured on the cover of UK Rock n‚Äô Roll magazine in March 2015, and New York‚Äôs Ulster Magazine in March 2016. The band has shared the stage with many larger acts including Tiger Army, Gary US Bonds, Dale Watson, Big Sandy, Wayne Hancock, and America, and has performed at at a variety of festivals including Viva Las Vegas, Ink n Iron, and The Nashville Boogie. Born from a hybrid of Lara‚Äôs former rockabilly band The Champtones, and upright bassist Matt‚Äôs international psychobilly act, The Arkhams, The Ark-Tones hit the ground running in 2012 and haven‚Äôt slowed down since. Lara and Matt also perform as a duo (The Gold Hope Duo), and can even be found as the country/western entertainers at the one of longest running family resorts in New York, the Rocking Horse Ranch, performing under the name Lara and the Hope'Alongs. In 2017, Lara Hope won the Ameripolitan Music Award for Best Female Rockabilly Artist, accepting the award at The Paramount Theater in Austin, Texas, surrounded by musical heroes. The band is also known for their visually arresting videos - ‚ÄúWhiskey Pick‚Äù (from their debut album) and ‚ÄúI‚Äôm the One‚Äù (re-recorded for the new album) were official selections in the 2014 and 2016 Woodstock Film Festival.

Surrounded By The Sound Music & Arts Festival 2018

Chattooga River Resort and Campground

9

Surrounded By The Sound Music & Arts Festival 2018

Thursday, August 30, 2018 5:00PM - Thursday, August 30, 2018 11:45PM

THE 2nd ANNUAL SURROUNDED BY THE SOUND MUSIC & ARTS FESTIVAL - The East Coast's Premier Grassroots Music & Arts Festival Presented by Sun-Dried Vibes - Labor Day Weekend - - August 31 - September 3, 2018 - - Official Pre Party - August 30, 2018 - - Chattooga River Resort & Campground - - Long Creek, SC - http://www.sbtsfestival.com/ http://surroundedbythesoundfestival.com/ Surrounded by the Sound is the East Coast‚Äôs Premiere Grassroots Festival, showcasing the best up and coming talent on this side of the USA with a focus on the Reggae/Rock Scene. At SBTS we pride ourselves on offering attendees a sense of community and belonging to ‚Äúthe family we have found.‚Äù Every Labor Day weekend, we offer a peaceful getaway to the upstate of South Carolina where music lovers can escape the hustle and bustle of their daily lives and reconnect with themselves and other like minded individuals. SBTS is inspired by and named after the song ‚ÄúYoung One,‚Äù a collaboration between Sun-Dried Vibes (SBTS Founders) and TreeHouse! The song lyrics advise listeners to ‚Äútake heed of their bare necessities, friends and family‚Äù and that we are all one core group that is ‚Äúsurrounded by the sound.‚Äù If you‚Äôre looking for the perfect festival to help you connect with the music you love and the community of people that make it happen, then SBTS is for you. We hope you will join us for an unforgettable and life changing experience this Labor Day Weekend. Two Main Stages plus Acoustic & Late Night Stages, Disc Golf, Kids Zone, Craft Beer, Food & Merchandise Vendors, Art, Yoga, and GOOD VIBES! EARLY BIRD TICKETS ARE SOLD OUT! PHASE 1 TICKETS ARE SOLD OUT! PHASE 2 GA TICKETS, VIP UPGRADES, ULTIMATE SBTS VIP EXPERIENCE TICKETS & PRE PARTY TICKETS ON SALE NOW! Thursday, August 30th - OFFICIAL PRE PARTY $40 Ticket | Early Access to Campground (8 AM) Music Line-Up: Badfish - Sublime Tribute | Giant Panda Guerrilla Dub Squad | New Kingston | Sun-Dried Vibes | Tropidelic | Roots of a Rebellion | TreeHouse! | Ted Bowne of Passafire |Oogee Wawa | The Ries Brothers | Higher Education | Elephant Convoy | Little Stranger | Lovely Budz | Little Stranger | I.R.E. | Something Like Seduction | Panski | Bubba Love | Elementree Livity Project | SoPoz The Instructors | Sensi Trails | Galaxy Girl | Nomadic Culture | Mr. Headies | More Acts TBA on April 1st!! Tickets Available at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/surrounded-by-the-sound-music-arts-festival-2018-tickets-37889259796 Ticket FAQ (Q) What is the difference between Early Bird Tickets and Phase 1, 2 & 3 Tickets? (A) Early Bird Tickets, Phase 1, 2 & 3 Tickets are all the same ticket. This ticket is good for General Admission for the entire weekend (Friday through Sunday). The names only distinguish between price. (Q) Does a VIP Upgrade include my General Admission Ticket with it? (A) No. A VIP Upgrade is an Upgrade for your GA Ticket. You will still need to purchase a GA Ticket along with the VIP Upgrade. (Q) What if I want to bring a RV/Camper or Car Camp? Is this possible? (A) If you plan on attending in an RV/Camper or if you wish to Car Camp, you will need to purchase the respective parking pass for that as well. These camping spots gain you similar access as those with VIP Upgrades, so these are premium spots! There is also a small questionnaire you will need to fill out to help us accommodate you properly. If you have extra questions, email lucky@sbtsfestival.com (Q) What does the Ultimate VIP Ticket entail? (A) The Ultimate VIP Ticket includes your GA Ticket plus your VIP Upgrade, plus it gives you Artist Credentials. This means you have access to Artist Camping, Artist Hospitality (meals included) and side stage / back stage access. You will essentially be treated as an Artist and a SBTS VIP all weekend! It‚Äôs the ULTIMATE TICKET! (Q) What does the Pre Party Ticket include? (A) The Pre Party Ticket is a big bonus for a small price. Pre Party Tickets gain you early access to the campground (8 AM on Thursday morning), Pre Party Campsites (closer to the path leading to the music venue) plus an extra night of music starting at 5 PM!! (Q) Why do I have to buy a ticket to Volunteer? (A) Volunteer Tickets are refundable tickets! This means that upon completion of your volunteer shifts/duties, you will be refunded your ticket price in full. This helps ensure that we can count on you to help us create the perfect atmosphere and experience for our attendees and for yourself! Our Partners/Sponsors: Infamous Ink Tattoo Studio | Bangbox Percussion | Black Rose Custom Prints | Innova Disc Golf | Rowdy Roots Media | Flowlife Entertainment Food Vendors: Pep Rolls | One Love Fusion Foods | Music For Your Mouth | More TBA Retail, Apparel & Art Vendors: Grateful Gypsy | Hympknotic Designs | More TBA Not into Camping? - Hotels in Clayton, GA Days Inn | America's Best Value Inn | Quality Inn & Suites Additional Information and FAQ for SBTS available at www.sbtsfestival.com

Joan Baez: Fare Thee Well...Tour 2018

Joan Baez: Fare Thee Well...Tour 2018

DSP Shows Presents: Joan Baez Tuesday, September 11, 2018 8pm Showtime Six decades after becoming a regular on the coffee house scene that was emerging around Club 47 in Cambridge, MA, Joan Baez determined that ‚Äú2018 will be my last year of formal extended touring.‚Äù With her 2017 Rock & Roll Hall of Fame induction topping off a lifetime of awards and honors for her recordings and human rights achievements around the globe, the symmetry of Joan‚Äôs decision reverberates. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm looking forward to being on the road with a beautiful new album about which I am truly proud,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúI welcome the opportunity to share this new music as well as longtime favorites with my audiences around the world.‚Äù

Hot Tuna at The State Theatre of Ithaca

Thursday, September 27, 2018

8:00PM

State Theatre of Ithaca

Ithaca, NY

9
773108312881744

Hot Tuna at The State Theatre of Ithaca

Thursday, September 27, 2018 8:00PM

DSP Shows Presents: Hot Tuna at The State Theatre of Ithaca Thursday, September 27th 8pm Show :: 7pm Doors Tickets on sale March 2nd at 10am! Hot Tuna, Jorma Kaukonen and Jack Casady, perform with a well-honed and solid power ‚Äì always in the groove from their years of experience and mutual inspiration. Started as a side project during Jefferson Airplane days, the constant, the very definition of Hot Tuna, has always been Jorma Kaukonen and Jack Casady. The two boyhood pals have never wavered in one of the most enduring friendships in Rock history. From their days playing together as teenagers in the Washington, DC area, through years of inventive Psylodelic rock in San Francisco (1996 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame Inductees), to their current acoustic and electric blues sound, no one has more consistently led American music for the last 50 years than Jorma Kaukonen and Jack Casady, the founders and continuing core members of Hot Tuna. At the 2016 Grammys, Jorma Kaukonen and Jack Casady were honored with Lifetime Achievement Awards.

In 2013, she made her late night stand up debut on TBS‚Äôs Conan and was one of the breakout New Faces at the prestigious Just For Laughs Festival in Montreal. Her TV writing credits include Late Night with Seth Meyers as well as being a regular correspondent/writer on FX‚Äôs Totally Biased with W. Kamau Bell. She is also an alumna of the NBC Stand Up for Diversity program and currently headlines throughout the world and has been seen at a number of festivals including Comedy Central‚Äôs Clusterfest, Portland‚Äôs Bridgetown Comedy Festival, Moontower, SF Sketchfest, DC‚Äôs Bentzen Ball, Outside Lands, Bonnaroo and Dublin‚Äôs Vodaphone Comedy Festival. Her debut album Just Putting It Out There was released in July 2016 by Tig Notaro‚Äôs label Bentzen Ball Records and hit the #4 on Billboard Comedy Charts. -- General admission seated show.
